englishText: Hadith.5059 - Abbad bin Kathir Al-Basri narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said: "For mukatab slaves (contracted for emancipation), if they commit fornication, they are to be lashed in proportion to what they have paid towards their emancipation with the punishment of a free person, and for the remaining portion, they are lashed with the punishment of a slave."
arabicText: 5059 - وَ رَوَى عَبَّادُ بْنُ كَثِيرٍ اَلْبَصْرِيُّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "فِي اَلْمُكَاتَبَيْنِ إِذَا فَجَرَا يُضْرَبَانِ مِنَ اَلْحَدِّ بِقَدْرِ مَا أَدَّيَا مِنْ مُكَاتَبَتِهِمَا حَدَّ اَلْحُرِّ وَ يُضْرَبَانِ اَلْبَاقِيَ حَدَّ اَلْمَمْلُوكِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5059 - Abbad bin Kathir Al-Basri narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "For mukatab slaves (contracted for emancipation), if they commit fornication, they are to be lashed in proportion to what they have paid towards their emancipation with the punishment of a free person, and for the remaining portion, they are lashed with the punishment of a slave."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Intercourse with an Animal
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5060 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrated from Ishaq bin Jarir from Sadeer from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) was asked about a man who engages in intercourse with an animal.
Imam (as) said: "He is to be lashed with a punishment less than the prescribed limit and must compensate the owner for the value of the animal because he has corrupted it for him.
If it is an animal whose meat is consumed, it must be slaughtered, burned, and buried.
If it is an animal that is ridden, he must pay its value, be lashed with a punishment less than the prescribed limit, and take it out of the city where he committed the act to another land where it is not known, and sell it there so that he is not disgraced by it."
arabicText: 5060 - رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ جَرِيرٍ عَنْ سَدِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَأْتِي اَلْبَهِيمَةَ قَالَ "يُجْلَدُ دُونَ اَلْحَدِّ وَ يُغْرَمُ قِيمَةَ اَلْبَهِيمَةِ لِصَاحِبِهَا لِأَنَّهُ أَفْسَدَهَا عَلَيْهِ وَ تُذْبَحُ وَ تُحْرَقُ وَ تُدْفَنُ إِنْ كَانَ مِمَّا يُؤْكَلُ لَحْمُهُ وَ إِنْ كَانَ مِمَّا يُرْكَبُ ظَهْرُهُ أُغْرِمَ قِيمَتَهَا وَ جُلِدَ دُونَ اَلْحَدِّ وَ أَخْرَجَهَا مِنَ اَلْمَدِينَةِ اَلَّتِي فَعَلَ ذَلِكَ بِهَا إِلَى بِلاَدٍ أُخْرَى حَيْثُ لاَ تُعْرَفُ فَيَبِيعُهَا فِيهَا كَيْ لاَ يُعَيَّرَ بِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5060 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrated from Ishaq bin Jarir from Sadeer from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) was asked about a man who engages in intercourse with an animal.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "He is to be lashed with a punishment less than the prescribed limit and must compensate the owner for the value of the animal because he has corrupted it for him.
If it is an animal whose meat is consumed, it must be slaughtered, burned, and buried.
If it is an animal that is ridden, he must pay its value, be lashed with a punishment less than the prescribed limit, and take it out of the city where he committed the act to another land where it is not known, and sell it there so that he is not disgraced by it."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for a Procurer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5061 - Ibrahim bin Hashim narrated from Salih bin Al-Sindi from Muhammad bin Sulayman Al-Basri from Abdullah bin Sinan.
He said: I said to Abu Abdullah (as), "Inform me about the qawwad (panderer), what is his prescribed punishment?"
The Imam (as) replied: "There is no hadd (fixed legal punishment) on the qawwad. is he not merely receiving payment for facilitating?"
I said: "May I be your ransom, but he is bringing together a man and a woman unlawfully."
Imam (as) said: "That is the one who arranges unlawful meetings between a man and a woman."
I said: "Yes, that is the case, may I be your ransom."
Imam (as) said: "He is to be lashed three-quarters of the punishment of a fornicator - seventy-five lashes - and he is to be exiled from the city in which he resides."
arabicText: 5061 - رَوَى إِبْرَاهِيمُ بْنُ هَاشِمٍ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ اَلسِّنْدِيِّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ اَلْبَصْرِيِّ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ ع أَخْبِرْنِي عَنِ اَلْقَوَّادِ مَا حَدُّهُ قَالَ "لاَ حَدَّ عَلَى اَلْقَوَّادِ أَ لَيْسَ إِنَّمَا يُعْطَى اَلْأَجْرَ عَلَى أَنْ يَقُودَ" قُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ إِنَّمَا يَجْمَعُ بَيْنَ اَلذَّكَرِ وَ اَلْأُنْثَى حَرَاماً قَالَ "ذَاكَ اَلْمُؤَلِّفُ بَيْنَ اَلذَّكَرِ وَ اَلْأُنْثَى حَرَاماً" فَقُلْتُ هُوَ ذَاكَ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ قَالَ "يُضْرَبُ ثَلاَثَةَ أَرْبَاعِ حَدِّ اَلزَّانِي خَمْسَةً وَ سَبْعِينَ سَوْطاً وَ يُنْفَى مِنَ اَلْمِصْرِ اَلَّذِي هُوَ فِيهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5061 - Ibrahim bin Hashim narrated from Salih bin Al-Sindi from Muhammad bin Sulayman Al-Basri from Abdullah bin Sinan.
thaqalaynMatn:
He said: I said to Abu Abdullah (as), "Inform me about the qawwad (panderer), what is his prescribed punishment?"
The Imam (as) replied: "There is no hadd (fixed legal punishment) on the qawwad. is he not merely receiving payment for facilitating?"
I said: "May I be your ransom, but he is bringing together a man and a woman unlawfully."
Imam (as) said: "That is the one who arranges unlawful meetings between a man and a woman."
I said: "Yes, that is the case, may I be your ransom."
Imam (as) said: "He is to be lashed three-quarters of the punishment of a fornicator - seventy-five lashes - and he is to be exiled from the city in which he resides."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for a Procurer
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5062 - In a narration: The Messenger of Allah (swt) cursed Al-wasilah and Al-muṭasilah.
arabicText: 5062 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ: لَعَنَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ اَلْوَاصِلَةَ وَ اَلْمُوتَصِلَةَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5062 - In a narration:
thaqalaynMatn: The Messenger of Allah (swt) cursed Al-wasilah and Al-muṭasilah.

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5063 - Al-Alaa narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) regarding a man who accuses his wife (of adultery).
Imam (as) said: "He is to be flogged."
I asked: "What if she pardons him?"
Imam (as) said: "No, and no honor (for him)."
arabicText: 5063 - رَوَى اَلْعَلاَءُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلَّذِي يَقْذِفُ اِمْرَأَتَهُ قَالَ "يُجْلَدُ" قُلْتُ أَ رَأَيْتَ إِنْ عَفَتْ عَنْهُ قَالَ "لاَ وَ لاَ كَرَامَةَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5063 - Al-Alaa narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) regarding a man who accuses his wife (of adultery).
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "He is to be flogged."
I asked: "What if she pardons him?"
Imam (as) said: "No, and no honor (for him)."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5064 - Ibn Mahbub narrated from Hammad ibn Ziyad from Sulayman ibn Khalid from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who said to his wife after consummating the marriage, "I did not find you a virgin"
Imam (as) said: "There is no legal punishment upon him."
arabicText: 5064 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ قَالَ لاِمْرَأَتِهِ بَعْدَ مَا دَخَلَتْ عَلَيْهِ لَمْ أَجِدْكِ عَذْرَاءَ قَالَ "لاَ حَدَّ عَلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5064 - Ibn Mahbub narrated from Hammad ibn Ziyad from Sulayman ibn Khalid from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who said to his wife after consummating the marriage, "I did not find you a virgin"
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no legal punishment upon him."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5065 - In another narration, Imam (as) said: "Indeed, the hymen may be lost without intercourse; it can be lost due to injury, stumbling, or falling."
arabicText: 5065 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ قَالَ: "إِنَّ اَلْعُذْرَةَ قَدْ تَسْقُطُ مِنْ غَيْرِ جِمَاعٍ قَدْ تَذْهَبُ بِالنَّكْبَةِ وَ اَلْعَثْرَةِ وَ اَلسَّقْطَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5065 - In another narration, Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, the hymen may be lost without intercourse; it can be lost due to injury, stumbling, or falling."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5066 - In the narration of Wahb ibn Wahb from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
"Indeed, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) would not administer the legal punishment for insinuation unless it was a clear and explicit accusation, such as saying, 'O' adulterer,' or 'O' son of an adulteress,' or 'You are not your father's son.'"
arabicText: 5066 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ وَهْبِ بْنِ وَهْبٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "أَنَّ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ لَمْ يَكُنْ يَحُدُّ فِي اَلتَّعْرِيضِ حَتَّى يَأْتِيَ بِالْفِرْيَةِ اَلْمُصَرَّحَةِ مِثْلِ يَا زَانِ وَ يَا اِبْنَ اَلزَّانِيَةِ أَوْ لَسْتَ لِأَبِيكَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5066 - In the narration of Wahb ibn Wahb from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) would not administer the legal punishment for insinuation unless it was a clear and explicit accusation, such as saying, 'O' adulterer,' or 'O' son of an adulteress,' or 'You are not your father's son.'"

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5067 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abbad ibn Suhayb who said: Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a Christian who accused a Muslim by saying to him, "O' adulterer."
Imam (as) said: "He is to be flogged eighty lashes for violating the right of the Muslim and eighty lashes minus one for violating the sanctity of Islam. His head is to be shaved, and he is to be paraded among the people of his religion so that others may be deterred."
arabicText: 5067 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبَّادِ بْنِ صُهَيْبٍ قَالَ: سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ نَصْرَانِيٍّ قَذَفَ مُسْلِماً فَقَالَ لَهُ يَا زَانِ قَالَ "يُجْلَدُ ثَمَانِينَ جَلْدَةً لِحَقِّ اَلْمُسْلِمِ وَ ثَمَانِينَ جَلْدَةً إِلاَّ سَوْطاً لِحُرْمَةِ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ وَ يُحْلَقُ رَأْسُهُ وَ يُطَافُ بِهِ فِي أَهْلِ دِينِهِ لِكَيْ يُنَكَّلَ غَيْرُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5067 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abbad ibn Suhayb who said: Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a Christian who accused a Muslim by saying to him, "O' adulterer."
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "He is to be flogged eighty lashes for violating the right of the Muslim and eighty lashes minus one for violating the sanctity of Islam. His head is to be shaved, and he is to be paraded among the people of his religion so that others may be deterred."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5068 - It was narrated from Safwan from Abu Bakr Al-Hadrami from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: I asked Imam (as) about a man who slanders a man from the pre-Islamic Arabs.
Imam (as) said: "He is to be given the legal punishment."
I asked: "Is he to be given the legal punishment?"
He said: "Yes, because that offense reaches the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family)."
arabicText: 5068 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَكْرٍ اَلْحَضْرَمِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ يَفْتَرِي عَلَى رَجُلٍ مِنْ جَاهِلِيَّةِ اَلْعَرَبِ قَالَ "يُضْرَبُ حَدّاً" قُلْتُ يُضْرَبُ حَدّاً قَالَ "نَعَمْ إِنَّ ذَلِكَ يَدْخُلُ عَلَى رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5068 - It was narrated from Safwan from Abu Bakr Al-Hadrami from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who slanders a man from the pre-Islamic Arabs.
Imam (as) said: "He is to be given the legal punishment."
I asked: "Is he to be given the legal punishment?"
He said: "Yes, because that offense reaches the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family)."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5069 - Ja'far ibn Bashir narrated from Al-Husayn ibn Abi Al-'Ala from Abu Makhlad Al-Sarraj from Abu Abdullah (as): Imam (as) ruled concerning a man who called another "the son of a madman," and the other replied to him, "Rather, you are the son of a madman."
Imam (as) commanded the first man to flog his companion twenty lashes and said: "Know that you will also be given twenty lashes in return."
After the first man flogged him, the flogged man was given the whip and he flogged the first man twenty lashes as a means of punishment to discipline both of them.
arabicText: 5069 - وَ رَوَى جَعْفَرُ بْنُ بَشِيرٍ عَنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ أَبِي اَلْعَلاَءِ عَنْ أَبِي مَخْلَدٍ اَلسَّرَّاجِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ قَضَى فِي رَجُلٍ دَعَا آخَرَ اِبْنَ اَلْمَجْنُونِ وَ قَالَ اَلْآخَرُ لَهُ بَلْ أَنْتَ اِبْنُ اَلْمَجْنُونِ فَأَمَرَ اَلْأَوَّلَ أَنْ يَجْلِدَ صَاحِبَهُ عِشْرِينَ جَلْدَةً وَ قَالَ "اِعْلَمْ أَنَّهُ سَتُعَقَّبُ مِثْلَهَا عِشْرِينَ فَلَمَّا جَلَدَهُ أَعْطَى اَلْمَجْلُودَ اَلسَّوْطَ فَجَلَدَهُ عِشْرِينَ نَكَالاً يُنَكِّلُهُمَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5069 - Ja'far ibn Bashir narrated from Al-Husayn ibn Abi Al-'Ala from Abu Makhlad Al-Sarraj from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) ruled concerning a man who called another "the son of a madman," and the other replied to him, "Rather, you are the son of a madman."
Imam (as) commanded the first man to flog his companion twenty lashes and said: "Know that you will also be given twenty lashes in return."
After the first man flogged him, the flogged man was given the whip and he flogged the first man twenty lashes as a means of punishment to discipline both of them.

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5070 - Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Hilal narrated from Uqbah ibn Khalid from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: I asked Imam (as) about a man who said to his wife, "O' adulteress."
Imam (as) said: "He is to be given the legal punishment and they are to be separated after he has been flogged, and she will no longer be his wife."
Imam (as) further said: "But if he said something that slipped out unintentionally without having any knowledge of it, intending only to anger her, then they are not to be separated."
arabicText: 5070 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ هِلاَلٍ عَنْ عُقْبَةَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَالَ لاِمْرَأَتِهِ يَا زَانِيَةُ قَالَ "يُجْلَدُ حَدّاً وَ يُفَرَّقُ بَيْنَهُمَا بَعْدَ مَا جُلِدَ وَ لاَ تَكُونُ اِمْرَأَتَهُ" قَالَ "وَ إِنْ كَانَ قَالَ كَلاَماً أَفْلَتَ مِنْهُ فِي غَيْرِ أَنْ يَعْلَمَ شَيْئاً أَرَادَ أَنْ يَغِيظَهَا بِهِ فَلاَ يُفَرَّقُ بَيْنَهُمَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5070 - Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Hilal narrated from Uqbah ibn Khalid from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who said to his wife, "O' adulteress."
Imam (as) said: "He is to be given the legal punishment and they are to be separated after he has been flogged, and she will no longer be his wife."
Imam (as) further said: "But if he said something that slipped out unintentionally without having any knowledge of it, intending only to anger her, then they are not to be separated."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5071 - Commander of the Faithful (as) said: "If there is doubt expressed with 'perhaps' or 'it may be' in enforcing a legal punishment, then the punishment is to be suspended."
arabicText: 5071 - وَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِذَا كَانَ فِي اَلْحَدِّ لَعَلَّ أَوْ عَسَى فَالْحَدُّ مُعَطَّلٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5071 - Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If there is doubt expressed with 'perhaps' or 'it may be' in enforcing a legal punishment, then the punishment is to be suspended."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5072 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "The one who accuses a foundling (laqiṭ) of fornication is subjected to the prescribed punishment (hadd). And if a woman accuses her husband of fornication while he is deaf, they are separated, and she is never permissible for him again."
arabicText: 5072 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "قَاذِفُ اَللَّقِيطِ يُحَدُّ وَ اَلْمَرْأَةُ إِذَا قَذَفَتْ زَوْجَهَا وَ هُوَ أَصَمُّ يُفَرَّقُ بَيْنَهُمَا ثُمَّ لاَ تَحِلُّ لَهُ أَبَداً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5072 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The one who accuses a foundling (laqiṭ) of fornication is subjected to the prescribed punishment (hadd). And if a woman accuses her husband of fornication while he is deaf, they are separated, and she is never permissible for him again."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5073 - Ibn Mahbub narrated from Hisham ibn Salim from Abu Basir who said:
Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a man who accused his wife of adultery while she was mute and deaf, unable to hear what he said.
Imam (as) said: "If she has witnesses who testify on her behalf before the Imam, he (the husband) is to be flogged with the legal punishment and they are to be separated, and she will never be permissible for him again. But if she has no witnesses, then she is forbidden to him as long as she remains with him, and there is no sin upon her from him."
arabicText: 5073 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ: سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَذَفَ اِمْرَأَتَهُ بِالزِّنَا وَ هِيَ خَرْسَاءُ صَمَّاءُ لاَ تَسْمَعُ مَا قَالَ فَقَالَ "إِنْ كَانَ لَهَا بَيِّنَةٌ يَشْهَدُونَ لَهَا عِنْدَ اَلْإِمَامِ جَلَدَهُ اَلْحَدَّ وَ فَرَّقَ بَيْنَهُمَا ثُمَّ لاَ تَحِلُّ لَهُ أَبَداً وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهَا بَيِّنَةٌ فَهِيَ حَرَامٌ عَلَيْهِ مَا أَقَامَ مَعَهَا وَ لاَ إِثْمَ عَلَيْهَا مِنْهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5073 - Ibn Mahbub narrated from Hisham ibn Salim from Abu Basir who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a man who accused his wife of adultery while she was mute and deaf, unable to hear what he said.
Imam (as) said: "If she has witnesses who testify on her behalf before the Imam, he (the husband) is to be flogged with the legal punishment and they are to be separated, and she will never be permissible for him again. But if she has no witnesses, then she is forbidden to him as long as she remains with him, and there is no sin upon her from him."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5074 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Whoever acknowledges a child and then denies him is to be given the legal punishment and held responsible for the child."
arabicText: 5074 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ أَنَّ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "مَنْ أَقَرَّ بِوَلَدٍ ثُمَّ نَفَاهُ جُلِدَ اَلْحَدَّ وَ أُلْزِمَ اَلْوَلَدَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5074 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever acknowledges a child and then denies him is to be given the legal punishment and held responsible for the child."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5075 - In the narration of Yunus ibn Abd Al-Rahman from some of his narrators from Abu Abdullah (as), he said: "Every adult, whether male or female, who falsely accuses a minor or an adult, a male or a female, a Muslim, a free person, or a slave, is subject to the prescribed punishment (hadd Al-firya).
And for one who is not yet an adult, the punishment is disciplinary (hadd Al-adab)."
arabicText: 5075 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ يُونُسَ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ عَنْ بَعْضِ رِجَالِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "كُلُّ بَالِغٍ مِنْ ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنْثَى اِفْتَرَى عَلَى صَغِيرٍ أَوْ كَبِيرٍ أَوْ ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنْثَى أَوْ مُسْلِمٍ أَوْ حُرٍّ أَوْ مَمْلُوكٍ فَعَلَيْهِ حَدُّ اَلْفِرْيَةِ وَ عَلَى غَيْرِ اَلْبَالِغِ حَدُّ اَلْأَدَبِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5075 - In the narration of Yunus ibn Abd Al-Rahman from some of his narrators from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Every adult, whether male or female, who falsely accuses a minor or an adult, a male or a female, a Muslim, a free person, or a slave, is subject to the prescribed punishment (hadd Al-firya).
And for one who is not yet an adult, the punishment is disciplinary (hadd Al-adab)."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5076 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"There is no legal punishment upon a mad person until they regain sanity, nor upon a child until they reach maturity, nor upon a sleeping person until they wake up."
arabicText: 5076 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ حَدَّ عَلَى مَجْنُونٍ حَتَّى يُفِيقَ وَ لاَ عَلَى اَلصَّبِيِّ حَتَّى يُدْرِكَ وَ لاَ عَلَى اَلنَّائِمِ حَتَّى يَسْتَيْقِظَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5076 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no legal punishment upon a mad person until they regain sanity, nor upon a child until they reach maturity, nor upon a sleeping person until they wake up."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5077 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Al-Ala and Abu Ayyub from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) regarding a man who said to his wife, "O' adulteress, I have committed adultery with you,"
Imam (as) said: "He is liable for one legal punishment for accusing her. As for his statement, 'I have committed adultery with you,' there is no legal punishment for that unless he testifies against himself four times for committing adultery before the Imam."
arabicText: 5077 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ اَلْعَلاَءِ وَ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ قَالَ لاِمْرَأَتِهِ يَا زَانِيَةُ أَنَا زَنَيْتُ بِكِ قَالَ "عَلَيْهِ حَدٌّ وَاحِدٌ لِقَذْفِهِ إِيَّاهَا وَ أَمَّا قَوْلُهُ أَنَا زَنَيْتُ بِكِ فَلاَ حَدَّ عَلَيْهِ فِيهِ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَشْهَدَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ أَرْبَعَ مَرَّاتٍ بِالزِّنَا عِنْدَ اَلْإِمَامِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5077 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Al-Ala and Abu Ayyub from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) regarding a man who said to his wife, "O' adulteress, I have committed adultery with you,"
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "He is liable for one legal punishment for accusing her. As for his statement, 'I have committed adultery with you,' there is no legal punishment for that unless he testifies against himself four times for committing adultery before the Imam."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5078 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Nu'aym ibn Ibrahim from Misma Abu Sayyar from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding four people who testified against a woman for adultery, and one of them was her husband.
Imam (as) said: "The three (other witnesses) are to be flogged, and her husband is to perform lian (mutual cursing) with her. They are to be separated, and she will never be permissible for him again."
arabicText: 5078 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ نُعَيْمِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مِسْمَعٍ أَبِي سَيَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي أَرْبَعَةٍ شَهِدُوا عَلَى اِمْرَأَةٍ بِالْفُجُورِ أَحَدُهُمْ زَوْجُهَا قَالَ "يُجْلَدُونَ اَلثَّلاَثَةُ وَ يُلاَعِنُهَا زَوْجُهَا وَ يُفَرَّقُ بَيْنَهُمَا وَ لاَ تَحِلُّ لَهُ أَبَداً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5078 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Nu'aym ibn Ibrahim from Misma Abu Sayyar from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding four people who testified against a woman for adultery, and one of them was her husband.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "The three (other witnesses) are to be flogged, and her husband is to perform lian (mutual cursing) with her. They are to be separated, and she will never be permissible for him again."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5079 - It has been narrated: "Indeed, the husband is considered one of the witnesses."
arabicText: 5079 - وَ قَدْ رُوِيَ: "أَنَّ اَلزَّوْجَ أَحَدُ اَلشُّهُودِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5079 - It has been narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, the husband is considered one of the witnesses."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5080 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abd Al-Rahman from Ubayd ibn Zurarah who said: I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say, "If a man were brought to me who had accused a Muslim slave of adultery, and we knew nothing about the slave except goodness, I would administer the legal punishment upon him - the same punishment as for a free person, except one lash less."
arabicText: 5080 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ عَنْ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ: "لَوْ أُتِيتُ بِرَجُلٍ قَدْ قَذَفَ عَبْداً مُسْلِماً بِالزِّنَا لاَ نَعْلَمُ مِنْهُ إِلاَّ خَيْراً لَضَرَبْتُهُ اَلْحَدَّ حَدَّ اَلْحُرِّ إِلاَّ سَوْطاً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5080 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abd Al-Rahman from Ubayd ibn Zurarah who said:
thaqalaynMatn: I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say, "If a man were brought to me who had accused a Muslim slave of adultery, and we knew nothing about the slave except goodness, I would administer the legal punishment upon him - the same punishment as for a free person, except one lash less."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5081 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Hammad ibn Ziyad from Sulayman ibn Khalid from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
"Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) was asked about a mukatab (a slave who has a contract for freedom) who falsely accused a Muslim man.
Imam (as) said: 'He is to be flogged with the punishment of a free man - eighty lashes - whether he has paid any part of his contract or not.'
It was asked: 'What if he commits adultery while he is a mukatab and has not paid anything from his contract?'
Imam (as) said: 'This is the right of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic. Fifty lashes are waived from him, and he is to be flogged fifty lashes.'"
arabicText: 5081 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "سُئِلَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ مُكَاتَبٍ اِفْتَرَى عَلَى رَجُلٍ مُسْلِمٍ فَقَالَ "يُضْرَبُ حَدَّ اَلْحُرِّ ثَمَانِينَ جَلْدَةً أَدَّى مِنْ مُكَاتَبَتِهِ شَيْئاً أَوْ لَمْ يُؤَدِّ" قِيلَ لَهُ فَإِنْ زَنَى وَ هُوَ مُكَاتَبٌ وَ لَمْ يُؤَدِّ مِنْ مُكَاتَبَتِهِ شَيْئاً قَالَ "هَذَا حَقُّ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يُطْرَحُ عَنْهُ خَمْسُونَ جَلْدَةً وَ يُضْرَبُ خَمْسِينَ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5081 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Hammad ibn Ziyad from Sulayman ibn Khalid from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) was asked about a mukatab (a slave who has a contract for freedom) who falsely accused a Muslim man.
Imam (as) said: 'He is to be flogged with the punishment of a free man - eighty lashes - whether he has paid any part of his contract or not.'
It was asked: 'What if he commits adultery while he is a mukatab and has not paid anything from his contract?'
Imam (as) said: 'This is the right of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic. Fifty lashes are waived from him, and he is to be flogged fifty lashes.'"

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5082 - Ibn Mahbub narrated from Malik ibn Atiyyah from Abu Basir from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a woman who accused a man (of adultery).
Imam (as) said: "She is to be flogged eighty lashes."
arabicText: 5082 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ مَالِكِ بْنِ عَطِيَّةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ [عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ خ ل] عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اِمْرَأَةٍ قَذَفَتْ رَجُلاً قَالَ "تُجْلَدُ ثَمَانِينَ جَلْدَةً".

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5083 - Muhammad ibn Sinan narrated from Al-Ala ibn Al-Fudayl from Abu Abdullah (as):
I asked Imam (as) about a man who denies his child after having acknowledged him.
Imam (as) said: "If the child is from a free woman, the father is to be flogged fifty lashes, which is the punishment for a slave. But if the child is from a slave woman, there is no punishment upon him."
And if a man says to another man: "You commit the act of the people of Lut (engaging in relations with men)," he is to be flogged eighty lashes.
Similarly, if he says to him: "O' effeminate one" or "O' one who is penetrated," he is to be flogged with the legal punishment for slander - eighty lashes.
If a man slanders a group of people with a single statement without naming them individually, he is subjected to one legal punishment. However, if he names them specifically, then a separate legal punishment applies to each person he named.
This was narrated by Burayd Al-Ijli from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as).
It has also been narrated: "If they (the slandered individuals) come forward separately, each one of them receives a separate punishment. But if they come forward collectively, only one punishment is administered.
If a man slanders another and is flogged, but then repeats the slander, and if he says, 'What I said to you is true,' he is not flogged again.
However, if he accuses him of adultery again after being flogged, the legal punishment applies. Yet, if he accuses him ten times before being flogged, only one punishment will be administered."
arabicText:
5083 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنِ اَلْعَلاَءِ بْنِ اَلْفُضَيْلِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لَهُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَنْتَفِي مِنْ وَلَدِهِ وَ قَدْ أَقَرَّ بِهِ قَالَ "إِنْ كَانَ اَلْوَلَدُ مِنْ حُرَّةٍ جُلِدَ اَلْأَبُ خَمْسِينَ سَوْطاً حَدَّ اَلْمَمْلُوكِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ مِنْ أَمَةٍ فَلاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهِ".
وَ إِذَا قَالَ رَجُلٌ لِرَجُلٍ إِنَّكَ تَعْمَلُ عَمَلَ قَوْمِ لُوطٍ تَنْكِحُ اَلرِّجَالَ ضُرِبَ ثَمَانِينَ جَلْدَةً وَ كَذَلِكَ إِنْ قَالَ لَهُ يَا مَعْفُوجُ يَا مَنْكُوحُ جُلِدَ حَدَّ اَلْقَاذِفِ ثَمَانِينَ جَلْدَةً وَ إِنْ قَذَفَ رَجُلٌ قَوْماً بِكَلِمَةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ فَعَلَيْهِ حَدٌّ وَاحِدٌ إِذَا لَمْ يُسَمِّهِمْ بِأَسْمَائِهِمْ وَ إِنْ سَمَّاهُمْ فَعَلَيْهِ لِكُلِّ رَجُلٍ سَمَّاهُ حَدٌّ رَوَى ذَلِكَ بُرَيْدٌ اَلْعِجْلِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ.
وَ رُوِيَ:
"أَنَّهُمْ إِنْ أَتَوْا بِهِ مُتَفَرِّقِينَ ضُرِبَ لِكُلِّ رَجُلٍ مِنْهُمْ حَدّاً وَاحِداً وَ إِنْ أَتَوْا بِهِ مُجْتَمِعِينَ ضُرِبَ حَدّاً وَاحِداً وَ إِنْ قَذَفَ رَجُلٌ رَجُلاً فَجُلِدَ ثُمَّ عَادَ عَلَيْهِ بِالْقَذْفِ فَإِنْ كَانَ قَالَ إِنَّ اَلَّذِي قُلْتُ لَكَ حَقٌّ لَمْ يُجْلَدْ وَ إِنْ قَذَفَهُ بِالزِّنَا بَعْدَ مَا جُلِدَ فَعَلَيْهِ اَلْحَدُّ وَ إِنْ قَذَفَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يُجْلَدَ بِعَشْرِ قَذَفَاتٍ لَمْ يَكُنْ عَلَيْهِ إِلاَّ حَدٌّ وَاحِدٌ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5083 - Muhammad ibn Sinan narrated from Al-Ala ibn Al-Fudayl from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who denies his child after having acknowledged him.
Imam (as) said: "If the child is from a free woman, the father is to be flogged fifty lashes, which is the punishment for a slave. But if the child is from a slave woman, there is no punishment upon him."
And if a man says to another man: "You commit the act of the people of Lut (engaging in relations with men)," he is to be flogged eighty lashes.
Similarly, if he says to him: "O' effeminate one" or "O' one who is penetrated," he is to be flogged with the legal punishment for slander - eighty lashes.
If a man slanders a group of people with a single statement without naming them individually, he is subjected to one legal punishment. However, if he names them specifically, then a separate legal punishment applies to each person he named.
This was narrated by Burayd Al-Ijli from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as).
It has also been narrated: "If they (the slandered individuals) come forward separately, each one of them receives a separate punishment. But if they come forward collectively, only one punishment is administered.
If a man slanders another and is flogged, but then repeats the slander, and if he says, 'What I said to you is true,' he is not flogged again.
However, if he accuses him of adultery again after being flogged, the legal punishment applies. Yet, if he accuses him ten times before being flogged, only one punishment will be administered."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5085 - Hisham ibn Salim narrated from Ammar Al-Sabati from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who said to another man, "O' son of an adulteress," intending adultery.
Imam (as) said: "If his mother is alive and present, and she comes forward to claim her right, the accuser is to be flogged eighty lashes.
If she is absent, it is to be delayed until she returns and claims her right.
And if she has passed away and nothing is known of her except goodness, the one who falsely accused her is to be given the legal punishment - eighty lashes."
arabicText:
5085 - وَ رَوَى هِشَامُ بْنُ سَالِمٍ عَنْ عَمَّارٍ اَلسَّابَاطِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ :
فِي رَجُلٍ قَالَ لِرَجُلٍ يَا اِبْنَ اَلْفَاعِلَةِ يَعْنِي اَلزِّنَا فَقَالَ "إِنْ كَانَتْ أُمُّهُ حَيَّةً شَاهِدَةً ثُمَّ جَاءَتْ تَطْلُبُ حَقَّهَا ضُرِبَ ثَمَانِينَ جَلْدَةً وَ إِنْ كَانَتْ غَائِبَةً اُنْتُظِرَ بِهَا حَتَّى تَقْدَمَ فَتَطْلُبَ حَقَّهَا وَ إِنْ كَانَتْ قَدْ مَاتَتْ وَ لَمْ يُعْلَمْ مِنْهَا إِلاَّ خَيْرٌ ضُرِبَ اَلْمُفْتَرِي عَلَيْهَا اَلْحَدَّ ثَمَانِينَ جَلْدَةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5085 - Hisham ibn Salim narrated from Ammar Al-Sabati from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who said to another man, "O' son of an adulteress," intending adultery.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "If his mother is alive and present, and she comes forward to claim her right, the accuser is to be flogged eighty lashes.
If she is absent, it is to be delayed until she returns and claims her right.
And if she has passed away and nothing is known of her except goodness, the one who falsely accused her is to be given the legal punishment - eighty lashes."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5086 - Abu Ayyub narrated from Hariz from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man falsely accusing the son of a woman whose rights were violated (Al-maghsubah) by saying to him, "O' son of an adulteress."
Imam (as) said: "I believe he deserves the legal punishment of eighty lashes and must repent to Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, for what he has said."
arabicText: 5086 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو أَيُّوبَ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ ع قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اِبْنِ اَلْمَغْصُوبَةِ يَفْتَرِي عَلَيْهِ اَلرَّجُلُ فَيَقُولُ لَهُ يَا اِبْنَ اَلْفَاعِلَةِ فَقَالَ "أَرَى عَلَيْهِ اَلْحَدَّ ثَمَانِينَ جَلْدَةً وَ يَتُوبُ إِلَى اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِمَّا قَالَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5086 - Abu Ayyub narrated from Hariz from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man falsely accusing the son of a woman whose rights were violated (Al-maghsubah) by saying to him,
thaqalaynMatn:
"O' son of an adulteress."
Imam (as) said: "I believe he deserves the legal punishment of eighty lashes and must repent to Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, for what he has said."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Slanderous Accusation
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5087 - It was narrated from Abu Walad Al-Hannat that he said:
Abu Abdullah (as) said: "Commander of the Faithful (as) was presented with two men, each of whom had accused the other of something concerning his body.
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) waived the legal punishment for both of them and administered disciplinary punishment (ta'zir) to them."
arabicText: 5087 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي وَلاَّدٍ اَلْحَنَّاطِ أَنَّهُ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "أُتِيَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بِرَجُلَيْنِ قَدْ قَذَفَ كُلُّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمَا صَاحِبَهُ فِي بَدَنِهِ فَدَرَأَ عَنْهُمَا اَلْحَدَّ وَ عَزَّرَهُمَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5087 - It was narrated from Abu Walad Al-Hannat that he said:
Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Commander of the Faithful (as) was presented with two men, each of whom had accused the other of something concerning his body.
Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) waived the legal punishment for both of them and administered disciplinary punishment (ta'zir) to them."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Drinking Alcohol and Reports Regarding Singing and Amusements
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5088 - Al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
"If a man entered Islam, acknowledged it, and then drank alcohol, committed adultery, and consumed usury, without having any knowledge of what is lawful and unlawful, I would not administer the legal punishment upon him if he was ignorant - unless there was evidence that he had recited the Surah in which adultery, alcohol, and usury are mentioned. If he was unaware of that, I would inform and educate him. But if he committed those acts after that, I would flog him and enforce the legal punishment upon him."
arabicText: 5088 - رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: "لَوْ أَنَّ رَجُلاً دَخَلَ فِي اَلْإِسْلاَمِ فَأَقَرَّ بِهِ ثُمَّ شَرِبَ اَلْخَمْرَ وَ زَنَى وَ أَكَلَ اَلرِّبَا وَ لَمْ يَتَبَيَّنْ لَهُ شَيْءٌ مِنَ اَلْحَلاَلِ وَ اَلْحَرَامِ لَمْ أُقِمْ عَلَيْهِ اَلْحَدَّ إِذَا كَانَ جَاهِلاً إِلاَّ أَنْ تَقُومَ عَلَيْهِ اَلْبَيِّنَةُ أَنَّهُ قَرَأَ اَلسُّورَةَ اَلَّتِي فِيهَا اَلزِّنَا وَ اَلْخَمْرُ وَ أَكْلُ اَلرِّبَا وَ إِذَا جَهِلَ ذَلِكَ أَعْلَمْتُهُ وَ أَخْبَرْتُهُ فَإِنْ رَكِبَهُ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ جَلَدْتُهُ وَ أَقَمْتُ عَلَيْهِ اَلْحَدَّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5088 - Al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man entered Islam, acknowledged it, and then drank alcohol, committed adultery, and consumed usury, without having any knowledge of what is lawful and unlawful, I would not administer the legal punishment upon him if he was ignorant - unless there was evidence that he had recited the Surah in which adultery, alcohol, and usury are mentioned. If he was unaware of that, I would inform and educate him. But if he committed those acts after that, I would flog him and enforce the legal punishment upon him."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Drinking Alcohol and Reports Regarding Singing and Amusements
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5089 - In the narration of Amr ibn Shimr from Jabir, who attributed it to the Prophet: Commander of the Faithful (as) was presented with Al-Najashi Al-Harithiyy, the poet, who had consumed alcohol during the month of Ramadan.
Imam (as) flogged him eighty lashes, then imprisoned him for a night.
The next day, Imam (as) summoned him and flogged him with twenty more lashes.
Al-Najashi said: "O' Commander of the Faithful (as), you already flogged me eighty lashes for drinking alcohol. What are these additional twenty for?"
Imam (as) replied: "These are for your audacity in drinking alcohol during the month of Ramadan."
arabicText: 5089 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَمْرِو بْنِ شِمْرٍ عَنْ جَابِرٍ يَرْفَعُهُ: أَنَّ أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أُتِيَ بِالنَّجَاشِيِّ اَلْحَارِثِيِّ اَلشَّاعِرِ قَدْ شَرِبَ اَلْخَمْرَ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ فَضَرَبَهُ ثَمَانِينَ ثُمَّ حَبَسَهُ لَيْلَةً ثُمَّ دَعَا بِهِ مِنَ اَلْغَدِ فَضَرَبَهُ عِشْرِينَ سَوْطاً فَقَالَ يَا أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ضَرَبْتَنِي ثَمَانِينَ سَوْطاً فِي شُرْبِ اَلْخَمْرِ فَهَذِهِ اَلْعِشْرُونَ مَا هِيَ فَقَالَ "هَذَا لِجُرْأَتِكَ عَلَى شُرْبِ اَلْخَمْرِ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5089 - In the narration of Amr ibn Shimr from Jabir, who attributed it to the Prophet:
thaqalaynMatn:
Commander of the Faithful (as) was presented with Al-Najashi Al-Harithiyy, the poet, who had consumed alcohol during the month of Ramadan.
Imam (as) flogged him eighty lashes, then imprisoned him for a night.
The next day, Imam (as) summoned him and flogged him with twenty more lashes.
Al-Najashi said: "O' Commander of the Faithful (as), you already flogged me eighty lashes for drinking alcohol. What are these additional twenty for?"
Imam (as) replied: "These are for your audacity in drinking alcohol during the month of Ramadan."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Drinking Alcohol and Reports Regarding Singing and Amusements
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5090 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Do not sit with those who drink wine, for when the curse descends, it encompasses everyone present in the gathering."
arabicText: 5090 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ تُجَالِسُوا شُرَّابَ اَلْخَمْرِ فَإِنَّ اَللَّعْنَةَ إِذَا نَزَلَتْ عَمَّتْ مَنْ فِي اَلْمَجْلِسِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5090 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not sit with those who drink wine, for when the curse descends, it encompasses everyone present in the gathering."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Drinking Alcohol and Reports Regarding Singing and Amusements
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5091 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"If a wine drinker falls ill, do not visit him; if he dies, do not attend his funeral; if he testifies, do not accept his testimony; and if he seeks marriage from you, do not marry him off.
Whoever marries his daughter to a wine drinker, it is as if he has led her to adultery.
And whoever marries his daughter to someone who opposes his faith has severed her family ties. Whoever entrusts a wine drinker with something has no guarantee from Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted."
arabicText: 5091 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "شَارِبُ اَلْخَمْرِ إِنْ مَرِضَ فَلاَ تَعُودُوهُ وَ إِنْ مَاتَ فَلاَ تَشْهَدُوهُ وَ إِنْ شَهِدَ فَلاَ تُزَكُّوهُ وَ إِنْ خَطَبَ إِلَيْكُمْ فَلاَ تُزَوِّجُوهُ فَإِنَّ مَنْ زَوَّجَ اِبْنَتَهُ شَارِبَ اَلْخَمْرِ فَكَأَنَّمَا قَادَهَا إِلَى اَلزِّنَا وَ مَنْ زَوَّجَ اِبْنَتَهُ مُخَالِفاً لَهُ عَلَى دِينِهِ فَقَدْ قَطَعَ رَحِمَهَا وَ مَنِ اِئْتَمَنَ شَارِبَ اَلْخَمْرِ لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ عَلَى اَللَّهِ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى ضَمَانٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5091 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"If a wine drinker falls ill, do not visit him; if he dies, do not attend his funeral; if he testifies, do not accept his testimony; and if he seeks marriage from you, do not marry him off.
Whoever marries his daughter to a wine drinker, it is as if he has led her to adultery.
And whoever marries his daughter to someone who opposes his faith has severed her family ties. Whoever entrusts a wine drinker with something has no guarantee from Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Drinking Alcohol and Reports Regarding Singing and Amusements
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5092 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Five things from five are impossible: Honor from a transgressor is impossible, compassion from an enemy is impossible, sincere advice from a jealous person is impossible, loyalty from a woman is impossible, and awe from a poor person is impossible."
arabicText: 5092 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "خَمْسَةٌ مِنْ خَمْسَةٍ مُحَالٌ اَلْحُرْمَةُ مِنَ اَلْفَاسِقِ مُحَالٌ وَ اَلشَّفَقَةُ مِنَ اَلْعَدُوِّ مُحَالٌ وَ اَلنَّصِيحَةُ مِنَ اَلْحَاسِدِ مُحَالٌ وَ اَلْوَفَاءُ مِنَ اَلْمَرْأَةِ مُحَالٌ وَ اَلْهَيْبَةُ مِنَ اَلْفَقِيرِ مُحَالٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5092 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Five things from five are impossible: Honor from a transgressor is impossible, compassion from an enemy is impossible, sincere advice from a jealous person is impossible, loyalty from a woman is impossible, and awe from a poor person is impossible."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Drinking Alcohol and Reports Regarding Singing and Amusements
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5093 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic:
"So avoid the filth of idols and avoid false speech." (Surah Al-Hajj 22:30)
Imam (as) said: "The filth of idols refers to chess, and false speech refers to singing. And backgammon (nard) is worse than chess.
As for chess, adopting it is disbelief, playing it is polytheism, teaching it is a grave and destructive sin, greeting someone engaged in it is disobedience, and touching its pieces is like touching the flesh of swine. Looking at it is like looking at the private parts of one's mother.
The one who plays backgammon with gambling is like one who eats the flesh of swine, and the one who plays it without gambling is like one who places his hand in the flesh or blood of swine.
It is not permissible to play with rings, the fourteen stones, and similar games, as all of them are forms of gambling, even if children play with nuts, it is considered gambling.
Beware of striking the stones together (a form of entertainment), for indeed, Satan runs along with you, and the angels flee from you. And whoever keeps a tambourine in his house for forty days "has incurred the wrath of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
arabicText:
5093 - وَ سُئِلَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ
۝ فَاجْتَنِبُوا اَلرِّجْسَ مِنَ اَلْأَوْثٰانِ وَ اِجْتَنِبُوا قَوْلَ اَلزُّورِ ۝
قَالَ "اَلرِّجْسُ مِنَ اَلْأَوْثَانِ اَلشِّطْرَنْجُ وَ قَوْلُ اَلزُّورِ اَلْغِنَاءُ وَ اَلنَّرْدُ أَشَدُّ مِنَ اَلشِّطْرَنْجِ فَأَمَّا اَلشِّطْرَنْجُ فَإِنَّ اِتِّخَاذَهَا كُفْرٌ وَ اَللَّعِبَ بِهَا شِرْكٌ وَ تَعْلِيمَهَا كَبِيرَةٌ مُوبِقَةٌ وَ اَلسَّلاَمَ عَلَى اَللاَّهِي بِهَا مَعْصِيَةٌ وَ مُقَلِّبَهَا كَمُقَلِّبِ لَحْمِ اَلْخِنْزِيرِ وَ اَلنَّاظِرَ إِلَيْهَا كَالنَّاظِرِ إِلَى فَرْجِ أُمِّهِ وَ اَللاَّعِبَ بِالنَّرْدِ قِمَاراً مَثَلُهُ مَثَلُ مَنْ يَأْكُلُ لَحْمَ اَلْخِنْزِيرِ وَ مَثَلَ اَلَّذِي يَلْعَبُ بِهَا مِنْ غَيْرِ قِمَارٍ مَثَلُ مَنْ يَضَعُ يَدَهُ فِي لَحْمِ اَلْخِنْزِيرِ أَوْ فِي دَمِهِ وَ لاَ يَجُوزُ اَللَّعِبُ بِالْخَوَاتِيمِ وَ اَلْأَرْبَعَةَ عَشَرَ وَ كُلُّ ذَلِكَ وَ أَشْبَاهُهُ قِمَارٌ حَتَّى لَعِبُ اَلصِّبْيَانِ بِالْجَوْزِ هُوَ اَلْقِمَارُ وَ إِيَّاكَ وَ اَلضَّرْبَ بِالصَّوَانِيجِ فَإِنَّ اَلشَّيْطَانَ يَرْكُضُ مَعَكَ وَ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةَ تَنْفِرُ عَنْكَ وَ مَنْ بَقِيَ فِي بَيْتِهِ طُنْبُورٌ أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحاً "فَقَدْ بٰاءَ بِغَضَبٍ مِنَ اَللّٰهِ" عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5093 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic:
"So avoid the filth of idols and avoid false speech." (Surah Al-Hajj 22:30)
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The filth of idols refers to chess, and false speech refers to singing. And backgammon (nard) is worse than chess.
As for chess, adopting it is disbelief, playing it is polytheism, teaching it is a grave and destructive sin, greeting someone engaged in it is disobedience, and touching its pieces is like touching the flesh of swine. Looking at it is like looking at the private parts of one's mother.
The one who plays backgammon with gambling is like one who eats the flesh of swine, and the one who plays it without gambling is like one who places his hand in the flesh or blood of swine.
It is not permissible to play with rings, the fourteen stones, and similar games, as all of them are forms of gambling, even if children play with nuts, it is considered gambling.
Beware of striking the stones together (a form of entertainment), for indeed, Satan runs along with you, and the angels flee from you. And whoever keeps a tambourine in his house for forty days "has incurred the wrath of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Drinking Alcohol and Reports Regarding Singing and Amusements
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5094 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Indeed, the angels withdraw from gatherings where gambling occurs and curse the one involved in it, except in the case of betting on hoofed animals, animals with padded feet, feathered birds, and arrows. And the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) himself raced with Usamah ibn Zayd and conducted horse races."
arabicText: 5094 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِنَّ اَلْمَلاَئِكَةَ لَتَنْفِرُ عِنْدَ اَلرِّهَانِ وَ تَلْعَنُ صَاحِبَهُ مَا خَلاَ اَلْحَافِرَ وَ اَلْخُفَّ وَ اَلرِّيشَ وَ اَلنَّصْلَ وَ قَدْ سَابَقَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ أُسَامَةَ بْنَ زَيْدٍ وَ أَجْرَى اَلْخَيْلَ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5094 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, the angels withdraw from gatherings where gambling occurs and curse the one involved in it, except in the case of betting on hoofed animals, animals with padded feet, feathered birds, and arrows. And the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) himself raced with Usamah ibn Zayd and conducted horse races."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Drinking Alcohol and Reports Regarding Singing and Amusements
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5095 - It has been narrated that the she-camel of the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family), was outrun in a race. So Prophet (sw), peace be upon him and his family, said:
"It (camel) transgressed and said to itself, 'Upon me is the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family.'
And it is a right upon Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, that nothing transgresses against anything except that He (swt) humiliates it.
And if a mountain were to transgress against another mountain, Allah would destroy the transgressing one among them."
arabicText: 5095 - فَرُوِيَ: "أَنَّ نَاقَةَ اَلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ سُبِقَتْ فَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "إِنَّهَا بَغَتْ وَ قَالَتْ فَوْقِي رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ حَقٌّ عَلَى اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَنْ لاَ يَبْغِيَ شَيْءٌ عَلَى شَيْءٍ إِلاَّ أَذَلَّهُ اَللَّهُ وَ لَوْ أَنَّ جَبَلاً بَغَى عَلَى جَبَلٍ لَهَدَّ اَللَّهُ اَلْبَاغِيَ مِنْهُمَا" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5095 - It has been narrated that the she-camel of the Prophet (peace be upon him and his family), was outrun in a race. So Prophet (sw), peace be upon him and his family, said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"It (camel) transgressed and said to itself, 'Upon me is the Messenger of Allah (swt), peace and blessings be upon him and his family.'
And it is a right upon Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, that nothing transgresses against anything except that He (swt) humiliates it.
And if a mountain were to transgress against another mountain, Allah would destroy the transgressing one among them."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Drinking Alcohol and Reports Regarding Singing and Amusements
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5096 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade inciting animals against one another, except in the case of dogs.
arabicText: 5096 - : وَ نَهَى رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَنْ تَحْرِيشِ اَلْبَهَائِمِ مَا خَلاَ اَلْكِلاَبَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5096 -
thaqalaynMatn: The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade inciting animals against one another, except in the case of dogs.

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Drinking Alcohol and Reports Regarding Singing and Amusements
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5097 - A man asked Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) about purchasing a bondwoman with a beautiful voice.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm upon you if you buy her and she reminds you of Paradise."
arabicText: 5097 - : وَ سَأَلَ رَجُلٌ عَلِيَّ بْنَ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ شِرَاءِ جَارِيَةٍ لَهَا صَوْتٌ فَقَالَ "مَا عَلَيْكَ لَوِ اِشْتَرَيْتَهَا فَذَكَّرَتْكَ اَلْجَنَّةَ ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5097 - A man asked Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) about purchasing a bondwoman with a beautiful voice.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm upon you if you buy her and she reminds you of Paradise."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5098 - It is narrated from Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as)  that he said:
"A servant continues to steal until, when the value of what he has stolen equals the blood money for his hand, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, exposes him."
arabicText: 5098 - رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: "لاَ يَزَالُ اَلْعَبْدُ يَسْرِقُ حَتَّى إِذَا اِسْتَوْفَى دِيَةَ يَدِهِ أَظْهَرَهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عَلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5098 - It is narrated from Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as)  that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A servant continues to steal until, when the value of what he has stolen equals the blood money for his hand, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, exposes him."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5099 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), that he said:
"The hand of a thief is not to be cut off during a year of drought."
arabicText: 5099 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "لاَ يُقْطَعُ اَلسَّارِقُ فِي عَامِ سَنَةٍ مُجْدِبَةٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5099 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The hand of a thief is not to be cut off during a year of drought."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5100 - In the narration of Ghiyath ibn Ibrahim from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), it is reported: "Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) was presented in Kufa with a man who had stolen a pigeon, but he did not cut off his hand and said: 'I do not cut off (a hand) for stealing birds.'"
arabicText: 5100 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ غِيَاثِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : "أَنَّ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أُتِيَ بِالْكُوفَةِ بِرَجُلٍ سَرَقَ حَمَاماً فَلَمْ يَقْطَعْهُ وَ قَالَ "لاَ أَقْطَعُ فِي اَلطَّيْرِ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5100 - In the narration of Ghiyath ibn Ibrahim from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), it is reported:
thaqalaynMatn: "Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) was presented in Kufa with a man who had stolen a pigeon, but he did not cut off his hand and said: 'I do not cut off (a hand) for stealing birds.'"

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5101 - Sa'd ibn Tarif narrated from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said: "Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) ordered the cutting off of a hand for stealing an iron helmet and for a shield that weighed thirty-eight ratl (a unit of weight)."
arabicText: 5101 - وَ رَوَى سَعْدُ بْنُ طَرِيفٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "قَطَعَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي بَيْضَةِ حَدِيدٍ وَ فِي جُنَّةٍ وَزْنُهَا ثَمَانِيَةٌ وَ ثَلاَثُونَ رِطْلاً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5101 - Sa'd ibn Tarif narrated from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) ordered the cutting off of a hand for stealing an iron helmet and for a shield that weighed thirty-eight ratl (a unit of weight)."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5102 - Hammad narrated from Al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who went to another man and said: "So-and-so sent me to you to collect such-and-such," and the man gave it to him, believing him.
Later, he met the original person and said: "Your messenger came to me, and I sent with him such-and-such," but the man replied:
"I did not send him to you, nor did anyone bring me anything."
The supposed messenger then claimed that he had indeed been sent and had delivered the item to him.
Imam (as) said: "If proof is established against him that he was never sent, his hand is to be cut off. But if there is no proof, the man must swear by Allah (swt) that he did not send him, and the other must recover his money from the messenger."
I asked: "What if he claims that necessity compelled him to do so?"
Imam (as) replied: "His hand is to be cut off because he has stolen the man's wealth."
arabicText:
5102 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادٌ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ :
فِي رَجُلٍ أَتَى رَجُلاً فَقَالَ أَرْسَلَنِي فُلاَنٌ إِلَيْكَ لِتُرْسِلَ إِلَيْهِ بِكَذَا وَ كَذَا فَأَعْطَاهُ وَ صَدَّقَهُ فَلَقِيَ صَاحِبَهُ فَقَالَ لَهُ إِنَّ رَسُولَكَ أَتَانِي فَبَعَثْتُ إِلَيْكَ مَعَهُ بِكَذَا وَ كَذَا فَقَالَ مَا أَرْسَلْتُهُ إِلَيْكَ وَ لاَ أَتَانِي أَحَدٌ بِشَيْءٍ فَزَعَمَ اَلرَّسُولُ أَنَّهُ قَدْ أَرْسَلَهُ وَ قَدْ دَفَعَهُ إِلَيْهِ قَالَ
"إِنْ وَجَدَ عَلَيْهِ بَيِّنَةً أَنَّهُ لَمْ يُرْسِلْهُ قُطِعَتْ يَدُهُ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَجِدْ عَلَيْهِ بَيِّنَةً فَيَمِينُهُ بِاللَّهِ مَا أَرْسَلَهُ وَ يَسْتَوْفِي اَلْآخَرُ مِنَ اَلرَّسُولِ اَلْمَالَ" قُلْتُ فَإِنْ زَعَمَ أَنَّهُ حَمَلَهُ عَلَى ذَلِكَ اَلْحَاجَةُ قَالَ "يُقْطَعُ لِأَنَّهُ سَرَقَ مَالَ اَلرَّجُلِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5102 - Hammad narrated from Al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (as)
thaqalaynMatn:
regarding a man who went to another man and said: "So-and-so sent me to you to collect such-and-such," and the man gave it to him, believing him.
Later, he met the original person and said: "Your messenger came to me, and I sent with him such-and-such," but the man replied:
"I did not send him to you, nor did anyone bring me anything."
The supposed messenger then claimed that he had indeed been sent and had delivered the item to him.
Imam (as) said: "If proof is established against him that he was never sent, his hand is to be cut off. But if there is no proof, the man must swear by Allah (swt) that he did not send him, and the other must recover his money from the messenger."
I asked: "What if he claims that necessity compelled him to do so?"
Imam (as) replied: "His hand is to be cut off because he has stolen the man's wealth."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5103 - It is narrated from one of the two Imams (as) that Imam (as) said:
"The hand of a thief is not to be cut off until he confesses to the theft twice. If he retracts his confession, he must compensate for what he stole, but his hand will not be cut off if there are no witnesses against him."
arabicText: 5103 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: "لاَ يُقْطَعُ اَلسَّارِقُ حَتَّى يُقِرَّ بِالسَّرِقَةِ مَرَّتَيْنِ فَإِنْ رَجَعَ ضَمِنَ اَلسَّرِقَةَ وَ لَمْ يُقْطَعْ إِذَا لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ شُهُودٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5103 - It is narrated from one of the two Imams (as) that Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The hand of a thief is not to be cut off until he confesses to the theft twice. If he retracts his confession, he must compensate for what he stole, but his hand will not be cut off if there are no witnesses against him."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5104 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "Every place that can be entered without permission, and a thief steals from it, there is no cutting off of the hand."
arabicText: 5104 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ قَالَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "كُلُّ مَدْخَلٍ يُدْخَلُ إِلَيْهِ بِغَيْرِ إِذْنٍ فَسَرَقَ مِنْهُ اَلسَّارِقُ فَلاَ قَطْعَ عَلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5104 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Every place that can be entered without permission, and a thief steals from it, there is no cutting off of the hand."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5105 - Al-Alaa narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said: I asked Imam (as) about a child who steals.
Imam (as) said: "If he is seven years old or younger, the punishment is lifted from him.
But if he repeats the act after the age of seven, his fingertip is to be cut off or scraped until it bleeds.
If he repeats it again, a part below his fingertip is to be cut off.
If he steals again after that and has reached nine years of age, his hand is to be cut off.
None of the prescribed punishments of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, are to be neglected."
arabicText: 5105 - وَ رَوَى اَلْعَلاَءُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلصَّبِيِّ يَسْرِقُ قَالَ "إِنْ كَانَ لَهُ سَبْعُ سِنِينَ أَوْ أَقَلُّ رُفِعَ عَنْهُ فَإِنْ عَادَ بَعْدَ اَلسَّبْعِ قُطِعَتْ بَنَانُهُ أَوْ حُكَّتْ حَتَّى تَدْمَى فَإِنْ عَادَ قُطِعَ مِنْهُ أَسْفَلُ مِنْ بَنَانِهِ فَإِنْ عَادَ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ وَ قَدْ بَلَغَ تِسْعَ سِنِينَ قُطِعَتْ يَدُهُ وَ لاَ يُضَيَّعُ حَدٌّ مِنْ حُدُودِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5105 - Al-Alaa narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about a child who steals.
Imam (as) said: "If he is seven years old or younger, the punishment is lifted from him.
But if he repeats the act after the age of seven, his fingertip is to be cut off or scraped until it bleeds.
If he repeats it again, a part below his fingertip is to be cut off.
If he steals again after that and has reached nine years of age, his hand is to be cut off.
None of the prescribed punishments of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, are to be neglected."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5106 - A man came to Commander of the Faithful (as) and confessed to theft.
Commander of the Faithful (as) asked him: "Do you recite anything from the Book of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic?"
The man replied: "Yes, Surah Al-Baqarah."
Imam (as) said: "I have pardoned your hand for the sake of Surah Al-Baqarah."
Al-Ashath objected, saying: "Are you suspending one of the punishments prescribed by Allah (swt), the Exalted?"
Commander of the Faithful (as) replied: "And what do you know about this matter? When evidence is established, the Imam has no authority to pardon, but when a man confesses against himself, then it is up to the Imam - if he wishes, he may pardon, and if he wishes, he may order the cutting."
arabicText: 5106 - : وَ جَاءَ رَجُلٌ إِلَى أَمِيرِ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَأَقَرَّ بِالسَّرِقَةِ فَقَالَ لَهُ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "أَ تَقْرَأُ شَيْئاً مِنْ كِتَابِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ" قَالَ نَعَمْ سُورَةَ اَلْبَقَرَةِ فَقَالَ "قَدْ وَهَبْتُ يَدَكَ لِسُورَةِ اَلْبَقَرَةِ " فَقَالَ اَلْأَشْعَثُ أَ تُعَطِّلُ حَدّاً مِنْ حُدُودِ اَللَّهِ تَعَالَى فَقَالَ "وَ مَا يُدْرِيكَ مَا هَذَا إِذَا قَامَتِ اَلْبَيِّنَةُ فَلَيْسَ لِلْإِمَامِ أَنْ يَعْفُوَ وَ إِذَا أَقَرَّ اَلرَّجُلُ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ فَذَاكَ إِلَى اَلْإِمَامِ إِنْ شَاءَ عَفَا وَ إِنْ شَاءَ قَطَعَ".

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5107 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said: "There is no cutting (of the hand) for stealing fruit or kathar."
And kathar refers to the inner core of palm trees (Al-jummar).
arabicText: 5107 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "لاَ قَطْعَ فِي ثَمَرٍ وَ لاَ كَثَرٍ وَ اَلْكَثَرُ هُوَ اَلْجُمَّارُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5107 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There is no cutting (of the hand) for stealing fruit or kathar."
And kathar refers to the inner core of palm trees (Al-jummar).

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5108 - Muhammad ibn Qays narrated from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said: "Commander of the Faithful (as) ruled in the case of a group of people who slaughtered a camel and ate it. They were investigated to determine who among them had slaughtered it, and they all testified against themselves that they had collectively slaughtered it without specifying any individual over another. So, Imam (as) ruled that their right hands be cut off."
arabicText: 5108 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ قَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "قَضَى أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي نَفَرٍ نَحَرُوا بَعِيراً فَأَكَلُوهُ فَامْتُحِنُوا أَيُّهُمْ نَحَرَ فَشَهِدُوا عَلَى أَنْفُسِهِمْ أَنَّهُمْ نَحَرُوهُ جَمِيعاً لَمْ يَخُصُّوا أَحَداً دُونَ أَحَدٍ فَقَضَى أَنْ تُقْطَعَ أَيْمَانُهُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5108 - Muhammad ibn Qays narrated from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Commander of the Faithful (as) ruled in the case of a group of people who slaughtered a camel and ate it. They were investigated to determine who among them had slaughtered it, and they all testified against themselves that they had collectively slaughtered it without specifying any individual over another. So, Imam (as) ruled that their right hands be cut off."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5109 - Yunus narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who stole from the war spoils an amount that would normally require his hand to be cut off.
Imam (as) said: "It should be examined how much his rightful share is. If what he took was less than his portion, he is to be disciplined (ta'zir) and given the remainder of his share.
If he took exactly what was due to him, then there is nothing upon him.
But if he took more than his share equal to the value of a shield, which is a quarter of a dinar, then his hand is to be cut off."
arabicText: 5109 - وَ رَوَى يُونُسُ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لَهُ رَجُلٌ سَرَقَ مِنَ اَلْمَغْنَمِ اَلشَّيْءَ اَلَّذِي يَجِبُ عَلَيْهِ اَلْقَطْعُ قَالَ "يُنْظَرُ كَمِ اَلَّذِي يُصِيبُهُ فَإِنْ كَانَ اَلَّذِي أَخَذَ أَقَلَّ مِنْ نَصِيبِهِ عُزِّرَ وَ دُفِعَ إِلَيْهِ تَمَامُ مَالِهِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ أَخَذَ مِثْلَ اَلَّذِي لَهُ فَلاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ أَخَذَ فَضْلاً بِقَدْرِ ثَمَنِ مِجَنٍّ وَ هُوَ رُبُعُ دِينَارٍ قُطِعَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5109 - Yunus narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who stole from the war spoils an amount that would normally require his hand to be cut off.
Imam (as) said: "It should be examined how much his rightful share is. If what he took was less than his portion, he is to be disciplined (ta'zir) and given the remainder of his share.
If he took exactly what was due to him, then there is nothing upon him.
But if he took more than his share equal to the value of a shield, which is a quarter of a dinar, then his hand is to be cut off."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5110 - Musa ibn Bakr narrated from Zurarah from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who rented a donkey and went to cloth merchants, bought a garment from them, and left the donkey with them.
Imam (as) said: "The donkey should be returned to its owner, and the one who took the garment should be pursued. However, there is no cutting (of the hand) upon him because this is an act of betrayal, not theft."
arabicText: 5110 - وَ رَوَى مُوسَى بْنُ بَكْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ اِكْتَرَى حِمَاراً وَ أَقْبَلَ إِلَى أَصْحَابِ اَلثِّيَابِ فَابْتَاعَ مِنْهُمْ ثَوْباً وَ تَرَكَ اَلْحِمَارَ عِنْدَهُمْ قَالَ "يُرَدُّ اَلْحِمَارُ عَلَى أَصْحَابِهِ وَ يُتْبَعُ اَلَّذِي ذَهَبَ بِالثَّوْبِ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ قَطْعٌ إِنَّمَا هِيَ خِيَانَةٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5110 - Musa ibn Bakr narrated from Zurarah from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who rented a donkey and went to cloth merchants, bought a garment from them, and left the donkey with them.
Imam (as) said: "The donkey should be returned to its owner, and the one who took the garment should be pursued. However, there is no cutting (of the hand) upon him because this is an act of betrayal, not theft."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5111 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"When a man committed theft for the first time, Commander of the Faithful (as) would cut off his right hand. If he repeated the theft, he would cut off his left foot. If he stole a third time, he would imprison him for life and provide for him from the public treasury."
arabicText: 5111 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "كَانَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِذَا سَرَقَ اَلرَّجُلُ أَوَّلاً قَطَعَ يَمِينَهُ فَإِنْ عَادَ قَطَعَ رِجْلَهُ اَلْيُسْرَى فَإِنْ عَادَ ثَالِثَةً خَلَّدَهُ اَلسِّجْنَ وَ أَنْفَقَ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ بَيْتِ اَلْمَالِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5111 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When a man committed theft for the first time, Commander of the Faithful (as) would cut off his right hand. If he repeated the theft, he would cut off his left foot. If he stole a third time, he would imprison him for life and provide for him from the public treasury."

author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5112 - It has been narrated: "If he steals while in prison, he is to be executed."

thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5112 - It has been narrated:
