chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5113 - Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about the minimum amount for which a thief's hand is to be cut off.
Imam (as) said: "A quarter of a dinar."
arabicText: 5113 - وَ سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ أَدْنَى مَا يُقْطَعُ فِيهِ اَلسَّارِقُ قَالَ "رُبُعُ دِينَارٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5113 - Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about the minimum amount for which a thief's hand is to be cut off.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "A quarter of a dinar."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5114 - In another narration, it is reported: "One-fifth of a dinar."
arabicText: 5114 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ: "خُمُسُ دِينَارٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5114 - In another narration, it is reported:
thaqalaynMatn: "One-fifth of a dinar."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5115 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn Ri'ab from Zurarah from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) regarding a man who stole, and his right hand was cut off. Then he stole again, and his left foot was cut off. Then he stole a third time.
Imam (as) said: "Commander of the Faithful (as) would imprison him for life and would say, 'I feel ashamed before my Lord (azj) to leave him without a hand to clean himself with and without a foot to walk with to fulfill his needs.'"
Imam Al-Baqir (as) added: "When Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) would cut off the hand, he would cut it below the wrist joint, and when he would cut off the foot, he would cut it from the ankle."
Imam Al-Baqir (as) also stated: "Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) did not believe that any of the prescribed punishments should be pardoned."
arabicText: 5115 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ سَرَقَ فَقُطِعَتْ يَدُهُ اَلْيُمْنَى ثُمَّ سَرَقَ فَقُطِعَتْ رِجْلَهُ اَلْيُسْرَى ثُمَّ سَرَقَ اَلثَّالِثَةَ قَالَ "كَانَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يُخَلِّدُهُ فِي اَلسِّجْنِ وَ يَقُولُ "إِنِّي لَأَسْتَحْيِي مِنْ رَبِّي أَنْ أَدَعَهُ بِلاَ يَدٍ يَسْتَنْظِفُ بِهَا وَ لاَ رِجْلٍ يَمْشِي بِهَا إِلَى حَاجَتِهِ" " قَالَ "وَ كَانَ إِذَا قَطَعَ اَلْيَدَ قَطَعَهَا دُونَ اَلْمَفْصِلِ وَ إِذَا قَطَعَ اَلرِّجْلَ قَطَعَهَا مِنَ اَلْكَعْبِ " قَالَ "وَ كَانَ لاَ يَرَى أَنْ يُعْفَى، عَنْ شَيْءٍ مِنَ اَلْحُدُودِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5115 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn Ri'ab from Zurarah from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as)
thaqalaynMatn:
regarding a man who stole, and his right hand was cut off. Then he stole again, and his left foot was cut off. Then he stole a third time.
Imam (as) said: "Commander of the Faithful (as) would imprison him for life and would say, 'I feel ashamed before my Lord (azj) to leave him without a hand to clean himself with and without a foot to walk with to fulfill his needs.'"
Imam Al-Baqir (as) added: "When Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) would cut off the hand, he would cut it below the wrist joint, and when he would cut off the foot, he would cut it from the ankle."
Imam Al-Baqir (as) also stated: "Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) did not believe that any of the prescribed punishments should be pardoned."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5116 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn Al-Hasan ibn Ribat from Ibn Muskan from Al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
"When the legal punishment is carried out on a thief, he is to be exiled to another town. If a man steals and is not caught until he steals again and is then apprehended, and evidence is brought against him, with witnesses testifying to both the first and the most recent theft, his hand is to be cut off for the first theft, but his foot is not to be cut off for the second theft.
This is because the witnesses testified to both thefts at the same time before his hand was cut off for the first theft.
However, if the witnesses had testified regarding the first theft and his hand was cut off, and then later testified about the second theft, his left foot would be cut off."
arabicText: 5116 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ رِبَاطٍ عَنِ اِبْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "إِذَا أُقِيمَ عَلَى اَلسَّارِقِ اَلْحَدُّ نُفِيَ إِلَى بَلْدَةٍ أُخْرَى وَ إِنْ سَرَقَ رَجُلٌ فَلَمْ يُقْدَرْ عَلَيْهِ حَتَّى سَرَقَ مَرَّةً أُخْرَى فَأُخِذَ فَجَاءَتِ اَلْبَيِّنَةُ فَشَهِدُوا عَلَيْهِ بِالسَّرِقَةِ اَلْأُولَى وَ اَلْأَخِيرَةِ فَإِنَّهُ تُقْطَعُ يَدُهُ بِالسَّرِقَةِ اَلْأُولَى وَ لاَ تُقْطَعُ رِجْلُهُ بِالسَّرِقَةِ اَلْأَخِيرَةِ لِأَنَّ اَلشُّهُودَ شَهِدُوا عَلَيْهِ جَمِيعاً فِي مَقَامٍ وَاحِدٍ بِالسَّرِقَةِ اَلْأُولَى وَ اَلْأَخِيرَةِ قَبْلَ أَنْ تُقْطَعَ يَدُهُ بِالسَّرِقَةِ اَلْأُولَى وَ لَوْ أَنَّ اَلشُّهُودَ شَهِدُوا عَلَيْهِ بِالسَّرِقَةِ اَلْأُولَى فَقُطِعَتْ يَدُهُ ثُمَّ شَهِدُوا عَلَيْهِ بَعْدُ بِالسَّرِقَةِ اَلْأَخِيرَةِ قُطِعَتْ رِجْلُهُ اَلْيُسْرَى".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5116 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn Al-Hasan ibn Ribat from Ibn Muskan from Al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When the legal punishment is carried out on a thief, he is to be exiled to another town. If a man steals and is not caught until he steals again and is then apprehended, and evidence is brought against him, with witnesses testifying to both the first and the most recent theft, his hand is to be cut off for the first theft, but his foot is not to be cut off for the second theft.
This is because the witnesses testified to both thefts at the same time before his hand was cut off for the first theft.
However, if the witnesses had testified regarding the first theft and his hand was cut off, and then later testified about the second theft, his left foot would be cut off."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5117 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"There is no cutting (of the hand) for open and public theft, which is snatching (Al-khulsah), but I would discipline him (ta'zir).
However, the one who steals and conceals what he takes is to have his hand cut off."
There is no cutting (of the hand) for one who snatches clothing, nor is there cutting for a pickpocket (ṭarrar) if he steals from the outer garment.
However, if he steals from the inner garment, then cutting is applied.
There is also no cutting for a worker (ajir) or a guest (ḍayf) because they are entrusted.
However, it has been narrated that if a guest hosts another guest who then steals, his hand is to be cut.
If a paralyzed person (ashall) steals, his right hand is to be cut off regardless of whether it is paralyzed or healthy. If he steals again, his left foot is to be cut off. If he steals a third time, he is to be imprisoned for life, provided for from the public treasury of the Muslims, and restrained from harming people.
This was narrated by Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Al-Alaa from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Zurarah from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), and also by Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abu Abdullah (as).
Additionally, there is no cutting for a slave if he steals from the property of his master because it is considered the wealth of the man himself, as if a part of him has stolen from another part.
arabicText:
5117 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لاَ قَطْعَ فِي اَلدَّغَارَةِ اَلْمُعْلَنَةِ وَ هِيَ اَلْخُلْسَةُ وَ لَكِنِّي أُعَزِّرُهُ وَ لَكِنْ يُقْطَعُ مَنْ يَأْخُذُ وَ يُخْفِي".
وَ لَيْسَ عَلَى اَلَّذِي يَسْلُبُ اَلثِّيَابَ قَطْعٌ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَى اَلطَّرَّارِ قَطْعٌ إِذَا طَرَّ مِنَ اَلْقَمِيصِ اَلْأَعْلَى فَإِنْ طَرَّ مِنَ اَلْقَمِيصِ اَلْأَسْفَلِ فَعَلَيْهِ اَلْقَطْعُ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَى اَلْأَجِيرِ وَ لاَ عَلَى اَلضَّيْفِ قَطْعٌ لِأَنَّهُمَا مُؤْتَمَنَانِ وَ قَدْ رُوِيَ أَنَّهُ إِنْ أَضَافَ اَلضَّيْفُ ضَيْفاً فَسَرَقَ قُطِعَ وَ اَلْأَشَلُّ إِذَا سَرَقَ قُطِعَتْ يَمِينُهُ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ شَلاَّءَ كَانَتْ أَوْ صَحِيحَةً فَإِنْ عَادَ فَسَرَقَ قُطِعَتْ رِجْلُهُ اَلْيُسْرَى فَإِنْ عَادَ خُلِّدَ اَلسِّجْنَ وَ أُجْرِيَ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ بَيْتِ مَالِ اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ وَ كُفَّ عَنِ اَلنَّاسِ رَوَى ذَلِكَ اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلاَءٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ. وَ رَوَاهُ اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَى اَلْعَبْدِ إِذَا سَرَقَ مِنْ مَالِ مَوْلاَهُ قَطْعٌ لِأَنَّهُ مَالُ اَلرَّجُلِ سَرَقَ بَعْضُهُ بَعْضاً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5117 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There is no cutting (of the hand) for open and public theft, which is snatching (Al-khulsah), but I would discipline him (ta'zir).
However, the one who steals and conceals what he takes is to have his hand cut off."
There is no cutting (of the hand) for one who snatches clothing, nor is there cutting for a pickpocket (ṭarrar) if he steals from the outer garment.
However, if he steals from the inner garment, then cutting is applied.
There is also no cutting for a worker (ajir) or a guest (ḍayf) because they are entrusted.
However, it has been narrated that if a guest hosts another guest who then steals, his hand is to be cut.
If a paralyzed person (ashall) steals, his right hand is to be cut off regardless of whether it is paralyzed or healthy. If he steals again, his left foot is to be cut off. If he steals a third time, he is to be imprisoned for life, provided for from the public treasury of the Muslims, and restrained from harming people.
This was narrated by Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Al-Alaa from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Zurarah from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), and also by Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abu Abdullah (as).
Additionally, there is no cutting for a slave if he steals from the property of his master because it is considered the wealth of the man himself, as if a part of him has stolen from another part.

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5118 - "The grave robber (Al-nabbash), if he is known for doing that, is to have his hand cut off."
arabicText: 5118 - : "وَ اَلنَّبَّاشُ إِذَا كَانَ مَعْرُوفاً بِذَلِكَ قُطِعَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5118 -
thaqalaynMatn: "The grave robber (Al-nabbash), if he is known for doing that, is to have his hand cut off."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5119 - It has been narrated that Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) ordered the hand of a grave robber to be cut off.
Imam (as) was asked: "Do you cut off (the hand) for stealing from the dead?"
Imam (as) replied: "We cut for our dead just as we cut for our living."
arabicText: 5119 - وَ رُوِيَ: "أَنَّ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَطَعَ نَبَّاشَ اَلْقَبْرِ فَقِيلَ لَهُ أَ تَقْطَعُ فِي اَلْمَوْتَى فَقَالَ "إِنَّا لَنَقْطَعُ لِأَمْوَاتِنَا كَمَا نَقْطَعُ لِأَحْيَائِنَا" ".

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5120 - It has been narrated that Commander of the Faithful (as) was presented with a grave robber.
Imam (as) grabbed him by his hair, struck him against the ground, and then said: "Step on him, O' servants of Allah (swt)." So, the people trampled him until he died.
arabicText: 5120 - وَ رُوِيَ: "أَنَّ أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أُتِيَ بِنَبَّاشٍ فَأَخَذَ بِشَعْرِهِ وَ جَلَدَ بِهِ اَلْأَرْضَ ثُمَّ قَالَ "طَئُوا عَلَيْهِ عِبَادَ اَللَّهِ" فَوُطِئَ حَتَّى مَاتَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5120 - It has been narrated that Commander of the Faithful (as) was presented with a grave robber.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) grabbed him by his hair, struck him against the ground, and then said: "Step on him, O' servants of Allah (swt)." So, the people trampled him until he died.

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5121 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic:
"The punishment of those who wage war against Allah (swt) and His Messenger and strive to spread corruption on earth is that they be killed, or crucified, or have their hands and feet cut off from opposite sides, or be exiled from the land" (Surah Al-Ma'idah 5:33).
Imam (as) said: "If a person kills but does not engage in combat and does not take wealth, he is to be executed.
If he engages in combat and kills, he is to be killed and crucified.
If he engages in combat and takes wealth but does not kill, his hand and foot are to be cut off.
And if he engages in combat but does not kill and does not take wealth, he is to be exiled."
arabicText:
5121 - وَ سُئِلَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ
۝ إِنَّمٰا جَزٰاءُ اَلَّذِينَ يُحٰارِبُونَ اَللّٰهَ وَ رَسُولَهُ وَ يَسْعَوْنَ فِي اَلْأَرْضِ فَسٰاداً أَنْ يُقَتَّلُوا أَوْ يُصَلَّبُوا أَوْ تُقَطَّعَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَ أَرْجُلُهُمْ مِنْ خِلاٰفٍ أَوْ يُنْفَوْا مِنَ اَلْأَرْضِ ۝
فَقَالَ "إِذَا قَتَلَ وَ لَمْ يُحَارِبْ وَ لَمْ يَأْخُذِ اَلْمَالَ قُتِلَ وَ إِذَا حَارَبَ وَ قَتَلَ قُتِلَ وَ صُلِبَ وَ إِذَا حَارَبَ وَ أَخَذَ اَلْمَالَ وَ لَمْ يَقْتُلْ قُطِعَتْ يَدُهُ وَ رِجْلُهُ وَ إِذَا حَارَبَ وَ لَمْ يَقْتُلْ وَ لَمْ يَأْخُذِ اَلْمَالَ نُفِيَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5121 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic:
"The punishment of those who wage war against Allah (swt) and His Messenger and strive to spread corruption on earth is that they be killed, or crucified, or have their hands and feet cut off from opposite sides, or be exiled from the land" (Surah Al-Ma'idah 5:33).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"If a person kills but does not engage in combat and does not take wealth, he is to be executed.
If he engages in combat and kills, he is to be killed and crucified.
If he engages in combat and takes wealth but does not kill, his hand and foot are to be cut off.
And if he engages in combat but does not kill and does not take wealth, he is to be exiled."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5122 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"The crucified person is to be taken down from the wooden structure after three days, washed, and buried. It is not permissible to keep him crucified for more than three days."
arabicText: 5122 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلْمَصْلُوبُ يُنْزَلُ عَنِ اَلْخَشَبَةِ بَعْدَ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ يُغَسَّلُ وَ يُدْفَنُ وَ لاَ يَجُوزُ صَلْبُهُ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5122 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The crucified person is to be taken down from the wooden structure after three days, washed, and buried. It is not permissible to keep him crucified for more than three days."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5123 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), it is reported:
"Indeed, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) crucified a man in Al-Hirah for three days. Then on the fourth day, Imam (as) took him down, prayed over him, and buried him."
arabicText: 5123 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "أَنَّ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ صَلَبَ رَجُلاً، بِالْحِيرَةِ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ أَنْزَلَهُ يَوْمَ اَلرَّابِعِ فَصَلَّى عَلَيْهِ وَ دَفَنَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5123 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), it is reported:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) crucified a man in Al-Hirah for three days. Then on the fourth day, Imam (as) took him down, prayed over him, and buried him."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5124 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Ḍurays from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said: "Whoever carries a weapon at night is considered a highway robber (muharib), unless he is a man who is not known for suspicion or wrongdoing."
arabicText: 5124 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ رِئَابٍ عَنْ ضُرَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "مَنْ حَمَلَ اَلسِّلاَحَ بِاللَّيْلِ فَهُوَ مُحَارِبٌ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ رَجُلاً لَيْسَ مِنْ أَهْلِ اَلرِّيبَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5124 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Ḍurays from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever carries a weapon at night is considered a highway robber (muharib), unless he is a man who is not known for suspicion or wrongdoing."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5125 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Talhah Al-Nahdi from Sawrah ibn Kulayb who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who leaves his house intending to go to the mosque or fulfill a need and is met or confronted by another man who strikes him and takes his garment.
Abu Abdullah (as) asked: "What do the people in your region say about this?"
I replied: "They say this is open aggression (dagharah muʿlanah), and that a highway robber (muharib) only exists in the lands of polytheists."
Imam (as) then asked: "Which is more sacred: the land of Islam or the land of polytheism?"
I replied: "The land of Islam."
Imam (as) said: "These people fall under the ruling of this verse:
'The punishment of those who wage war against Allah (swt) and His Messenger'" (until the end of the verse). (Surah Al-Ma'idah 5:33)
arabicText:
5125 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ طَلْحَةَ اَلنَّهْدِيِّ عَنْ سَوْرَةَ بْنِ كُلَيْبٍ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلٌ يَخْرُجُ مِنْ مَنْزِلِهِ يُرِيدُ اَلْمَسْجِدَ أَوْ يُرِيدُ اَلْحَاجَةَ فَيَلْقَاهُ رَجُلٌ أَوْ يَسْتَقْبِلُهُ فَيَضْرِبُهُ وَ يَأْخُذُ ثَوْبَهُ قَالَ "أَيَّ شَيْءٍ يَقُولُ فِيهِ مَنْ قِبَلَكُمْ" قَالَ قُلْتُ يَقُولُونَ هَذِهِ دَغَارَةٌ مُعْلَنَةٌ وَ إِنَّمَا اَلْمُحَارِبُ فِي قُرًى مُشْرِكِيَّةٍ فَقَالَ "أَيُّهُمَا أَعْظَمُ حُرْمَةً دَارُ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ أَوْ دَارُ اَلشِّرْكِ" قَالَ فَقُلْتُ دَارُ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ قَالَ "هَؤُلاَءِ مِنْ أَهْلِ هَذِهِ اَلْآيَةِ:
۝ إِنَّمٰا جَزٰاءُ اَلَّذِينَ يُحٰارِبُونَ اَللّٰهَ وَ رَسُولَهُ  ۝ " إِلَى آخِرِ اَلْآيَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5125 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Talhah Al-Nahdi from Sawrah ibn Kulayb who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who leaves his house intending to go to the mosque or fulfill a need and is met or confronted by another man who strikes him and takes his garment.
Abu Abdullah (as) asked: "What do the people in your region say about this?"
I replied: "They say this is open aggression (dagharah muʿlanah), and that a highway robber (muharib) only exists in the lands of polytheists."
Imam (as) then asked: "Which is more sacred: the land of Islam or the land of polytheism?"
I replied: "The land of Islam."
Imam (as) said: "These people fall under the ruling of this verse:
'The punishment of those who wage war against Allah (swt) and His Messenger'" (until the end of the verse). (Surah Al-Ma'idah 5:33)

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5126 - It was narrated from Tarif ibn Sinan Al-Thawri who said:
I asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who stole a free woman and sold her.
Imam (as) said: "There are four legal punishments in this case.
The first is that since he stole, his hand is to be cut off.
The second is that if he had intercourse with her, he is to be flogged with the legal punishment.
The third is upon the one who bought her: if he had intercourse with her and knew her status, then if he was married (muhsan), he is to be stoned, and if he was unmarried (non-muhsan), he is to be flogged with the legal punishment. However, if he did not know (her status), then there is nothing upon him or upon her.
The fourth is that if she was forced into it, there is no punishment upon her, but if she consented, she is to be flogged with the legal punishment."
arabicText: 5126 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ طَرِيفِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ اَلثَّوْرِيِّ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ جَعْفَرَ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ سَرَقَ حُرَّةً فَبَاعَهَا فَقَالَ "فِيهَا أَرْبَعَةُ حُدُودٍ أَمَّا أَوَّلُهَا فَسَارِقٌ تُقْطَعُ يَدُهُ وَ اَلثَّانِيَةُ إِنْ كَانَ وَطِئَهَا جُلِدَ اَلْحَدَّ وَ عَلَى اَلَّذِي اِشْتَرَى إِنْ كَانَ وَطِئَهَا وَ قَدْ عَلِمَ إِنْ كَانَ مُحْصَناً رُجِمَ وَ إِنْ كَانَ غَيْرَ مُحْصَنٍ جُلِدَ اَلْحَدَّ وَ إِنْ كَانَ لَمْ يَعْلَمْ فَلاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهِ وَ لاَ عَلَيْهَا هِيَ وَ إِنْ كَانَ اِسْتَكْرَهَهَا فَلاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهَا وَ إِنْ كَانَتْ طَاوَعَتْهُ جُلِدَتِ اَلْحَدَّ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5126 - It was narrated from Tarif ibn Sinan Al-Thawri who said:
I asked Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who stole a free woman and sold her.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There are four legal punishments in this case.
The first is that since he stole, his hand is to be cut off.
The second is that if he had intercourse with her, he is to be flogged with the legal punishment.
The third is upon the one who bought her: if he had intercourse with her and knew her status, then if he was married (muhsan), he is to be stoned, and if he was unmarried (non-muhsan), he is to be flogged with the legal punishment. However, if he did not know (her status), then there is nothing upon him or upon her.
The fourth is that if she was forced into it, there is no punishment upon her, but if she consented, she is to be flogged with the legal punishment."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5127 - Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Hilal narrated from his father from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
I asked Imam (as): "Tell me why the right hand and the left foot of a thief are cut off, but not the right hand and the right foot?"
Imam (as) replied: "What a good question you have asked! If his right hand and right foot were cut off, he would fall onto his left side and would not be able to stand. But when his right hand and left foot are cut off, he remains balanced and can stand upright."
I said: "May I be your ransom, how can he stand when his foot has been cut off?"
Imam (as) replied: "The cutting is not as you perceive it. The foot is cut off from the ankle, leaving part of the foot so that he can stand on it, perform prayer, and worship Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
I asked: "From where is the hand cut off?"
Imam (as) replied: "The four fingers are cut off, and the thumb is left for him so that he may lean on it during prayer and wash his face for prayer."
arabicText: 5127 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ هِلاَلٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لَهُ أَخْبِرْنِي عَنِ اَلسَّارِقِ لِمَ تُقْطَعُ يَدُهُ اَلْيُمْنَى وَ رِجْلُهُ اَلْيُسْرَى وَ لاَ تُقْطَعُ يَدُهُ اَلْيُمْنَى وَ رِجْلُهُ اَلْيُمْنَى فَقَالَ "مَا أَحْسَنَ مَا سَأَلْتَ إِذَا قُطِعَتْ يَدُهُ اَلْيُمْنَى وَ رِجْلُهُ اَلْيُمْنَى سَقَطَ عَلَى جَانِبِهِ اَلْأَيْسَرِ وَ لَمْ يَقْدِرْ عَلَى اَلْقِيَامِ وَ إِذَا قُطِعَتْ يَدُهُ اَلْيُمْنَى وَ رِجْلُهُ اَلْيُسْرَى اِعْتَدَلَ وَ اِسْتَوَى قَائِماً" قَالَ قُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ كَيْفَ يَقُومُ وَ قَدْ قُطِعَتْ رِجْلُهُ قَالَ "إِنَّ اَلْقَطْعَ لَيْسَ مِنْ حَيْثُ رَأَيْتَ تُقْطَعُ إِنَّمَا تُقْطَعُ اَلرِّجْلُ مِنَ اَلْكَعْبِ وَ يُتْرَكُ لَهُ مِنْ قَدَمِهِ مَا يَقُومُ عَلَيْهِ يُصَلِّي وَ يَعْبُدُ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ" قُلْتُ فَمِنْ أَيْنَ تُقْطَعُ اَلْيَدُ قَالَ "تُقْطَعُ اَلْأَرْبَعُ اَلْأَصَابِعِ وَ يُتْرَكُ لَهُ اَلْإِبْهَامُ يَعْتَمِدُ عَلَيْهَا فِي اَلصَّلاَةِ يَغْسِلُ بِهَا وَجْهَهُ لِلصَّلاَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5127 - Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Hilal narrated from his father from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as): "Tell me why the right hand and the left foot of a thief are cut off, but not the right hand and the right foot?"
Imam (as) replied: "What a good question you have asked! If his right hand and right foot were cut off, he would fall onto his left side and would not be able to stand. But when his right hand and left foot are cut off, he remains balanced and can stand upright."
I said: "May I be your ransom, how can he stand when his foot has been cut off?"
Imam (as) replied: "The cutting is not as you perceive it. The foot is cut off from the ankle, leaving part of the foot so that he can stand on it, perform prayer, and worship Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
I asked: "From where is the hand cut off?"
Imam (as) replied: "The four fingers are cut off, and the thumb is left for him so that he may lean on it during prayer and wash his face for prayer."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5128 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who stole a cluster of dates from an orchard worth two dirhams.
Imam (as) said: "His hand is to be cut off for that."
arabicText: 5128 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ سَرَقَ مِنْ بُسْتَانٍ عِذْقاً قِيمَتُهُ دِرْهَمَانِ قَالَ "يُقْطَعُ بِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5128 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who stole a cluster of dates from an orchard worth two dirhams.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "His hand is to be cut off for that."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5129 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Ḍurays Al-Kunasi from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
"If a male slave confesses to theft once before the Imam, his hand is to be cut off.
Likewise, if a female slave confesses to theft before the Imam, her hand is to be cut off."
arabicText: 5129 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ رِئَابٍ عَنْ ضُرَيْسٍ اَلْكُنَاسِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "اَلْعَبْدُ إِذَا أَقَرَّ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ عِنْدَ اَلْإِمَامِ مَرَّةً أَنَّهُ سَرَقَ قَطَعَهُ وَ اَلْأَمَةُ إِذَا أَقَرَّتْ عَلَى نَفْسِهَا عِنْدَ اَلْإِمَامِ بِالسَّرِقَةِ قَطَعَهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5129 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Ḍurays Al-Kunasi from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"If a male slave confesses to theft once before the Imam, his hand is to be cut off.
Likewise, if a female slave confesses to theft before the Imam, her hand is to be cut off."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for Theft
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5130 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abu Ayyub from Al-Fudayl ibn Yasar who said: I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say: "If a slave confesses to theft, his hand is not to be cut off. However, if two witnesses testify against him, his hand is to be cut off."
arabicText: 5130 - رَوَى ذَلِكَ اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ عَنِ اَلْفُضَيْلِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ: "إِذَا أَقَرَّ اَلْمَمْلُوكُ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ بِالسَّرِقَةِ لَمْ يُقْطَعْ وَ إِنْ شَهِدَ عَلَيْهِ شَاهِدَانِ قُطِعَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5130 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abu Ayyub from Al-Fudayl ibn Yasar who said:
thaqalaynMatn: I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say: "If a slave confesses to theft, his hand is not to be cut off. However, if two witnesses testify against him, his hand is to be cut off."

chapter: Chapter on the Implementation of Legal Punishments on the Mute, the Deaf, and the Blind
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5131 - Yunus narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar who said that one of the two Imams (peace be upon them) was asked about the legal punishments (hudud) for a mute, a deaf person, and a blind person.
Imam (as) said: "The legal punishments apply to them if they comprehend what they are doing."
arabicText: 5131 - رَوَى يُونُسُ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ: سُئِلَ أَحَدُهُمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ حَدِّ اَلْأَخْرَسِ وَ اَلْأَصَمِّ وَ اَلْأَعْمَى قَالَ "عَلَيْهِمُ اَلْحُدُودُ إِذَا كَانُوا يَعْقِلُونَ مَا يَأْتُونَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5131 - Yunus narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar who said that one of the two Imams (peace be upon them) was asked about the legal punishments (hudud) for a mute, a deaf person, and a blind person.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The legal punishments apply to them if they comprehend what they are doing."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for the One Who Consumes Usury After Proof
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5132 - Ishaq ibn Ammar and Samaah narrated from Abu Basir from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: I asked Imam - "What is the punishment for one who consumes usury after clear evidence (has been established)?"
Imam (as) replied: "He is to be disciplined. If he returns to it, he is disciplined again. If he repeats it a third time, he is to be killed."
arabicText: 5132 - رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ وَ سَمَاعَةُ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لَهُ مَا حَدُّ آكِلِ اَلرِّبَا بَعْدَ اَلْبَيِّنَةِ قَالَ "يُؤَدَّبُ فَإِنْ عَادَ أُدِّبَ فَإِنْ عَادَ قُتِلَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5132 - Ishaq ibn Ammar and Samaah narrated from Abu Basir from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam - "What is the punishment for one who consumes usury after clear evidence (has been established)?"
Imam (as) replied: "He is to be disciplined. If he returns to it, he is disciplined again. If he repeats it a third time, he is to be killed."

chapter: Chapter on the Legal Punishment for the One Who Consumes Carrion, Blood, and Pork
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5133 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
"One who consumes carrion, blood, or pork is to be disciplined. If he returns to it, he is disciplined again."
I asked: "And if he does it again?"
Imam (as) replied: "He is to be disciplined, but there is no execution upon him."
arabicText: 5133 - رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: "آكِلُ اَلْمَيْتَةِ وَ اَلدَّمِ وَ لَحْمِ اَلْخِنْزِيرِ عَلَيْهِ أَدَبٌ فَإِنْ عَادَ أُدِّبَ" قُلْتُ فَإِنْ عَادَ قَالَ "يُؤَدَّبُ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ قَتْلٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5133 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"One who consumes carrion, blood, or pork is to be disciplined. If he returns to it, he is disciplined again."
I asked: "And if he does it again?"
Imam (as) replied: "He is to be disciplined, but there is no execution upon him."

chapter: Chapter on Obligations When Multiple Legal Punishments Are Combined Upon a Man
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5134 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Zurarah from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said: "Any man upon whom multiple legal punishments (hudud) have been established, and among them is the punishment of death, the lesser punishments are to be carried out first, and then he is to be executed afterward."
arabicText: 5134 - رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ رِئَابٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "أَيُّمَا رَجُلٍ اِجْتَمَعَتْ عَلَيْهِ حُدُودٌ فِيهَا اَلْقَتْلُ يُبْدَأُ بِالْحُدُودِ اَلَّتِي هِيَ دُونَ اَلْقَتْلِ ثُمَّ يُقْتَلُ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5134 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Zurarah from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Any man upon whom multiple legal punishments (hudud) have been established, and among them is the punishment of death, the lesser punishments are to be carried out first, and then he is to be executed afterward."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5135 - Sulayman ibn Dawud Al-Minqari narrated from Hafs ibn Ghiyath who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as), "Who is responsible for carrying out the legal punishments (hudud) -the ruler or the judge?"
Imam (as) replied: "The implementation of the legal punishments belongs to the one who holds the authority of judgment."
arabicText: 5135 - رَوَى سُلَيْمَانُ بْنُ دَاوُدَ اَلْمِنْقَرِيُّ عَنْ حَفْصِ بْنِ غِيَاثٍ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَنْ يُقِيمُ اَلْحُدُودَ اَلسُّلْطَانُ أَوِ اَلْقَاضِي فَقَالَ "إِقَامَةُ اَلْحُدُودِ إِلَى مَنْ إِلَيْهِ اَلْحُكْمُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5135 - Sulayman ibn Dawud Al-Minqari narrated from Hafs ibn Ghiyath who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as), "Who is responsible for carrying out the legal punishments (hudud) -the ruler or the judge?"
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "The implementation of the legal punishments belongs to the one who holds the authority of judgment."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5136 - It has been narrated that a man brought another man to Commander of the Faithful (as) and said: "O' Commander of the Faithful, this man claimed that he had a wet dream involving my mother."
Commander of the Faithful (as) replied: "A dream is like a shadow; if you wish, I will flog his shadow for you."
Then Imam (as) said: "However, I will punish him so that he does not repeat such actions and harm the Muslims."
arabicText: 5136 - وَ رُوِيَ: "أَنَّ رَجُلاً جَاءَ بِرَجُلٍ إِلَى أَمِيرِ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقَالَ يَا أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ إِنَّ هَذَا زَعَمَ أَنَّهُ اِحْتَلَمَ بِأُمِّي فَقَالَ "إِنَّ اَلْحُلُمَ بِمَنْزِلَةِ اَلظِّلِّ فَإِنْ شِئْتَ جَلَدْتُ لَكَ ظِلَّهُ" ثُمَّ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "لَكِنِّي أُوجِعُهُ لِئَلاَّ يَعُودَ يُؤْذِي اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5136 - It has been narrated that a man brought another man to Commander of the Faithful (as) and said: "O' Commander of the Faithful,
thaqalaynMatn:
this man claimed that he had a wet dream involving my mother."
Commander of the Faithful (as) replied: "A dream is like a shadow; if you wish, I will flog his shadow for you."
Then Imam (as) said: "However, I will punish him so that he does not repeat such actions and harm the Muslims."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5137 - It has been narrated that two boys approached Commander of the Faithful (as) holding their wooden tablets and said: "O' Commander of the Faithful, judge between us."
Commander of the Faithful (as) replied: "Injustice in this matter is like injustice in legal rulings. Convey to your teacher on my behalf that if he strikes you more than three times, it will be taken as retribution against him on the Day of Judgment."
arabicText: 5137 - رُوِيَ: "أَنَّهُ دَنَا مِنْ أَمِيرِ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ صَبِيَّانِ بِيَدِهِمَا لَوْحَانِ فَقَالاَ يَا أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ خَايِرْ بَيْنَنَا قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "إِنَّ اَلْجَوْرَ فِي هَذَا كَالْجَوْرِ فِي اَلْأَحْكَامِ أَبْلِغَا مُؤَدِّبَكُمَا عَنِّي أَنَّهُ إِنْ ضَرَبَكُمَا فَوْقَ ثَلاَثٍ كَانَ ذَلِكَ قِصَاصاً يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ " ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5137 - It has been narrated that two boys approached Commander of the Faithful (as) holding their wooden tablets and said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"O' Commander of the Faithful, judge between us."
Commander of the Faithful (as) replied: "Injustice in this matter is like injustice in legal rulings. Convey to your teacher on my behalf that if he strikes you more than three times, it will be taken as retribution against him on the Day of Judgment."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5138 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Yunus from Abu Al-Hasan Al-Maḍi (as) who said:
"All those who commit major sins (kabaʾir), if the legal punishment (Hadd) is carried out on them twice, they are to be executed on the third offense."
arabicText: 5138 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْمَاضِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "أَصْحَابُ اَلْكَبَائِرِ كُلِّهَا إِذَا أُقِيمَ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلْحَدُّ مَرَّتَيْنِ قُتِلُوا فِي اَلثَّالِثَةِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5138 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Yunus from Abu Al-Hasan Al-Maḍi (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "All those who commit major sins (kabaʾir), if the legal punishment (Hadd) is carried out on them twice, they are to be executed on the third offense."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5139 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever we strike with a legal punishment (hadd) from the punishments of Allah (swt) and he dies, there is no blood money (diyyah) upon us. But whoever we strike with a legal punishment from the rights of the people and he dies, then his blood money is upon us."
arabicText:
5139 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ :
"مَنْ ضَرَبْنَاهُ حَدّاً مِنْ حُدُودِ اَللَّهِ فَمَاتَ فَلاَ دِيَةَ لَهُ عَلَيْنَا وَ مَنْ ضَرَبْنَاهُ حَدّاً مِنْ حُدُودِ اَلنَّاسِ فَمَاتَ فَإِنَّ دِيَتَهُ عَلَيْنَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5139 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever we strike with a legal punishment (hadd) from the punishments of Allah (swt) and he dies, there is no blood money (diyyah) upon us. But whoever we strike with a legal punishment from the rights of the people and he dies, then his blood money is upon us."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5140 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: A man came to the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) and said:
"My mother does not resist the hand of one who touches her."
The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said: "Then confine her."
The man replied: "I have done that."
The Prophet (sw) said: "Then prevent anyone from entering upon her."
The man said: "I have done that."
The Prophet (sw) then said: "Then restrain her, for you will not honor her with anything better than preventing her from violating the prohibitions of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
arabicText:
5140 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ:
"جَاءَ رَجُلٌ إِلَى رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَقَالَ إِنَّ أُمِّي لاَ تَدْفَعُ يَدَ لاَمِسٍ قَالَ "فَاحْبِسْهَا" قَالَ قَدْ فَعَلْتُ قَالَ "فَامْنَعْ مَنْ يَدْخُلُ عَلَيْهَا" قَالَ قَدْ فَعَلْتُ قَالَ "فَقَيِّدْهَا فَإِنَّكَ لاَ تَبَرُّهَا بِشَيْءٍ أَفْضَلَ مِنْ أَنْ تَمْنَعَهَا مِنْ مَحَارِمِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ " ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5140 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abu Abdullah (as) who said: A man came to the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) and said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"My mother does not resist the hand of one who touches her."
The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) said: "Then confine her."
The man replied: "I have done that."
The Prophet (sw) said: "Then prevent anyone from entering upon her."
The man said: "I have done that."
The Prophet (sw) then said: "Then restrain her, for you will not honor her with anything better than preventing her from violating the prohibitions of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5141 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn Ri'ab from Durays from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
"The legal punishments (hudud) that are the rights of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, cannot be pardoned except by the Imam. However, when it comes to the rights of people in a legal punishment, there is no harm if it is pardoned without the Imam's involvement."
arabicText: 5141 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ ضُرَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "لاَ يُعْفَى عَنِ اَلْحُدُودِ اَلَّتِي لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ دُونَ اَلْإِمَامِ فَأَمَّا مَا كَانَ مِنْ حَقِّ اَلنَّاسِ فِي حَدٍّ فَلاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يُعْفَى عَنْهُ دُونَ اَلْإِمَامِ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5141 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn Ri'ab from Durays from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The legal punishments (hudud) that are the rights of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, cannot be pardoned except by the Imam. However, when it comes to the rights of people in a legal punishment, there is no harm if it is pardoned without the Imam's involvement."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5142 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about a man who said to a woman, "O' adulteress," and she replied: "You are more adulterous than me."
Imam (as) said: "She is subject to the legal punishment (hadd) for the accusation she made against him. However, regarding her self-admission, she is not to be punished unless she confesses to that before the Imam four times."
arabicText: 5142 - وَ سُئِلَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَالَ لاِمْرَأَةٍ يَا زَانِيَةُ فَقَالَتْ أَنْتَ أَزْنَى مِنِّي قَالَ "عَلَيْهَا اَلْحَدُّ فِيمَا قَذَفَتْهُ بِهِ وَ أَمَّا فِي إِقْرَارِهَا عَلَى نَفْسِهَا فَلاَ تُحَدُّ حَتَّى تُقِرَّ بِذَلِكَ عِنْدَ اَلْإِمَامِ أَرْبَعَ مَرَّاتٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5142 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about a man who said to a woman, "O' adulteress," and she replied:
thaqalaynMatn:
"You are more adulterous than me."
Imam (as) said: "She is subject to the legal punishment (hadd) for the accusation she made against him. However, regarding her self-admission, she is not to be punished unless she confesses to that before the Imam four times."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5143 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"It is not permissible for a ruler who believes in Allah (swt) and the Last Day to administer more than ten lashes except in the case of a legal punishment (hadd)."
arabicText: 5143 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "لاَ يَحِلُّ لِوَالٍ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَ اَلْيَوْمِ اَلْآخِرِ أَنْ يَجْلِدَ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ عَشَرَةِ أَسْوَاطٍ إِلاَّ فِي حَدٍّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5143 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is not permissible for a ruler who believes in Allah (swt) and the Last Day to administer more than ten lashes except in the case of a legal punishment (hadd)."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5144 - In the narration of Ziyad ibn Marwan Al-Qandi from someone who reported from Abu Abdullah (as), he said: "The hand of a thief is not to be cut off during a year of famine for stealing anything edible, such as bread, meat, or cucumbers."
arabicText: 5144 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ زِيَادِ بْنِ مَرْوَانَ اَلْقَنْدِيِّ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "لاَ يُقْطَعُ اَلسَّارِقُ فِي سَنَةِ اَلْمَحْقِ فِي شَيْءٍ يُؤْكَلُ مِثْلِ اَلْخُبْزِ وَ اَللَّحْمِ وَ اَلْقِثَّاءِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5144 - In the narration of Ziyad ibn Marwan Al-Qandi from someone who reported from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The hand of a thief is not to be cut off during a year of famine for stealing anything edible, such as bread, meat, or cucumbers."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5145 - It was narrated from Adam ibn Ishaq from Abdullah ibn Muhammad Al-Jufi who said: I was with Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) when a letter from Hisham ibn Abd Al-Malik arrived regarding a man who had exhumed the grave of a woman, stolen her clothes, and committed intercourse with her. The people were divided on how to punish him: some said: "Kill him," while others said: "Burn him."
Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) wrote back to him:
"The sanctity of the deceased is like the sanctity of the living. His punishment is that his hand should be cut off for exhuming the grave and stealing the clothing, and the legal punishment for adultery is to be applied to him.
If he was married (muhsan), he is to be stoned, and if he was not married, he is to be flogged one hundred lashes."
arabicText: 5145 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ آدَمَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْجُعْفِيِّ قَالَ: كُنْتُ عِنْدَ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ع وَ جَاءَهُ كِتَابُ هِشَامِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَلْمَلِكِ فِي رَجُلٍ نَبَشَ اِمْرَأَةً فَسَلَبَهَا ثِيَابَهَا وَ نَكَحَهَا فَإِنَّ اَلنَّاسَ قَدِ اِخْتَلَفُوا عَلَيْنَا هَاهُنَا طَائِفَةٌ قَالُوا اُقْتُلُوهُ وَ طَائِفَةٌ قَالُوا أَحْرِقُوهُ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِلَيْهِ "أَنَّ حُرْمَةَ اَلْمَيِّتِ كَحُرْمَةِ اَلْحَيِّ حَدُّهُ أَنْ تُقْطَعَ يَدُهُ لِنَبْشِهِ وَ سَلْبِهِ اَلثِّيَابَ وَ يُقَامَ عَلَيْهِ اَلْحَدُّ فِي اَلزِّنَا إِنْ أُحْصِنَ رُجِمَ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ أُحْصِنَ جُلِدَ مِائَةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5145 - It was narrated from Adam ibn Ishaq from Abdullah ibn Muhammad Al-Jufi who said: I was with Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) when a letter from Hisham ibn Abd Al-Malik arrived regarding a man who had exhumed the grave of a woman, stolen her clothes, and committed intercourse with her.
thaqalaynMatn:
The people were divided on how to punish him: some said: "Kill him," while others said: "Burn him."
Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) wrote back to him:
"The sanctity of the deceased is like the sanctity of the living. His punishment is that his hand should be cut off for exhuming the grave and stealing the clothing, and the legal punishment for adultery is to be applied to him.
If he was married (muhsan), he is to be stoned, and if he was not married, he is to be flogged one hundred lashes."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5146 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
"Avert prescribed punishments through doubts. There is no intercession, no guarantee, and no oath in matters of prescribed punishments."
arabicText: 5146 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : "اِدْرَءُوا اَلْحُدُودَ بِالشُّبُهَاتِ وَ لاَ شَفَاعَةَ وَ لاَ كَفَالَةَ وَ لاَ يَمِينَ فِي حَدٍّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5146 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Avert prescribed punishments through doubts. There is no intercession, no guarantee, and no oath in matters of prescribed punishments."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5147 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), it is reported:
"Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) was presented with a man who had consumed alcohol.
Imam (as) asked him to recite the Qur'an, and the man recited it.
Then Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) took his cloak and threw it among the cloaks of the people and said to him, 'Retrieve your cloak.'
When he could not distinguish it, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) carried out the legal punishment on him."
arabicText: 5147 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "أَنَّ عَلِيّاً عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أُتِيَ بِشَارِبٍ فَاسْتَقْرَأَهُ اَلْقُرْآنَ فَقَرَأَهُ فَأَخَذَ رِدَاءَهُ فَأَلْقَاهُ مَعَ أَرْدِيَةِ اَلنَّاسِ ثُمَّ قَالَ لَهُ "خَلِّصْ رِدَاكَ" فَلَمْ يُخَلِّصْهُ فَحَدَّهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5147 - In the narration of Al-Sakuni from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), it is reported:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) was presented with a man who had consumed alcohol.
Imam (as) asked him to recite the Qur'an, and the man recited it.
Then Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) took his cloak and threw it among the cloaks of the people and said to him, 'Retrieve your cloak.'
When he could not distinguish it, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) carried out the legal punishment on him."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5148 - Abu Ayyub narrated from Al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
"In the book of Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), it is mentioned that He (as) would administer punishment using a whip, half a whip, or even a part of it - meaning in the legal punishments (hudud) when a young boy or girl, who had not yet reached maturity, was brought to him.
Yet, He (as) would not nullify any of Allah's (swt) prescribed punishments."
Imam Al Sadiq (as) was asked: "How would he strike with part of the whip?"
Imam (as) replied: "Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) would hold the whip by its middle and strike with it, or he would hold it by a third and strike with it, in proportion to their ages.
In this way, he would strike them with the whip without nullifying any of Allah's (swt) prescribed punishments, the Mighty and Majestic."
arabicText:
5148 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو أَيُّوبَ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ:
"إِنَّ فِي كِتَابِ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَضْرِبُ بِالسَّوْطِ وَ بِنِصْفِ اَلسَّوْطِ وَ بِبَعْضِهِ يَعْنِي فِي اَلْحُدُودِ إِذَا أُتِيَ بِغُلاَمٍ أَوْ جَارِيَةٍ لَمْ يُدْرِكَا وَ لَمْ يَكُنْ يُبْطِلُ حَدّاً مِنْ حُدُودِ اَللَّهِ" فَقِيلَ لَهُ كَيْفَ كَانَ يَضْرِبُ بِبَعْضِهِ قَالَ "كَانَ يَأْخُذُ اَلسَّوْطَ بِيَدِهِ مِنْ وَسَطِهِ فَيَضْرِبُ بِهِ أَوْ مِنْ ثُلُثِهِ فَيَضْرِبُ بِهِ عَلَى قَدْرِ أَسْنَانِهِمْ كَذَلِكَ يَضْرِبُهُمْ بِالسَّوْطِ وَ لاَ يُبْطِلُ حَدّاً مِنْ حُدُودِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ".

Imam Al Sadiq (as) was asked: "How would he strike with part of the whip?"
Imam (as) replied: "Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) would hold the whip by its middle and strike with it, or he would hold it by a third and strike with it, in proportion to their ages.
In this way, he would strike them with the whip without nullifying any of Allah's (swt) prescribed punishments, the Mighty and Majestic."

chapter: Chapter on Rare Cases of Legal Punishments
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5149 - Commander of the Faithful (as) delivered a sermon to the people and said: "Indeed, Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, has set boundaries, so do not transgress them. He (swt) has made obligations, so do not neglect them. And He  (swt) has remained silent on certain matters - not out of forgetfulness - so do not burden yourselves with them. This is a mercy from Allah (swt) for you, so accept it."
Then Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "What is lawful (halal) is clear, and what is unlawful (haram) is clear, and between them are doubtful matters. Whoever avoids what is doubtful regarding sin will be even more cautious in avoiding what is clearly sinful. The acts of disobedience are the sanctuary of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic. Whoever grazes near it is likely to fall into it."
