Hadith.5445 - Hammad ibn ʿIsa narrated from Ribʿi ibn Abdullah from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
"If a man appoints someone as his executor while that person is absent, the appointed person does not have the right to reject the will. However, if he appoints him while he is present in the same town, then he has the choice to either accept or decline it."
arabicText: 5445 - رَوَى حَمَّادُ بْنُ عِيسَى عَنْ رِبْعِيِّ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "إِنْ أَوْصَى رَجُلٌ إِلَى رَجُلٍ وَ هُوَ غَائِبٌ فَلَيْسَ لَهُ أَنْ يَرُدَّ وَصِيَّتَهُ وَ إِنْ أَوْصَى إِلَيْهِ وَ هُوَ بِالْبَلَدِ فَهُوَ بِالْخِيَارِ إِنْ شَاءَ قَبِلَ وَ إِنْ شَاءَ لَمْ يَقْبَلْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5445 - Hammad ibn ʿIsa narrated from Ribʿi ibn Abdullah from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man appoints someone as his executor while that person is absent, the appointed person does not have the right to reject the will. However, if he appoints him while he is present in the same town, then he has the choice to either accept or decline it."

chapter: Chapter on Refusing to Accept a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5446 - Ribʿi narrated from Al-Fuḍayl ibn Yasar from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) regarding a man who is appointed as an executor.
Imam (as) said: "If the will is sent to him from another town, he does not have the right to reject it. However, if he is in a city where others are available, then it is up to him to accept or decline it."
arabicText: 5446 - وَ رَوَى رِبْعِيٌّ عَنِ اَلْفُضَيْلِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ يُوصَى إِلَيْهِ قَالَ "إِذَا بُعِثَ بِهَا إِلَيْهِ مِنْ بَلَدٍ فَلَيْسَ لَهُ رَدُّهَا وَ إِنْ كَانَ فِي مِصْرٍ يُوجَدُ فِيهِ غَيْرُهُ فَذَاكَ إِلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5446 - Ribʿi narrated from Al-Fuḍayl ibn Yasar from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) regarding a man who is appointed as an executor.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If the will is sent to him from another town, he does not have the right to reject it. However, if he is in a city where others are available, then it is up to him to accept or decline it."

chapter: Chapter on Refusing to Accept a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5447 - Sahl ibn Ziyad narrated from Ali ibn Al-Rayyan, who said:
I wrote to Abu Al-Hasan (as) asking about a man whose father invited him to accept his will. Is it permissible for him to refuse accepting his father's will?
Imam (as) replied: "He does not have the right to refuse."
arabicText: 5447 - وَ رَوَى سَهْلُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلرَّيَّانِ قَالَ : كَتَبْتُ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلٌ دَعَاهُ وَالِدُهُ إِلَى قَبُولِ وَصِيَّتِهِ هَلْ لَهُ أَنْ يَمْتَنِعَ مِنْ قَبُولِ وَصِيَّةِ وَالِدِهِ فَوَقَّعَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "لَيْسَ لَهُ أَنْ يَمْتَنِعَ ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5447 - Sahl ibn Ziyad narrated from Ali ibn Al-Rayyan, who said:
I wrote to Abu Al-Hasan (as) asking about a man whose father invited him to accept his will. Is it permissible for him to refuse accepting his father's will?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "He does not have the right to refuse."

chapter: Chapter on Refusing to Accept a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5448 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Hisham ibn Salim from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who is entrusted with a will by another man but dislikes accepting it.
Abu Abdullah (as) said: "He should not abandon him in this situation."
arabicText: 5448 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يُوصِي إِلَى اَلرَّجُلِ بِوَصِيَّةٍ فَيَكْرَهُ أَنْ يَقْبَلَهَا فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "لاَ يَخْذُلْهُ عَلَى هَذِهِ اَلْحَالِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5448 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Hisham ibn Salim from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who is entrusted with a will by another man but dislikes accepting it.
thaqalaynMatn: Abu Abdullah (as) said: "He should not abandon him in this situation."

chapter: Chapter on Refusing to Accept a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5449 - Ali ibn Al-Hakam narrated from Sayf ibn Umayrah from Manṣur ibn Hazim from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
"If a man appoints his brother as his executor while he is absent, he does not have the right to reject the will. This is because if he had been present and refused to accept it, the testator would have sought someone else."
arabicText: 5449 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحَكَمِ عَنْ سَيْفِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ حَازِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "إِذَا أَوْصَى اَلرَّجُلُ إِلَى أَخِيهِ وَ هُوَ غَائِبٌ فَلَيْسَ لَهُ أَنْ يَرُدَّ وَصِيَّتَهُ لِأَنَّهُ لَوْ كَانَ شَاهِداً فَأَبَى أَنْ يَقْبَلَهَا طَلَبَ غَيْرَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5449 - Ali ibn Al-Hakam narrated from Sayf ibn Umayrah from Manṣur ibn Hazim from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man appoints his brother as his executor while he is absent, he does not have the right to reject the will. This is because if he had been present and refused to accept it, the testator would have sought someone else."

chapter: Chapter on the Age at Which a child's Bequest Becomes Valid
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5450 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Aban ibn Uthman from Abd Al-Rahman ibn Abi Abdullah from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
"When a boy reaches the age of ten, his will becomes valid."
arabicText: 5450 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "إِذَا بَلَغَ اَلْغُلاَمُ عَشْرَ سِنِينَ جَازَتْ وَصِيَّتُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5450 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Aban ibn Uthman from Abd Al-Rahman ibn Abi Abdullah from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When a boy reaches the age of ten, his will becomes valid."

chapter: Chapter on the Age at Which a child's Bequest Becomes Valid
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5451 - Ṣafwan ibn Yahya narrated from Musa ibn Bakr from Zurarah from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
"When a boy reaches the age of ten, whatever he does with his wealth - whether he frees a slave, gives charity, or makes a will within reasonable limits and rightful matters - is valid."
arabicText: 5451 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ بَكْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَ قَالَ : "إِذَا أَتَى عَلَى اَلْغُلاَمِ عَشْرُ سِنِينَ فَإِنَّهُ يَجُوزُ لَهُ فِي مَالِهِ مَا أَعْتَقَ أَوْ تَصَدَّقَ وَ أَوْصَى عَلَى حَدٍّ مَعْرُوفٍ وَ حَقٍّ فَهُوَ جَائِزٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5451 - Ṣafwan ibn Yahya narrated from Musa ibn Bakr from Zurarah from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When a boy reaches the age of ten, whatever he does with his wealth - whether he frees a slave, gives charity, or makes a will within reasonable limits and rightful matters - is valid."

chapter: Chapter on the Age at Which a child's Bequest Becomes Valid
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5452 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Abi Al-Maghra from Abu Baṣir from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said: "If a boy reaches the age of ten and makes a will for one-third of his wealth in a rightful cause, his will is valid. And if he is seven years old and makes a will for a small amount of his wealth in a rightful cause, his will is also valid."
arabicText: 5452 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْمَغْرَاءِ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "إِذَا بَلَغَ اَلْغُلاَمُ عَشْرَ سِنِينَ فَأَوْصَى بِثُلُثِ مَالِهِ فِي حَقٍّ جَازَتْ وَصِيَّتُهُ وَ إِذَا كَانَ اِبْنَ سَبْعِ سِنِينَ فَأَوْصَى مِنْ مَالِهِ بِالْيَسِيرِ فِي حَقٍّ جَازَتْ وَصِيَّتُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5452 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Abi Al-Maghra from Abu Baṣir from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a boy reaches the age of ten and makes a will for one-third of his wealth in a rightful cause, his will is valid. And if he is seven years old and makes a will for a small amount of his wealth in a rightful cause, his will is also valid."

chapter: Chapter on the Age at Which a child's Bequest Becomes Valid
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5453 - Ali ibn Al-Hakam narrated from Dawud ibn Al-Nuʿman from Abu Ayyub from Muhammad ibn Muslim, who said: I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say:
"If a boy is on his deathbed and makes a will before reaching maturity, his will is valid if it is for his close relatives, but it is not valid for strangers."
arabicText: 5453 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحَكَمِ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ اَلنُّعْمَانِ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ : "إِنَّ اَلْغُلاَمَ إِذَا حَضَرَهُ اَلْمَوْتُ فَأَوْصَى وَ لَمْ يُدْرِكْ جَازَتْ وَصِيَّتُهُ لِذَوِي اَلْأَرْحَامِ وَ لَمْ تَجُزْ لِلْغُرَبَاءِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5453 - Ali ibn Al-Hakam narrated from Dawud ibn Al-Nuʿman from Abu Ayyub from Muhammad ibn Muslim, who said: I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a boy is on his deathbed and makes a will before reaching maturity, his will is valid if it is for his close relatives, but it is not valid for strangers."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests Made Through Writing and Gestures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5454 - Abd Al-Ṣamad ibn Muhammad narrated from Hanan ibn Sadir from his father, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
"I entered upon Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Al-Hanafiyya, and his tongue had become paralyzed.
I instructed him to make his will, but he did not respond. So, I ordered a basin to be brought and filled it with sand.
I said to him, 'Write with your hand,' and he wrote his will in the sand with his hand, and I copied it onto a scroll."
arabicText:
5454 - رَوَى عَبْدُ اَلصَّمَدِ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ حَنَانِ بْنِ سَدِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ :
"دَخَلْتُ عَلَى مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ اِبْنِ اَلْحَنَفِيَّةِ وَ قَدِ اُعْتُقِلَ لِسَانُهُ فَأَمَرْتُهُ بِالْوَصِيَّةِ فَلَمْ يُجِبْ"
قَالَ "فَأَمَرْتُ بِطَسْتٍ فَجَعَلْتُ فِيهِ اَلرَّمْلَ فَوُضِعَ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ خُطَّ بِيَدِكَ فَخَطَّ وَصِيَّتَهُ بِيَدِهِ فِي اَلرَّمْلِ وَ نَسَخْتُ أَنَا فِي صَحِيفَةٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5454 - Abd Al-Ṣamad ibn Muhammad narrated from Hanan ibn Sadir from his father, from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I entered upon Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Al-Hanafiyya, and his tongue had become paralyzed.
I instructed him to make his will, but he did not respond. So, I ordered a basin to be brought and filled it with sand.
I said to him, 'Write with your hand,' and he wrote his will in the sand with his hand, and I copied it onto a scroll."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests Made Through Writing and Gestures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5455 - Muhammad ibn Ahmad Al-Ashari narrated from Al-Sindi ibn Muhammad from Yunus ibn Yaʿqub from Abu Maryam, who narrated from his father:
Umamah bint Abi Al-Aṣ - whose mother was Zaynab, the daughter of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) - was married to Imam Ali ibn Abi Ṭalib (as) after Sayyida Faṭimah {s.a} (passed away).
After the martyrdom of Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), Al-Mughirah ibn Al-Nawfal married her.
It was narrated that she became severely ill until her tongue became paralyzed. Imam Hasan ibn Ali (as) and Imam Hussain ibn Ali (as), the sons of Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), came to her while she was unable to speak.
They (as) began asking her, while Al-Mughirah disapproved.
They (as) asked: "Did you emancipate so-and-so and his family?" She nodded her head in agreement.
They (as) continued: "And this and that?"
She again nodded her head in affirmation but could not speak clearly.
Her gestures were accepted as valid in confirming her wishes.
arabicText:
5455 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ اَلْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنِ اَلسِّنْدِيِّ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ أَبِي مَرْيَمَ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ :
أَنَّ أُمَامَةَ بِنْتَ أَبِي اَلْعَاصِ وَ أُمُّهَا زَيْنَبُ بِنْتُ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ كَانَتْ تَحْتَ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي طَالِبٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بَعْدَ فَاطِمَةَ عَلَيْهَا اَلسَّلاَمُ فَخَلَفَ عَلَيْهَا بَعْدَ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلْمُغِيرَةُ بْنُ اَلنَّوْفَلِ فَذَكَرَ أَنَّهَا وَجِعَتْ وَجَعاً شَدِيداً حَتَّى اُعْتُقِلَ لِسَانُهَا فَجَاءَهَا اَلْحَسَنُ وَ اَلْحُسَيْنُ اِبْنَا عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ هِيَ لاَ تَسْتَطِيعُ اَلْكَلاَمَ فَجَعَلاَ يَقُولاَنِ لَهَا وَ اَلْمُغِيرَةُ كَارِهٌ لِذَلِكَ "أَعْتَقْتِ فُلاَناً وَ أَهْلَهُ"
فَجَعَلَتْ تُشِيرُ بِرَأْسِهَا نَعَمْ "وَ كَذَا وَ كَذَا" فَجَعَلَتْ تُشِيرُ بِرَأْسِهَا أَنْ نَعَمْ لاَ تُفْصِحُ بِالْكَلاَمِ فَأَجَازَ ذَلِكَ لَهَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5455 - Muhammad ibn Ahmad Al-Ashari narrated from Al-Sindi ibn Muhammad from Yunus ibn Yaʿqub from Abu Maryam, who narrated from his father:
thaqalaynMatn:
Umamah bint Abi Al-Aṣ - whose mother was Zaynab, the daughter of the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) - was married to Imam Ali ibn Abi Ṭalib (as) after Sayyida Faṭimah {s.a} (passed away).
After the martyrdom of Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), Al-Mughirah ibn Al-Nawfal married her.
It was narrated that she became severely ill until her tongue became paralyzed. Imam Hasan ibn Ali (as) and Imam Hussain ibn Ali (as), the sons of Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), came to her while she was unable to speak.
They (as) began asking her, while Al-Mughirah disapproved.
They (as) asked: "Did you emancipate so-and-so and his family?" She nodded her head in agreement.
They (as) continued: "And this and that?"
She again nodded her head in affirmation but could not speak clearly.
Her gestures were accepted as valid in confirming her wishes.

chapter: Chapter on Bequests Made Through Writing and Gestures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5456 - It was narrated from Ibrahim ibn Muhammad Al-Hamadhani, who said:
I wrote to Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) regarding a man who wrote something in his own handwriting but did not tell his heirs, "This is my will," nor did he say, "I have made a will." However, he wrote a document that contained what he intended to bequeath.
I asked whether it was obligatory for his heirs to fulfill what was written in his handwriting, even though he did not command them to do so.
Abu Al-Hasan (as) replied: "If he had children, they must carry out everything they find written in their father's document, whether it pertains to acts of righteousness or anything else."
arabicText: 5456 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْهَمَذَانِيِّ قَالَ : كَتَبْتُ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلٌ كَتَبَ كِتَاباً بِخَطِّهِ وَ لَمْ يَقُلْ لِوَرَثَتِهِ هَذِهِ وَصِيَّتِي وَ لَمْ يَقُلْ إِنِّي قَدْ أَوْصَيْتُ إِلاَّ أَنَّهُ كَتَبَ كِتَاباً فِيهِ مَا أَرَادَ أَنْ يُوصِيَ بِهِ هَلْ يَجِبُ عَلَى وَرَثَتِهِ اَلْقِيَامُ بِمَا فِي اَلْكِتَابِ بِخَطِّهِ وَ لَمْ يَأْمُرْهُمْ بِذَلِكَ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "إِنْ كَانَ لَهُ وُلْدٌ يُنْفِذُونَ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ يَجِدُونَ فِي كِتَابِ أَبِيهِمْ فِي وَجْهِ اَلْبِرِّ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5456 - It was narrated from Ibrahim ibn Muhammad Al-Hamadhani, who said:
I wrote to Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) regarding a man who wrote something in his own handwriting but did not tell his heirs, "This is my will," nor did he say, "I have made a will." However, he wrote a document that contained what he intended to bequeath.
I asked whether it was obligatory for his heirs to fulfill what was written in his handwriting, even though he did not command them to do so.
Abu Al-Hasan (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he had children, they must carry out everything they find written in their father's document, whether it pertains to acts of righteousness or anything else."

chapter: Chapter on Revoking a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5457 - Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Faḍḍal narrated from Ali ibn Uqbah from Burayd Al-ʿIjli from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
"The one who makes a will has the right to revoke it or make changes to it as long as he is alive."
arabicText: 5457 - رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِيِّ بْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ عُقْبَةَ عَنْ بُرَيْدٍ اَلْعِجْلِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لِصَاحِبِ اَلْوَصِيَّةِ أَنْ يَرْجِعَ فِيهَا وَ يُحْدِثَ فِي وَصِيَّتِهِ مَا دَامَ حَيّاً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5457 - Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Faḍḍal narrated from Ali ibn Uqbah from Burayd Al-ʿIjli from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The one who makes a will has the right to revoke it or make changes to it as long as he is alive."

chapter: Chapter on Revoking a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5458 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Bukayr ibn Aʿyan from Ubayd ibn Zurarah, who said: I heard Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) say:
"The one making a will has the right to revoke it, whether he is in good health or ill."
arabicText: 5458 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ بُكَيْرِ بْنِ أَعْيَنَ عَنْ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ : "لِلْمُوصِي أَنْ يَرْجِعَ فِي وَصِيَّتِهِ إِنْ كَانَ فِي صِحَّةٍ أَوْ مَرَضٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5458 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Bukayr ibn Aʿyan from Ubayd ibn Zurarah, who said: I heard Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) say:
thaqalaynMatn: "The one making a will has the right to revoke it, whether he is in good health or ill."

chapter: Chapter on Revoking a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5459 - Yunus ibn Abd Al-Rahman narrated from Abdullah ibn Muskan from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
"The Commander of the Faithful (as) ruled that the manumitted slave (Al-mudabbar) is to be freed from one-third of the estate. A man has the right to revoke his will, to add to it or reduce from it, as long as he has not passed away."
arabicText: 5459 - وَ رَوَى يُونُسُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "قَضَى أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّ اَلْمُدَبَّرَ مِنَ اَلثُّلُثِ وَ أَنَّ لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يَنْقُضَ وَصِيَّتَهُ فَيَزِيدَ فِيهَا وَ يَنْقُصَ مِنْهَا مَا لَمْ يَمُتْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5459 - Yunus ibn Abd Al-Rahman narrated from Abdullah ibn Muskan from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Commander of the Faithful (as) ruled that the manumitted slave (Al-mudabbar) is to be freed from one-third of the estate. A man has the right to revoke his will, to add to it or reduce from it, as long as he has not passed away."

chapter: Chapter on Revoking a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5460 - In the narration of Yunus ibn Abd Al-Rahman with his chain of transmission, Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) said:
"A man has the right to alter his will. He may free the one he had initially ordered to be owned, and he may grant ownership to the one he had initially ordered to be freed. He may give to the one he had previously deprived and deprive the one he had previously granted, as long as he has not retracted from his decision."
arabicText: 5460 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ يُونُسَ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بِإِسْنَادِهِ قَالَ قَالَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : "لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يُغَيِّرَ مِنْ وَصِيَّتِهِ فَيُعْتِقَ مَنْ كَانَ أَمَرَ بِتَمْلِيكِهِ وَ يُمَلِّكَ مَنْ كَانَ أَمَرَ بِعِتْقِهِ وَ يُعْطِيَ مَنْ كَانَ حَرَمَهُ وَ يَحْرِمَ مَنْ كَانَ أَعْطَاهُ مَا لَمْ يَكُنْ رَجَعَ عَنْهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5460 - In the narration of Yunus ibn Abd Al-Rahman with his chain of transmission, Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A man has the right to alter his will. He may free the one he had initially ordered to be owned, and he may grant ownership to the one he had initially ordered to be freed. He may give to the one he had previously deprived and deprive the one he had previously granted, as long as he has not retracted from his decision."

chapter: Chapter on One Who Makes a Bequest Exceeding One-Third While His Heirs Are Present and Approve it, if They Can Revoke it After His Death
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5461 - Hammad ibn ʿIsa narrated from Hariz from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who made a will in the presence of his heirs, and they approved it. However, after the man's death, they attempted to revoke the will.
Imam (as) said: "They do not have the right to revoke it. The will remains binding upon them once they had approved it during his lifetime."
arabicText: 5461 - رَوَى حَمَّادُ بْنُ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى بِوَصِيَّةٍ وَ وَرَثَتُهُ شُهُودٌ فَأَجَازُوا ذَلِكَ فَلَمَّا مَاتَ اَلرَّجُلُ نَقَضُوا اَلْوَصِيَّةَ هَلْ لَهُمْ أَنْ يَرُدُّوا مَا أَقَرُّوا بِهِ فَقَالَ "لَيْسَ لَهُمْ ذَلِكَ وَ اَلْوَصِيَّةُ جَائِزَةٌ عَلَيْهِمْ إِذَا أَقَرُّوا بِهَا فِي حَيَاتِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5461 - Hammad ibn ʿIsa narrated from Hariz from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who made a will in the presence of his heirs, and they approved it. However, after the man's death, they attempted to revoke the will.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "They do not have the right to revoke it. The will remains binding upon them once they had approved it during his lifetime."

chapter: Chapter on the Obligation of Executing the Bequest and the Prohibition of Altering it
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5462 - Hammad ibn ʿIsa narrated from Hariz from Muhammad ibn Muslim, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who made a will to give his wealth in the way of Allah (swt).
Imam (as) replied: "Give it to the one he specified in his will, even if that person is a Jew or a Christian. Indeed, Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, says:
'But whoever changes it after hearing it, the sin is only upon those who change it.'"
(Surah Al-Baqarah 2:181)
arabicText:
5462 - رَوَى حَمَّادُ بْنُ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ :
سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ أَوْصَى بِمَالِهِ فِي سَبِيلِ اَللَّهِ فَقَالَ "أَعْطِهِ لِمَنْ أَوْصَى لَهُ بِهِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ يَهُودِيّاً أَوْ نَصْرَانِيّاً إِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَقُولُ
۝ فَمَنْ بَدَّلَهُ بَعْدَ مٰا سَمِعَهُ فَإِنَّمٰا إِثْمُهُ عَلَى اَلَّذِينَ يُبَدِّلُونَهُ ۝.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5462 - Hammad ibn ʿIsa narrated from Hariz from Muhammad ibn Muslim, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who made a will to give his wealth in the way of Allah (swt).
Imam (as) replied: "Give it to the one he specified in his will, even if that person is a Jew or a Christian. Indeed, Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, says:
'But whoever changes it after hearing it, the sin is only upon those who change it.'"
(Surah Al-Baqarah 2:181)

chapter: Chapter on the Obligation of Executing the Bequest and the Prohibition of Altering it
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5463 - Sahl ibn Ziyad narrated from Muhammad ibn Al-Walid from Yunus ibn Yaʿqub:
A man in Hamadhan mentioned that his father had passed away. His father was unaware of this matter (the teachings of the Ahl Al-Bayt), and before his death, he made a will instructing that something be given in the way of Allah (swt).
Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about how to fulfill this will, and it was explained to Imam (as) that the deceased was unaware of the truth but had made a will at the time of his death.
Abu Abdullah (as) said: "If a man had made a will to me to distribute his wealth to a Jew or a Christian, I would fulfill it for them. Indeed, Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, says:
'But whoever changes it after hearing it, the sin is only upon those who change it. Verily, Allah (swt) is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.'" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:181)
Then Imam (as) added: "Look for someone who is engaged in these paths (meaning the frontier defense posts), and send it to him."
arabicText:
5463 - وَ رَوَى سَهْلُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ اَلْوَلِيدِ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ :
أَنَّ رَجُلاً كَانَ بِهَمَذَانَ ذَكَرَ أَنَّ أَبَاهُ مَاتَ وَ كَانَ لاَ يَعْرِفُ هَذَا اَلْأَمْرَ فَأَوْصَى بِوَصِيَّةٍ عِنْدَ اَلْمَوْتِ وَ أَوْصَى أَنْ يُعْطَى شَيْءٌ فِي سَبِيلِ اَللَّهِ فَسُئِلَ عَنْهُ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ كَيْفَ يُفْعَلُ بِهِ وَ أَخْبَرْنَاهُ أَنَّهُ كَانَ لاَ يَعْرِفُ هَذَا اَلْأَمْرَ وَ أَوْصَى بِوَصِيَّةٍ عِنْدَ اَلْمَوْتِ فَقَالَ "لَوْ أَنَّ رَجُلاً أَوْصَى إِلَيَّ أَنْ أَضَعَ مَالَهُ فِي يَهُودِيٍّ أَوْ نَصْرَانِيٍّ لَوَضَعْتُهُ فِيهِمْ إِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَقُولُ
۝ فَمَنْ بَدَّلَهُ بَعْدَ مٰا سَمِعَهُ فَإِنَّمٰا إِثْمُهُ عَلَى اَلَّذِينَ يُبَدِّلُونَهُ إِنَّ اَللّٰهَ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ ۝
فَانْظُرْ إِلَى مَنْ يَخْرُجُ فِي هَذِهِ اَلْوُجُوهِ يَعْنِي اَلثُّغُورَ فَابْعَثُوا بِهِ إِلَيْهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5463 - Sahl ibn Ziyad narrated from Muhammad ibn Al-Walid from Yunus ibn Yaʿqub:
thaqalaynMatn:
A man in Hamadhan mentioned that his father had passed away. His father was unaware of this matter (the teachings of the Ahl Al-Bayt), and before his death, he made a will instructing that something be given in the way of Allah (swt).
Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about how to fulfill this will, and it was explained to Imam (as) that the deceased was unaware of the truth but had made a will at the time of his death.
Abu Abdullah (as) said: "If a man had made a will to me to distribute his wealth to a Jew or a Christian, I would fulfill it for them. Indeed, Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, says:
'But whoever changes it after hearing it, the sin is only upon those who change it. Verily, Allah (swt) is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.'" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:181)
Then Imam (as) added: "Look for someone who is engaged in these paths (meaning the frontier defense posts), and send it to him."

chapter: Chapter on the Obligation of Executing the Bequest and the Prohibition of Altering it
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5464 - It was narrated from Abu Ṭalib Abdullah ibn Al-Ṣalt Al-Qummi that he said:
Al-Khalil ibn Hashim wrote to Dhu Al-Ri'asatayn, who was the governor of Nishapur, informing him that a man from the Magians had passed away and had bequeathed a portion of his wealth to the poor.
The executor in Nishapur took that wealth and distributed it among the poor Muslims.
Al-Khalil wrote to Dhu Al-Riʾasatayn about this matter, and Dhu Al-Riʾasatayn consulted Al-Maʾmun, who said: "I have no ruling on this issue."
Then he asked Abu Al-Hasan (as), and Abu Al-Hasan (as) replied:
"The Magian did not bequeath his wealth to the poor Muslims. Therefore, it is appropriate that an equivalent amount from the charity funds be taken and returned to the poor among the Magians."
arabicText: 5464 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي طَالِبٍ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ اَلصَّلْتِ اَلْقُمِّيِّ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : كَتَبَ اَلْخَلِيلُ بْنُ هَاشِمٍ إِلَى ذِي اَلرِّئَاسَتَيْنِ وَ هُوَ وَالِي نَيْسَابُورَ أَنَّ رَجُلاً مِنَ اَلْمَجُوسِ مَاتَ وَ أَوْصَى لِلْفُقَرَاءِ بِشَيْءٍ مِنْ مَالِهِ فَأَخَذَهُ اَلْوَصِيُّ بِنَيْسَابُورَ فَجَعَلَهُ فِي فُقَرَاءِ اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ فَكَتَبَ اَلْخَلِيلُ إِلَى ذِي اَلرِّئَاسَتَيْنِ بِذَلِكَ فَسَأَلَ اَلْمَأْمُونَ عَنْ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ لَيْسَ عِنْدِي فِي ذَلِكَ شَيْءٌ فَسَأَلَ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقَالَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "إِنَّ اَلْمَجُوسِيَّ لَمْ يُوصِ لِفُقَرَاءِ اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ وَ لَكِنْ يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يُؤْخَذَ مِقْدَارُ ذَلِكَ اَلْمَالِ مِنْ مَالِ اَلصَّدَقَةِ فَيُرَدَّ عَلَى فُقَرَاءِ اَلْمَجُوسِ ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5464 - It was narrated from Abu Ṭalib Abdullah ibn Al-Ṣalt Al-Qummi that he said:
Al-Khalil ibn Hashim wrote to Dhu Al-Ri'asatayn, who was the governor of Nishapur, informing him that a man from the Magians had passed away and had bequeathed a portion of his wealth to the poor.
The executor in Nishapur took that wealth and distributed it among the poor Muslims.
Al-Khalil wrote to Dhu Al-Riʾasatayn about this matter, and Dhu Al-Riʾasatayn consulted Al-Maʾmun, who said: "I have no ruling on this issue."
Then he asked Abu Al-Hasan (as), and Abu Al-Hasan (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Magian did not bequeath his wealth to the poor Muslims. Therefore, it is appropriate that an equivalent amount from the charity funds be taken and returned to the poor among the Magians."

chapter: Chapter on a person's Right Over His Wealth as Long as There Remains Some Life in Him
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5466 - Abdullah ibn Jabalah narrated from Samaah, from Abu Baṣir, from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) who said:
I asked Imam (as), "A man who has children, is it permissible for him to give his wealth to his relatives?"
Imam (as) replied: "It is his wealth; he may do with it as he wishes until death comes to him."
arabicText:
5466 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ جَبَلَةَ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ :
قُلْتُ لَهُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَكُونُ لَهُ اَلْوَلَدُ يَسَعُهُ أَنْ يَجْعَلَ مَالَهُ لِقَرَابَتِهِ قَالَ "هُوَ مَالُهُ يَصْنَعُ بِهِ مَا شَاءَ إِلَى أَنْ يَأْتِيَهُ اَلْمَوْتُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5466 - Abdullah ibn Jabalah narrated from Samaah, from Abu Baṣir, from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as), "A man who has children, is it permissible for him to give his wealth to his relatives?"
Imam (as) replied: "It is his wealth; he may do with it as he wishes until death comes to him."

chapter: Chapter on a person's Right Over His Wealth as Long as There Remains Some Life in Him
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5467 - And the confirmation of this is what Ṣafwan narrated from Murazim regarding a man who gives something from his wealth during his illness.
Imm (as) said: "If he clearly transfers it (during his lifetime), then it is valid. However, if he bequeaths it (for after his death), then it is only from one-third of his wealth."
arabicText: 5467 - وَ تَصْدِيقُ ذَلِكَ- مَا رَوَاهُ صَفْوَانُ عَنْ مُرَازِمٍ‌ فِي الرَّجُلِ يُعْطِي الشَّيْ‌ءَ مِنْ مَالِهِ فِي مَرَضِهِ قَالَ إِذَا أَبَانَ بِهِ فَهُوَ جَائِزٌ وَ إِنْ أَوْصَى بِهِ فَمِنَ الثُّلُثِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5467 - And the confirmation of this is what Ṣafwan narrated from Murazim regarding a man who gives something from his wealth during his illness.
Imm (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he clearly transfers it (during his lifetime), then it is valid. However, if he bequeaths it (for after his death), then it is only from one-third of his wealth."

chapter: Chapter on a person's Right Over His Wealth as Long as There Remains Some Life in Him
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5468 - As for the narration of Ali ibn Asbaṭ from Thaʿlabah from Abu Al-Hasan Amr ibn Shaddad Al-Azdi from Ammar ibn Musa from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"A man has the most right over his wealth as long as his soul remains in him. If he bequeaths all of it, it is permissible for him."
arabicText:
5468 - وَ أَمَّا حَدِيثُ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ عَنْ ثَعْلَبَةَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَمْرِو بْنِ شَدَّادٍ اَلْأَزْدِيِّ عَنْ عَمَّارِ بْنِ مُوسَى عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ:
"اَلرَّجُلُ أَحَقُّ بِمَالِهِ مَا دَامَ فِيهِ اَلرُّوحُ إِنْ أَوْصَى بِهِ كُلِّهِ فَهُوَ جَائِزٌ لَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5468 - As for the narration of Ali ibn Asbaṭ from Thaʿlabah from Abu Al-Hasan Amr ibn Shaddad Al-Azdi from Ammar ibn Musa from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A man has the most right over his wealth as long as his soul remains in him. If he bequeaths all of it, it is permissible for him."

chapter: Chapter on a person's Right Over His Wealth as Long as There Remains Some Life in Him
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5469 - And a confirmation of this is what was narrated by Ismaʿil ibn Abi Ziyad Al-Sakuni from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Abu Abdullah Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), that he was asked about a man who dies without leaving behind an heir or any male relative (Aṣabah).
Imam (as) said: "He may bequeath his wealth as he wishes among the Muslims, the poor, and the wayfarer."
arabicText: 5469 - وَ تَصْدِيقُ ذَلِكَ مَا رَوَاهُ إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ أَبِي زِيَادٍ اَلسَّكُونِيُّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَمُوتُ وَ لاَ وَارِثَ لَهُ وَ لاَ عَصَبَةَ قَالَ "يُوصِي بِمَالِهِ حَيْثُ يَشَاءُ فِي اَلْمُسْلِمِينَ وَ اَلْمَسَاكِينِ وَ اِبْنِ اَلسَّبِيلِ".

chapter: Chapter on the Bequest of One Who Intentionally Takes His Own Life
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5470 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abu Walad, who said: I heard Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) say:
"Whoever intentionally kills himself will be in the Fire of Hell, abiding therein forever."
Imam (as) was asked: "What if he had made a will (waṣiyyah) and then deliberately killed himself immediately after? Will his will be carried out?"
Imam (as) replied: "If he made the will before committing any harmful act against himself, whether by injury or any other action, then his will is valid regarding one-third of his wealth. However, if he made the will after having already harmed himself - by injuring himself or committing an act intending death - then his will is not valid."
arabicText: 5470 - رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي وَلاَّدٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ : "مَنْ قَتَلَ نَفْسَهُ مُتَعَمِّداً فَهُوَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ "خٰالِداً فِيهٰا" " قِيلَ لَهُ أَ رَأَيْتَ إِنْ كَانَ أَوْصَى بِوَصِيَّةٍ ثُمَّ قَتَلَ نَفْسَهُ مُتَعَمِّداً مِنْ سَاعَتِهِ تُنْفَذُ وَصِيَّتُهُ قَالَ "إِنْ كَانَ أَوْصَى قَبْلَ أَنْ يُحْدِثَ حَدَثاً فِي نَفْسِهِ مِنْ جِرَاحَةٍ أَوْ فِعْلٍ أُجِيزَتْ وَصِيَّتُهُ فِي ثُلُثِهِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ أَوْصَى بِوَصِيَّةٍ وَ قَدْ أَحْدَثَ فِي نَفْسِهِ جِرَاحَةً أَوْ فِعْلاً لَعَلَّهُ يَمُوتُ لَمْ تُجَزْ وَصِيَّتُهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5470 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abu Walad, who said: I heard Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) say:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Whoever intentionally kills himself will be in the Fire of Hell, abiding therein forever."
Imam (as) was asked: "What if he had made a will (waṣiyyah) and then deliberately killed himself immediately after? Will his will be carried out?"
Imam (as) replied: "If he made the will before committing any harmful act against himself, whether by injury or any other action, then his will is valid regarding one-third of his wealth. However, if he made the will after having already harmed himself - by injuring himself or committing an act intending death - then his will is not valid."

chapter: Chapter on Two Men Being Appointed as Executors of a Bequest, and Each Taking Charge of Half of the Estate
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5471 - Muhammad ibn Al-Hasan Al-Ṣaffar (may Allah (swt) be pleased with him) wrote to Abu Muhammad Imam Hasan ibn Ali Al-Askari (as) asking:
"A man appointed two individuals as executors of his will. Is it permissible for one of them to independently handle half of the inheritance and the other to manage the other half?"
Imam (as) responded in writing: "It is not appropriate for them to act contrary to the deceased's instructions. They should act according to what he commanded them, God willing."
arabicText: 5471 - كَتَبَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْحَسَنِ اَلصَّفَّارُ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ إِلَى أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : رَجُلٌ أَوْصَى إِلَى رَجُلَيْنِ أَ يَجُوزُ لِأَحَدِهِمَا أَنْ يَنْفَرِدَ بِنِصْفِ اَلتَّرِكَةِ وَ اَلْآخَرِ بِالنِّصْفِ فَوَقَّعَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "لاَ يَنْبَغِي لَهُمَا أَنْ يُخَالِفَا اَلْمَيِّتَ وَ يَعْمَلاَنِ عَلَى حَسَبِ مَا أَمَرَهُمَا إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5471 - Muhammad ibn Al-Hasan Al-Ṣaffar (may Allah (swt) be pleased with him) wrote to Abu Muhammad Imam Hasan ibn Ali Al-Askari (as) asking:
"A man appointed two individuals as executors of his will. Is it permissible for one of them to independently handle half of the inheritance and the other to manage the other half?"
Imam (as) responded in writing:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is not appropriate for them to act contrary to the deceased's instructions. They should act according to what he commanded them, God willing."

chapter: Chapter on Two Men Being Appointed as Executors of a Bequest, and Each Taking Charge of Half of the Estate
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5472 - In the book of Muhammad ibn Yaʿqub Al-Kulayni (may Allah (swt) have mercy on him), narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Ali ibn Al-Hasan Al-Mithami, from his two brothers Muhammad and Ahmad, from their father, from Dawud ibn Abi Yazid, from Burayd ibn Muawiyah, it is reported:
A man passed away and appointed two individuals as executors of his will. One of them said to his companion, "Take half of what he left behind, and give me the other half."
However, the other refused.
They sought guidance from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding this matter, and Imam (as) said:
"That rightfully belongs to him."
arabicText:
5472 - وَ فِي كِتَابِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ اَلْكُلَيْنِيِّ رَحِمَهُ اَللَّهُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْمِيثَمِيِّ عَنْ أَخَوَيْهِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَبِيهِمَا عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ أَبِي يَزِيدَ عَنْ بُرَيْدِ بْنِ مُعَاوِيَةَ قَالَ :
إِنَّ رَجُلاً مَاتَ وَ أَوْصَى إِلَى رَجُلَيْنِ فَقَالَ أَحَدُهُمَا لِصَاحِبِهِ خُذْ نِصْفَ مَا تَرَكَ وَ أَعْطِنِي اَلنِّصْفَ مِمَّا تَرَكَ فَأَبَى عَلَيْهِ اَلْآخَرُ فَسَأَلُوا أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ "ذَاكَ لَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5472 - In the book of Muhammad ibn Yaʿqub Al-Kulayni (may Allah (swt) have mercy on him), narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Ali ibn Al-Hasan Al-Mithami, from his two brothers Muhammad and Ahmad, from their father, from Dawud ibn Abi Yazid, from Burayd ibn Muawiyah, it is reported:
thaqalaynMatn:
A man passed away and appointed two individuals as executors of his will. One of them said to his companion, "Take half of what he left behind, and give me the other half."
However, the other refused.
They sought guidance from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding this matter, and Imam (as) said:
"That rightfully belongs to him."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests of a Portion of Wealth, a Share, a Part, or a Large Amount
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5473 - Aban ibn Taghlib narrated from Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) that Imam (as) was asked about a man who made a bequest (waṣiyyah) of something from his wealth.
Imam (as) replied: "The portion specified in the Book of (Imam) Ali (as) is one out of six parts."
arabicText: 5473 - رَوَى أَبَانُ بْنُ تَغْلِبَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى بِشَيْءٍ مِنْ مَالِهِ فَقَالَ "اَلشَّيْءُ فِي كِتَابِ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَاحِدٌ مِنْ سِتَّةٍ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5473 - Aban ibn Taghlib narrated from Imam Ali ibn Al-Hussain (as) that Imam (as) was asked about a man who made a bequest (waṣiyyah) of something from his wealth.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "The portion specified in the Book of (Imam) Ali (as) is one out of six parts."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests of a Portion of Wealth, a Share, a Part, or a Large Amount
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5474 - Al-Sakuni narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he was asked about a man who bequeaths a share (sahm) of his wealth.
Imam (as) replied: "The share is one out of eight parts, based on the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic:
"Indeed, the charities are only for the poor, the needy, those employed to collect them, those whose hearts are to be reconciled, for freeing slaves, for those in debt, in the way of Allah (swt), and for the stranded traveler." (Surah Al-Tawbah, 9:60)
arabicText: 5474 - وَ رَوَى اَلسَّكُونِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ يُوصِي بِسَهْمٍ مِنْ مَالِهِ فَقَالَ "اَلسَّهْمُ وَاحِدٌ مِنْ ثَمَانِيَةٍ لِقَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ۝ إِنَّمَا اَلصَّدَقٰاتُ لِلْفُقَرٰاءِ وَ اَلْمَسٰاكِينِ وَ اَلْعٰامِلِينَ عَلَيْهٰا وَ اَلْمُؤَلَّفَةِ قُلُوبُهُمْ وَ فِي اَلرِّقٰابِ وَ اَلْغٰارِمِينَ وَ فِي سَبِيلِ اَللّٰهِ وَ اِبْنِ اَلسَّبِيلِ ۝.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5474 - Al-Sakuni narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he was asked about a man who bequeaths a share (sahm) of his wealth.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The share is one out of eight parts, based on the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic:
"Indeed, the charities are only for the poor, the needy, those employed to collect them, those whose hearts are to be reconciled, for freeing slaves, for those in debt, in the way of Allah (swt), and for the stranded traveler." (Surah Al-Tawbah, 9:60)

chapter: Chapter on Bequests of a Portion of Wealth, a Share, a Part, or a Large Amount
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5475 - It has been narrated that "the share is one out of six."
arabicText: 5475 - وَ قَدْ رُوِيَ : "أَنَّ اَلسَّهْمَ وَاحِدٌ مِنْ سِتَّةٍ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5475 - It has been narrated that
thaqalaynMatn: "the share is one out of six."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests of a Portion of Wealth, a Share, a Part, or a Large Amount
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5476 - It is narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Faddal, from Thalabah ibn Maymun, from Muawiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who bequeathed a portion of his wealth.
Imam (as) replied: "A portion is one-tenth." Allah (swt), the Almighty, said:
"Then place on every mountain a portion (juz') of them" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:260), and the mountains were ten.
arabicText:
5476 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِيِّ بْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ ثَعْلَبَةَ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى بِجُزْءٍ مِنْ مَالِهِ فَقَالَ
"جُزْءٌ مِنْ عَشَرَةٍ قَالَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ۝ ثُمَّ اِجْعَلْ عَلىٰ كُلِّ جَبَلٍ مِنْهُنَّ جُزْءاً ۝ وَ كَانَتِ اَلْجِبَالُ عَشَرَةً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5476 - It is narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Faddal, from Thalabah ibn Maymun, from Muawiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) about a man who bequeathed a portion of his wealth.
Imam (as) replied: "A portion is one-tenth." Allah (swt), the Almighty, said:
"Then place on every mountain a portion (juz') of them" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:260), and the mountains were ten.

chapter: Chapter on Bequests of a Portion of Wealth, a Share, a Part, or a Large Amount
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5477 - It is narrated by Al-Bazanti from Al-Husayn ibn Khalid, who said:
I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about a man who bequeathed a portion of his wealth.
Imam (as) replied: "It is one-seventh of his one-third share."
arabicText: 5477 - وَ رَوَى اَلْبَزَنْطِيُّ عَنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى بِجُزْءٍ مِنْ مَالِهِ قَالَ "سُبُعُ ثُلُثِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5477 - It is narrated by Al-Bazanti from Al-Husayn ibn Khalid, who said:
I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about a man who bequeathed a portion of his wealth.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is one-seventh of his one-third share."

chapter: Chapter on a Man Who Makes a Bequest of Wealth in the Way of Allah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5478 - Muhammad bin Isa bin Ubaid narrated from Al-Hasan bin Rashid, who said:
I asked Abu Al-Hasan Al-Askari, (Imam Ali ibn Muhammad Al-Hadi (as)) about a man who made a will to dedicate wealth "in the way of Allah (swt)" (fi sabeelillah).
Imam (as) replied: "The way of Allah (swt) is our Shia (followers)."
arabicText: 5478 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عِيسَى بْنِ عُبَيْدٍ عَنِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْعَسْكَرِيَّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى بِمَالٍ فِي سَبِيلِ اَللَّهِ فَقَالَ "سَبِيلُ اَللَّهِ شِيعَتُنَا ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5478 - Muhammad bin Isa bin Ubaid narrated from Al-Hasan bin Rashid, who said:
I asked Abu Al-Hasan Al-Askari, (Imam Ali ibn Muhammad Al-Hadi (as)) about a man who made a will to dedicate wealth "in the way of Allah (swt)" (fi sabeelillah).
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "The way of Allah (swt) is our Shia (followers)."

chapter: Chapter on a Man Who Makes a Bequest of Wealth in the Way of Allah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5479 - Muhammad bin Isa narrated from Muhammad bin Sulayman from Al-Husayn bin Umar, who said: I said to Abu Abdullah (as), "A man made a will to me regarding something in the way of Allah (swt)."
Imam (as) said to me: "Use it for Hajj."
I said: "He made a will to me in the way."
Imam (as) said: "Use it for Hajj, for I do not know of any path among His (swt) paths better than Hajj."
arabicText: 5479 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عِيسَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ عَنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ عُمَرَ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ رَجُلاً أَوْصَى إِلَيَّ بِشَيْءٍ فِي سَبِيلِ اَللَّهِ فَقَالَ لِي "اِصْرِفْهُ فِي اَلْحَجِّ" قَالَ قُلْتُ أَوْصَى إِلَيَّ فِي اَلسَّبِيلِ قَالَ "اِصْرِفْهُ فِي اَلْحَجِّ فَإِنِّي لاَ أَعْلَمُ سَبِيلاً مِنْ سُبُلِهِ أَفْضَلَ مِنَ اَلْحَجِّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5479 - Muhammad bin Isa narrated from Muhammad bin Sulayman from Al-Husayn bin Umar, who said: I said to Abu Abdullah (as),
thaqalaynMatn:
"A man made a will to me regarding something in the way of Allah (swt)."
Imam (as) said to me: "Use it for Hajj."
I said: "He made a will to me in the way."
Imam (as) said: "Use it for Hajj, for I do not know of any path among His (swt) paths better than Hajj."

chapter: Chapter on the Liability of the Executor for Altering What the Deceased Had Bequeathed
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5480 - Muhammad bin Sinan narrated from Ibn Maskan from Abu Sa'id from Abu Abdullah (as) who was asked about a man who made a will for a Hajj and designated it as a will in favor of a person.
Imam (as) said: "His executor must fulfill it and ensure it is carried out as a Hajj, just as he had bequeathed. For Allah (swt), the Exalted, says:
'But whoever changes it after he has heard it, the sin is only upon those who change it.'"
(Surah Al-Baqarah 2:181)
arabicText: 5480 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنِ اِبْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي سَعِيدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سُئِلَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى بِحَجَّةٍ فَجَعَلَهَا وَصِيَّةً فِي نَسَمَةٍ فَقَالَ "يَغْرَمُهَا وَصِيُّهُ وَ يَجْعَلُهَا فِي حَجَّةٍ كَمَا أَوْصَى بِهِ فَإِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَقُولُ ۝ فَمَنْ بَدَّلَهُ بَعْدَ مٰا سَمِعَهُ فَإِنَّمٰا إِثْمُهُ عَلَى اَلَّذِينَ يُبَدِّلُونَهُ ۝.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5480 - Muhammad bin Sinan narrated from Ibn Maskan from Abu Sa'id from Abu Abdullah (as) who was asked about a man who made a will for a Hajj and designated it as a will in favor of a person.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "His executor must fulfill it and ensure it is carried out as a Hajj, just as he had bequeathed. For Allah (swt), the Exalted, says:
'But whoever changes it after he has heard it, the sin is only upon those who change it.'"
(Surah Al-Baqarah 2:181)

chapter: Chapter on the Liability of the Executor for Altering What the Deceased Had Bequeathed
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5481 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrated from Muhammad bin Marid who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who made a will to another man, instructing him to free a soul (a slave) for six hundred dirhams from his one-third share of the inheritance. However, the executor instead gave the six hundred dirhams to a man to perform Hajj on behalf of the deceased.
Abu Abdullah (as) said: "I believe the executor must personally pay six hundred dirhams from his own wealth and fulfill what the deceased had willed by freeing a soul."
arabicText: 5481 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَارِدٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى إِلَى رَجُلٍ وَ أَمَرَهُ أَنْ يُعْتِقَ عَنْهُ نَسَمَةً بِسِتِّمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ مِنْ ثُلُثِهِ فَانْطَلَقَ اَلْوَصِيُّ فَأَعْطَى اَلسِّتَّمِائَةِ رَجُلاً يَحُجُّ بِهَا عَنْهُ فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "أَرَى أَنْ يَغْرَمَ اَلْوَصِيُّ سِتَّمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ مِنْ مَالِهِ وَ يَجْعَلَهَا فِيمَا أَوْصَى بِهِ اَلْمَيِّتُ فِي نَسَمَةٍ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5481 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrated from Muhammad bin Marid who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who made a will to another man, instructing him to free a soul (a slave) for six hundred dirhams from his one-third share of the inheritance. However, the executor instead gave the six hundred dirhams to a man to perform Hajj on behalf of the deceased.
Abu Abdullah (as) said: "I believe the executor must personally pay six hundred dirhams from his own wealth and fulfill what the deceased had willed by freeing a soul."

chapter: Chapter on the Liability of the Executor for Altering What the Deceased Had Bequeathed
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5482 - Muhammad bin Abi Umayr narrated from Zayd Al-Narsi, from Ali bin Mazid, the companion of Al-Sabari, who said:
A man entrusted me with his estate and instructed me to perform Hajj on his behalf. When I examined the amount, I found it to be very little and insufficient for Hajj. I asked Abu Hanifa and the jurists of Kufa, and they said: 'Give it in charity on his behalf'.
Later, when I met Abdullah ibn Al-Hasan during Tawaf, I asked him and said:
'A man from your followers in Kufa passed away and entrusted his estate to me, instructing me to perform Hajj on his behalf. However, when I examined the amount, it was not enough for Hajj. I consulted the jurists in my area, and they advised me to give it in charity on his behalf, so I did. What do you say?'
He replied: Here is Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) in the Hijr, go to him and ask him.
So I entered the Hijr, and I saw Abu Abdullah (as) under the Mizab, facing the Kaaba, praying. Then Imam (as) turned, saw me, and asked: What is your need?
I said: A man passed away and entrusted his estate to me to perform Hajj on his behalf, but I found it insufficient for Hajj. I asked the jurists in my area, and they advised me to give it in charity, so I did.
Imam (as) said: What have you done (with the money)?
I replied: I gave it in charity.
Imam (as) said: You are liable - unless the amount was not enough for Hajj even from Mecca. If it was insufficient for Hajj from Mecca, then there is no liability on you. But if it was enough for Hajj from Mecca, then you are responsible.
arabicText: 5482 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ زَيْدٍ اَلنَّرْسِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مَزْيَدٍ صَاحِبِ اَلسَّابِرِيِّ قَالَ : أَوْصَى إِلَيَّ رَجُلٌ بِتَرِكَتِهِ وَ أَمَرَنِي أَنْ أَحُجَّ بِهَا عَنْهُ فَنَظَرْتُ فِي ذَلِكَ فَإِذَا شَيْءٌ يَسِيرٌ لاَ يَكْفِي لِلْحَجِّ فَسَأَلْتُ أَبَا حَنِيفَةَ وَ فُقَهَاءَ أَهْلِ اَلْكُوفَةِ فَقَالُوا تَصَدَّقْ بِهَا عَنْهُ فَلَمَّا لَقِيتُ عَبْدَ اَللَّهِ بْنَ اَلْحَسَنِ فِي اَلطَّوَافِ سَأَلْتُهُ فَقُلْتُ إِنَّ رَجُلاً مِنْ مَوَالِيكُمْ مِنْ أَهْلِ اَلْكُوفَةِ مَاتَ وَ أَوْصَى بِتَرِكَتِهِ إِلَيَّ وَ أَمَرَنِي أَنْ أَحُجَّ بِهَا عَنْهُ فَنَظَرْتُ فِي ذَلِكَ فَلَمْ يَكْفِ لِلْحَجِّ فَسَأَلْتُ مَنْ عِنْدَنَا مِنَ اَلْفُقَهَاءِ فَقَالُوا تَصَدَّقْ بِهَا عَنْهُ فَتَصَدَّقْتُ بِهَا فَمَا تَقُولُ فَقَالَ لِي هَذَا جَعْفَرُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ فِي اَلْحِجْرِ فَأْتِهِ فَاسْأَلْهُ فَدَخَلْتُ اَلْحِجْرَ فَإِذَا أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ تَحْتَ اَلْمِيزَابِ مُقْبِلٌ بِوَجْهِهِ إِلَى اَلْبَيْتِ يَدْعُو ثُمَّ اِلْتَفَتَ فَرَآنِي فَقَالَ "مَا حَاجَتُكَ" قُلْتُ رَجُلٌ مَاتَ وَ أَوْصَى بِتَرِكَتِهِ أَنْ أَحُجَّ بِهَا عَنْهُ فَنَظَرْتُ فِي ذَلِكَ فَلَمْ يَكْفِ لِلْحَجِّ فَسَأَلْتُ مَنْ عِنْدَنَا مِنَ اَلْفُقَهَاءِ فَقَالُوا تَصَدَّقْ بِهَا فَقَالَ "مَا صَنَعْتَ" قُلْتُ تَصَدَّقْتُ بِهَا فَقَالَ "ضَمِنْتَ إِلاَّ أَنْ لاَ يَكُونَ يَبْلُغُ مَا يُحَجُّ بِهِ مِنْ مَكَّةَ فَإِنْ كَانَ لاَ يَبْلُغُ مَا يُحَجُّ بِهِ مِنْ مَكَّةَ فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْكَ ضَمَانٌ وَ إِنْ كَانَ يَبْلُغُ مَا يُحَجُّ بِهِ مِنْ مَكَّةَ فَأَنْتَ ضَامِنٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5482 - Muhammad bin Abi Umayr narrated from Zayd Al-Narsi, from Ali bin Mazid, the companion of Al-Sabari, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
A man entrusted me with his estate and instructed me to perform Hajj on his behalf. When I examined the amount, I found it to be very little and insufficient for Hajj. I asked Abu Hanifa and the jurists of Kufa, and they said: 'Give it in charity on his behalf'.
Later, when I met Abdullah ibn Al-Hasan during Tawaf, I asked him and said:
'A man from your followers in Kufa passed away and entrusted his estate to me, instructing me to perform Hajj on his behalf. However, when I examined the amount, it was not enough for Hajj. I consulted the jurists in my area, and they advised me to give it in charity on his behalf, so I did. What do you say?'
He replied: Here is Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) in the Hijr, go to him and ask him.
So I entered the Hijr, and I saw Abu Abdullah (as) under the Mizab, facing the Kaaba, praying. Then Imam (as) turned, saw me, and asked: What is your need?
I said: A man passed away and entrusted his estate to me to perform Hajj on his behalf, but I found it insufficient for Hajj. I asked the jurists in my area, and they advised me to give it in charity, so I did.
Imam (as) said: What have you done (with the money)?
I replied: I gave it in charity.
Imam (as) said: You are liable - unless the amount was not enough for Hajj even from Mecca. If it was insufficient for Hajj from Mecca, then there is no liability on you. But if it was enough for Hajj from Mecca, then you are responsible.

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Relatives and Freed Slaves
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5483 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrated from Ali bin Ri'ab, from Zurara, from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) regarding a man who bequeathed one-third of his wealth to his paternal uncles and maternal uncles.
Imam (as) said: "Two-thirds are for his paternal uncles, and one-third is for his maternal uncles."
arabicText: 5483 - رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى بِثُلُثِ مَالِهِ فِي أَعْمَامِهِ وَ أَخْوَالِهِ فَقَالَ "لِأَعْمَامِهِ اَلثُّلُثَانِ وَ لِأَخْوَالِهِ اَلثُّلُثُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5483 - Al-Hasan bin Mahbub narrated from Ali bin Ri'ab, from Zurara, from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) regarding a man who bequeathed one-third of his wealth to his paternal uncles and maternal uncles.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Two-thirds are for his paternal uncles, and one-third is for his maternal uncles."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Relatives and Freed Slaves
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5484 - Sahl bin Ziyad Al-Adami wrote to Abu Muhammad (as) about a man who had sons and daughters and acknowledged that a piece of land belonged to his children without specifying, whether it should be divided according to Allah's (swt) shares and obligations, where the male receives double the share of the female.
Abu Muhammad (as) responded: "They should execute their father's will as he specified. If he did not specify anything, then it should be divided according to the Book of Allah (swt), the Exalted, if Allah (swt) wills."
arabicText: 5484 - وَ كَتَبَ سَهْلُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ اَلْأَدَمِيُّ إِلَى أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : رَجُلٌ لَهُ وُلْدٌ ذُكُورٌ وَ إِنَاثٌ فَأَقَرَّ بِضَيْعَةٍ أَنَّهَا لِوُلْدِهِ وَ لَمْ يَذْكُرْ أَنَّهَا بَيْنَهُمْ عَلَى سِهَامِ اَللَّهِ وَ فَرَائِضِهِ اَلذَّكَرُ وَ اَلْأُنْثَى فِيهِ سَوَاءٌ فَوَقَّعَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "يُنْفِذُونَ وَصِيَّةَ أَبِيهِمْ عَلَى مَا سَمَّى فَإِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ سَمَّى شَيْئاً رَدُّوهَا عَلَى كِتَابِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5484 - Sahl bin Ziyad Al-Adami wrote to Abu Muhammad (as) about a man who had sons and daughters and acknowledged that a piece of land belonged to his children without specifying, whether it should be divided according to Allah's (swt) shares and obligations, where the male receives double the share of the female.
Abu Muhammad (as) responded:
thaqalaynMatn: "They should execute their father's will as he specified. If he did not specify anything, then it should be divided according to the Book of Allah (swt), the Exalted, if Allah (swt) wills."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Relatives and Freed Slaves
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5485 - Muhammad bin Al-Hasan Al-Saffar, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, wrote to Abu Muhammad Imam Hasan ibn Ali Al-Askari (as) regarding a man who bequeathed one-third of his wealth to his male and female servants, either equally or with the instruction that "the male should receive the share of two females" from the bequest.
Abu Muhammad (as) replied: "It is permissible for the deceased to bequeath according to what he specified, if Allah (swt) the Exalted wills."
arabicText: 5485 - وَ كَتَبَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْحَسَنِ اَلصَّفَّارُ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ إِلَى أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : رَجُلٌ أَوْصَى بِثُلُثِ مَالِهِ فِي مَوَالِيهِ وَ مَوْلَيَاتِهِ اَلذَّكَرُ وَ اَلْأُنْثَى فِيهِ سَوَاءٌ أَوْ "لِلذَّكَرِ مِثْلُ حَظِّ اَلْأُنْثَيَيْنِ" مِنَ اَلْوَصِيَّةِ فَوَقَّعَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "جَائِزٌ لِلْمَيِّتِ مَا أَوْصَى بِهِ عَلَى مَا أَوْصَى بِهِ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5485 - Muhammad bin Al-Hasan Al-Saffar, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, wrote to Abu Muhammad Imam Hasan ibn Ali Al-Askari (as) regarding a man who bequeathed one-third of his wealth to his male and female servants, either equally or with the instruction that "the male should receive the share of two females" from the bequest.
Abu Muhammad (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is permissible for the deceased to bequeath according to what he specified, if Allah (swt) the Exalted wills."

chapter: Chapter on Appointing a Competent or an Incompetent Person as an Executor of a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5486 - Muhammad bin Isa bin Ubaid narrated from his brother Ja'far bin Isa bin Ubaid, from Ali bin Yaqtin, who said: I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about a man who appointed a woman as his executor and included a child with her in the will.
Imam (as) said: "This is permissible. The woman should carry out the will and does not need to wait for the child to reach maturity. However, when the child grows up, he has no right to object unless there has been an alteration or change in the will, in which case he has the right to restore it to what the deceased had originally intended."
arabicText: 5486 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عِيسَى بْنِ عُبَيْدٍ عَنْ أَخِيهِ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ عِيسَى بْنِ عُبَيْدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ يَقْطِينٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى إِلَى اِمْرَأَةٍ وَ أَشْرَكَ فِي اَلْوَصِيَّةِ مَعَهَا صَبِيّاً فَقَالَ "يَجُوزُ ذَلِكَ وَ تُمْضِي اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلْوَصِيَّةَ وَ لاَ تَنْتَظِرُ بُلُوغَ اَلصَّبِيِّ فَإِذَا بَلَغَ اَلصَّبِيُّ فَلَيْسَ لَهُ أَنْ لاَ يَرْضَى إِلاَّ مَا كَانَ مِنْ تَبْدِيلٍ أَوْ تَغْيِيرٍ فَإِنَّ لَهُ أَنْ يَرُدَّهُ إِلَى مَا أَوْصَى بِهِ اَلْمَيِّتُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5486 - Muhammad bin Isa bin Ubaid narrated from his brother Ja'far bin Isa bin Ubaid, from Ali bin Yaqtin, who said: I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about a man who appointed a woman as his executor and included a child with her in the will.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "This is permissible. The woman should carry out the will and does not need to wait for the child to reach maturity. However, when the child grows up, he has no right to object unless there has been an alteration or change in the will, in which case he has the right to restore it to what the deceased had originally intended."

chapter: Chapter on Appointing a Competent or an Incompetent Person as an Executor of a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5487 - Muhammad bin Al-Hasan Al-Saffar, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, wrote to Abu Muhammad Imam Hasan ibn Ali Al-Askari (as) about a man who made his children the  executors of his will, among them adults who are mature and minors who are not mature yet.
He asked if it was permissible for the adults to execute the will and settle their father's debts, proven against the deceased by trustworthy witnesses, before the minors reached maturity.
Abu Muhammad (as) replied: "It is obligatory upon the adult children to settle their father's debts and not delay this obligation."
arabicText: 5487 - وَ كَتَبَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْحَسَنِ اَلصَّفَّارُ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ إِلَى أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : رَجُلٌ أَوْصَى إِلَى وَلَدِهِ وَ فِيهِمْ كِبَارٌ قَدْ أَدْرَكُوا وَ فِيهِمْ صِغَارٌ أَ يَجُوزُ لِلْكِبَارِ أَنْ يُنْفِذُوا اَلْوَصِيَّةَ وَ يَقْضُوا دَيْنَهُ لِمَنْ صَحَّحَ عَلَى اَلْمَيِّتِ بِشُهُودٍ عُدُولٍ قَبْلَ أَنْ يُدْرِكَ اَلصِّغَارُ فَوَقَّعَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "عَلَى اَلْأَكَابِرِ مِنَ اَلْوُلْدِ أَنْ يَقْضُوا دَيْنَ أَبِيهِمْ وَ لاَ يَحْبِسُوهُ بِذَلِكَ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5487 - Muhammad bin Al-Hasan Al-Saffar, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, wrote to Abu Muhammad Imam Hasan ibn Ali Al-Askari (as) about a man who made his children the  executors of his will, among them adults who are mature and minors who are not mature yet.
He asked if it was permissible for the adults to execute the will and settle their father's debts, proven against the deceased by trustworthy witnesses, before the minors reached maturity.
Abu Muhammad (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is obligatory upon the adult children to settle their father's debts and not delay this obligation."

chapter: Chapter on the Beneficiary of a Bequest Dying Before the Testator or Before Receiving What Was Bequeathed to Him
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5488 - Amr ibn Sa'id Al-Mada'ini narrated from Muhammad ibn Umar Al-Sabati who said: I asked Abu Ja'far Al-Thani (as), (the second (as)), about a man who had appointed me as his executor and instructed to give something to his uncle every year. The uncle then passed away.
Abu Jafar (as) wrote in response: "Give it to his heirs."
arabicText: 5488 - رَوَى عَمْرُو بْنُ سَعِيدٍ اَلْمَدَائِنِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عُمَرَ اَلسَّابَاطِيِّ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ يَعْنِي اَلثَّانِيَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى إِلَيَّ وَ أَمَرَنِي أَنْ أُعْطِيَ عَمّاً لَهُ فِي كُلِّ سَنَةٍ شَيْئاً فَمَاتَ اَلْعَمُّ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "أَعْطِ وَرَثَتَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5488 - Amr ibn Sa'id Al-Mada'ini narrated from Muhammad ibn Umar Al-Sabati who said: I asked Abu Ja'far Al-Thani (as), (the second (as)), about a man who had appointed me as his executor and instructed to give something to his uncle every year. The uncle then passed away.
Abu Jafar (as) wrote in response:
thaqalaynMatn: "Give it to his heirs."

chapter: Chapter on the Beneficiary of a Bequest Dying Before the Testator or Before Receiving What Was Bequeathed to Him
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5489 - Asim ibn Humaid narrated from Muhammad ibn Qays from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said: "Commander of the Faithful (as) ruled concerning a man who made a bequest to another, but the person to whom the bequest was made was absent and died before the one who made the bequest.
Imam (as) said: 'The bequest is for the heir of the one to whom it was made.'
Imam (as) also said: 'Whoever makes a bequest to someone, whether present or absent, and the beneficiary dies before the one who made the bequest, then the bequest goes to the heir of the beneficiary, unless the testator revokes the bequest before his own death.'"
arabicText: 5489 - وَ رَوَى عَاصِمُ بْنُ حُمَيْدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ اَلْبَاقِرِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "قَضَى أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى لآِخَرَ وَ اَلْمُوصَى لَهُ غَائِبٌ فَتُوُفِّيَ اَلَّذِي أُوصِيَ لَهُ قَبْلَ اَلْمُوصِي قَالَ "اَلْوَصِيَّةُ لِوَارِثِ اَلَّذِي أُوصِيَ لَهُ" وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "مَنْ أَوْصَى لِأَحَدٍ شَاهِدٍ أَوْ غَائِبٍ فَتُوُفِّيَ اَلْمُوصَى لَهُ قَبْلَ اَلْمُوصِي فَالْوَصِيَّةُ لِوَارِثِ اَلَّذِي أُوصِيَ لَهُ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَرْجِعَ فِي وَصِيَّتِهِ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَمُوتَ" ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5489 - Asim ibn Humaid narrated from Muhammad ibn Qays from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Commander of the Faithful (as) ruled concerning a man who made a bequest to another, but the person to whom the bequest was made was absent and died before the one who made the bequest.
Imam (as) said: 'The bequest is for the heir of the one to whom it was made.'
Imam (as) also said: 'Whoever makes a bequest to someone, whether present or absent, and the beneficiary dies before the one who made the bequest, then the bequest goes to the heir of the beneficiary, unless the testator revokes the bequest before his own death.'"

chapter: Chapter on the Beneficiary of a Bequest Dying Before the Testator or Before Receiving What Was Bequeathed to Him
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5490 - Al-Abbas ibn Amir narrated from Muthanna who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man for whom a bequest was made, but he died before receiving it and left no offspring.
Imam (as) said: "Seek an heir or his mawla (guardian) and give it to him."
I asked: "What if no heir is known?"
Imam (as) replied: "Exert yourself in searching for an heir for him, and if you cannot find one and Allah (swt), the Exalted, knows of your sincere effort, then give it in charity."
arabicText: 5490 - وَ رَوَى اَلْعَبَّاسُ بْنُ عَامِرٍ عَنْ مُثَنًّى قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أُوصِيَ لَهُ بِوَصِيَّةٍ فَمَاتَ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَقْبِضَهَا وَ لَمْ يَتْرُكْ عَقِباً قَالَ "اُطْلُبْ لَهُ وَارِثاً أَوْ مَوْلًى فَادْفَعْهَا إِلَيْهِ" قُلْتُ فَإِنْ لَمْ يُعْلَمْ لَهُ وَلِيُّ قَالَ "اِجْهَدْ أَنْ تَقْدِرَ لَهُ عَلَى وَلِيٍّ فَإِنْ لَمْ تَجِدْهُ وَ عَلِمَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْكَ اَلْجَهْدَ فَتَصَدَّقْ بِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5490 - Al-Abbas ibn Amir narrated from Muthanna who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about a man for whom a bequest was made, but he died before receiving it and left no offspring.
Imam (as) said: "Seek an heir or his mawla (guardian) and give it to him."
I asked: "What if no heir is known?"
Imam (as) replied: "Exert yourself in searching for an heir for him, and if you cannot find one and Allah (swt), the Exalted, knows of your sincere effort, then give it in charity."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5491 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Muawiyah ibn Ammar who said:
A woman from my family entrusted me with her wealth and instructed that emancipation (of slaves) be made on her behalf, that Hajj be performed, and that charity be given. However, the amount left was insufficient to cover all that.
I consulted Abu Hanifah, and he said: "It should be divided into three parts - one-third for Hajj, one-third for emancipation, and one-third for charity."
Then I went to Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) and said to him:
"A woman from my family passed away and entrusted me with one-third of her wealth, instructing that Hajj be performed on her behalf, emancipation be made, and charity be given. But the amount was not enough to fulfill all these."
Imam (as) said: "Start with Hajj, for it is an obligation from the obligations of Allah (swt), the Exalted. Then divide what remains - part of it for emancipation and part for charity."
I informed Abu Hanifah of the statement of Abu Abdullah (as), and he withdrew his previous opinion and accepted the guidance of Abu Abdullah (as).
arabicText:
5491 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ :
أَوْصَتْ إِلَيَّ اِمْرَأَةٌ مِنْ أَهْلِ بَيْتِي بِمَالِهَا وَ أَمَرَتْ أَنْ يُعْتَقَ عَنْهَا وَ يُحَجَّ وَ يُتَصَدَّقَ فَلَمْ يَبْلُغْ ذَلِكَ فَسَأَلْتُ أَبَا حَنِيفَةَ فَقَالَ يُجْعَلُ ذَلِكَ أَثْلاَثاً ثُلُثاً فِي اَلْحَجِّ وَ ثُلُثاً فِي اَلْعِتْقِ وَ ثُلُثاً فِي اَلصَّدَقَةِ فَدَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ إِنَّ اِمْرَأَةً مِنْ أَهْلِي مَاتَتْ وَ أَوْصَتْ إِلَيَّ بِثُلُثِ مَالِهَا وَ أَمَرَتْ أَنْ يُعْتَقَ عَنْهَا وَ يُحَجَّ عَنْهَا وَ يُتَصَدَّقَ عَنْهَا فَنَظَرْتُ فِيهِ فَلَمْ يَبْلُغْ فَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "اِبْدَأْ بِالْحَجِّ فَإِنَّهُ فَرِيضَةٌ مِنْ فَرَائِضِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ اِجْعَلْ مَا بَقِيَ طَائِفَةً فِي اَلْعِتْقِ وَ طَائِفَةً فِي اَلصَّدَقَةِ" فَأَخْبَرْتُ أَبَا حَنِيفَةَ بِقَوْلِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَرَجَعَ عَنْ قَوْلِهِ وَ قَالَ بِقَوْلِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5491 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Muawiyah ibn Ammar who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
A woman from my family entrusted me with her wealth and instructed that emancipation (of slaves) be made on her behalf, that Hajj be performed, and that charity be given. However, the amount left was insufficient to cover all that.
I consulted Abu Hanifah, and he said: "It should be divided into three parts - one-third for Hajj, one-third for emancipation, and one-third for charity."
Then I went to Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) and said to him:
"A woman from my family passed away and entrusted me with one-third of her wealth, instructing that Hajj be performed on her behalf, emancipation be made, and charity be given. But the amount was not enough to fulfill all these."
Imam (as) said: "Start with Hajj, for it is an obligation from the obligations of Allah (swt), the Exalted. Then divide what remains - part of it for emancipation and part for charity."
I informed Abu Hanifah of the statement of Abu Abdullah (as), and he withdrew his previous opinion and accepted the guidance of Abu Abdullah (as).

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5492 - Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Faddal narrated from Dawud ibn Farqad who said:
Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about a man who was on a journey with a female slave and two male servant slaves. The man said to the two male slaves, "You both are free for the sake of Allah (swt). Bear witness that what is in the womb of this bondwoman is from me."
Later, the bondwoman gave birth to a boy. When they returned to the man's heirs, the heirs denied the claim and enslaved the boy and the two male servants. Afterward, the two male slaves were emancipated, and after their emancipation, they testified that their former master had made them witness that the child in the womb of the bondwoman was indeed his child.
Imam Jafar Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Their testimony is valid in favor of the boy, and the boy cannot enslave them because they have established his lineage."
arabicText: 5492 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِيِّ بْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ فَرْقَدٍ قَالَ : سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ كَانَ فِي سَفَرٍ وَ مَعَهُ جَارِيَةٌ لَهُ وَ غُلاَمَانِ مَمْلُوكَانِ فَقَالَ لَهُمَا أَنْتُمَا أَحْرَارٌ لِوَجْهِ اَللَّهِ فَاشْهَدَا أَنَّ مَا فِي بَطْنِ جَارِيَتِي هَذِهِ مِنِّي فَوَلَدَتْ غُلاَماً فَلَمَّا قَدِمُوا عَلَى اَلْوَرَثَةِ أَنْكَرُوا ذَلِكَ وَ اِسْتَرَقُّوهُمْ ثُمَّ إِنَّ اَلْغُلاَمَيْنِ أُعْتِقَا بَعْدُ فَشَهِدَا بَعْدَ مَا أُعْتِقَا أَنَّ مَوْلَيهُمَا اَلْأَوَّلَ أَشْهَدَهُمَا أَنَّ مَا فِي بَطْنِ جَارِيَتِهِ مِنْهُ قَالَ "تَجُوزُ شَهَادَتُهُمَا لِلْغُلاَمِ وَ لاَ يَسْتَرِقَّهُمَا اَلْغُلاَمُ اَلَّذِي شَهِدَا لَهُ لِأَنَّهُمَا أَثْبَتَا نَسَبَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5492 - Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Faddal narrated from Dawud ibn Farqad who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about a man who was on a journey with a female slave and two male servant slaves. The man said to the two male slaves, "You both are free for the sake of Allah (swt). Bear witness that what is in the womb of this bondwoman is from me."
Later, the bondwoman gave birth to a boy. When they returned to the man's heirs, the heirs denied the claim and enslaved the boy and the two male servants. Afterward, the two male slaves were emancipated, and after their emancipation, they testified that their former master had made them witness that the child in the womb of the bondwoman was indeed his child.
Imam Jafar Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Their testimony is valid in favor of the boy, and the boy cannot enslave them because they have established his lineage."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5493 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abu Jamilah from Humran from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) regarding a man who, on his deathbed, made a will saying, "Free so-and-so, and so-and-so, and so-and-so," until he mentioned five individuals. When his estate was assessed, it was found that one-third of his wealth was not enough to cover the value of the five slaves he had ordered to be freed.
Imam (as) said: "The individuals he named should be evaluated according to their order of mention, starting with the first. They should be valued, and their emancipation should proceed from the first he mentioned, then the second, the third, the fourth, and finally the fifth. If the one-third of the estate runs out before reaching the last, then the last named does not get freed because the man ordered their emancipation beyond the limit of what he lawfully owned, and thus it is not permissible."
arabicText: 5493 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَمِيلَةَ عَنْ حُمْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى عِنْدَ مَوْتِهِ وَ قَالَ أَعْتِقْ فُلاَناً وَ فُلاَناً وَ فُلاَناً حَتَّى ذَكَرَ خَمْسَةً فَنُظِرَ فِي ثُلُثِهِ فَلَمْ يَبْلُغْ ثُلُثُهُ أَثْمَانَ قِيمَةِ اَلْمَمَالِيكِ اَلْخَمْسَةِ اَلَّذِينَ أَمَرَ بِعِتْقِهِمْ قَالَ "يُنْظَرُ إِلَى اَلَّذِينَ سَمَّاهُمْ وَ بَدَأَ بِعِتْقِهِمْ فَيُقَوَّمُونَ وَ يُنْظَرُ إِلَى ثُلُثِهِ فَيُعْتَقُ مِنْهُ أَوَّلُ شَيْءٍ ذَكَرَ ثُمَّ اَلثَّانِي وَ اَلثَّالِثُ ثُمَّ اَلرَّابِعُ ثُمَّ اَلْخَامِسُ فَإِنْ عَجَزَ اَلثُّلُثُ كَانَ فِي اَلَّذِي سَمَّى آخِراً لِأَنَّهُ أَعْتَقَ بَعْدَ مَبْلَغِ اَلثُّلُثِ بِمَا لاَ يَمْلِكُ فَلاَ يَجُوزُ لَهُ ذَلِكَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5493 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abu Jamilah from Humran from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as)
thaqalaynMatn:
regarding a man who, on his deathbed, made a will saying, "Free so-and-so, and so-and-so, and so-and-so," until he mentioned five individuals. When his estate was assessed, it was found that one-third of his wealth was not enough to cover the value of the five slaves he had ordered to be freed.
Imam (as) said: "The individuals he named should be evaluated according to their order of mention, starting with the first. They should be valued, and their emancipation should proceed from the first he mentioned, then the second, the third, the fourth, and finally the fifth. If the one-third of the estate runs out before reaching the last, then the last named does not get freed because the man ordered their emancipation beyond the limit of what he lawfully owned, and thus it is not permissible."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5494 - Al-Alaa ibn Razin narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who, when death approached him, freed his slave and made a will, but the total of his bequests exceeded one-third of his estate.
Imam (as) replied: "The emancipation of the slave is to be carried out, and any reduction should be applied to what remains (of the bequests beyond the one-third limit)."
arabicText: 5494 - وَ رَوَى اَلْعَلاَءُ بْنُ رَزِينٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ حَضَرَهُ اَلْمَوْتُ فَأَعْتَقَ غُلاَمَهُ وَ أَوْصَى بِوَصِيَّةٍ فَكَانَ أَكْثَرَ مِنَ اَلثُّلُثِ قَالَ "يُمْضَى عِتْقُ اَلْغُلاَمِ وَ يَكُونُ اَلنُّقْصَانُ فِيمَا بَقِيَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5494 - Al-Alaa ibn Razin narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who, when death approached him, freed his slave and made a will, but the total of his bequests exceeded one-third of his estate.
Imam (as) replied: "The emancipation of the slave is to be carried out, and any reduction should be applied to what remains (of the bequests beyond the one-third limit)."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5495 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from Abu Hammam Ismail ibn Hammam from Abu Al-Hasan (as) regarding a man who, at the time of his death, made a will bequeathing wealth to his relatives and also freed a slave. However, the total of what he bequeathed exceeded one-third of his estate. He was asked how this should be handled concerning his will.
Imam (as) replied: "The emancipation (of the slave) should be carried out first."
arabicText: 5495 - وَ رَوَى أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ أَبِي هَمَّامٍ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ هَمَّامٍ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى عِنْدَ مَوْتِهِ بِمَالٍ لِذَوِي قَرَابَتِهِ وَ أَعْتَقَ مَمْلُوكاً فَكَانَ جَمِيعُ مَا أَوْصَى بِهِ يَزِيدُ عَلَى اَلثُّلُثِ كَيْفَ يُصْنَعُ فِي وَصِيَّتِهِ فَقَالَ "يُبْدَأُ بِالْعِتْقِ فَيُنْفَذُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5495 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from Abu Hammam Ismail ibn Hammam from Abu Al-Hasan (as) regarding a man who, at the time of his death, made a will bequeathing wealth to his relatives and also freed a slave. However, the total of what he bequeathed exceeded one-third of his estate. He was asked how this should be handled concerning his will.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "The emancipation (of the slave) should be carried out first."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
