author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5496 - Al-Nadr ibn Shuayb narrated from Khalid ibn Maad from Al-Jazi from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who passed away and left behind a slave woman of whom he had freed one-third. The executor of his will married her before any division of the inheritance had taken place.
Imam (as) said: "She should be appraised (for her full value), and both she and her husband must work to pay off the remaining value of her price after her appraisal. Whatever state - whether freedom or servitude - applies to the woman will also apply to her children."
arabicText: 5496 - وَ رَوَى اَلنَّضْرُ بْنُ شُعَيْبٍ عَنْ خَالِدِ بْنِ مَادٍّ عَنِ اَلْجَازِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ تُوُفِّيَ فَتَرَكَ جَارِيَةً أَعْتَقَ ثُلُثَهَا فَتَزَوَّجَهَا اَلْوَصِيُّ قَبْلَ أَنْ يُقْسَمَ شَيْءٌ مِنَ اَلْمِيرَاثِ "أَنَّهَا تُقَوَّمُ وَ تُسْتَسْعَى هِيَ وَ زَوْجُهَا فِي بَقِيَّةِ ثَمَنِهَا بَعْدَ مَا تُقَوَّمُ فَمَا أَصَابَ اَلْمَرْأَةَ مِنْ عِتْقٍ أَوْ رِقٍّ جَرَى عَلَى وَلَدِهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5496 - Al-Nadr ibn Shuayb narrated from Khalid ibn Maad from Al-Jazi from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who passed away and left behind a slave woman of whom he had freed one-third. The executor of his will married her before any division of the inheritance had taken place.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "She should be appraised (for her full value), and both she and her husband must work to pay off the remaining value of her price after her appraisal. Whatever state - whether freedom or servitude - applies to the woman will also apply to her children."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5497 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr Al-Bazanti narrated from Ahmad ibn Ziyad who said: I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about a man who was on his deathbed and had slaves solely for himself and others jointly owned with another person. In his will, he stated, "My slaves are free, except for those who are in partnership."
Imam (as) wrote in response: "They should be appraised against his estate, and if his wealth can cover it, then they are free."
arabicText: 5497 - وَ رَوَى أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ اَلْبَزَنْطِيُّ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ زِيَادٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ تَحْضُرُهُ اَلْوَفَاةُ وَ لَهُ مَمَالِيكُ لِخَاصَّةِ نَفْسِهِ وَ مَمَالِيكُ فِي اَلشِّرْكَةِ مَعَ رَجُلٍ آخَرَ فَيُوصِي فِي وَصِيَّتِهِ مَمَالِيكِي أَحْرَارٌ مَا خَلاَ مَمَالِيكِيَ اَلَّذِينَ فِي اَلشِّرْكَةِ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "يُقَوَّمُونَ عَلَيْهِ إِنْ كَانَ مَالُهُ يَحْتَمِلُ ثُمَّ هُمْ أَحْرَارٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5497 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr Al-Bazanti narrated from Ahmad ibn Ziyad who said: I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about a man who was on his deathbed and had slaves solely for himself and others jointly owned with another person. In his will, he stated,
thaqalaynMatn:
"My slaves are free, except for those who are in partnership."
Imam (as) wrote in response: "They should be appraised against his estate, and if his wealth can cover it, then they are free."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5498 - Muhammad ibn Ismaʿil ibn Baziʿ narrated from Ali ibn Al-Nuʿman, from Suwayd Al-Qallaʾ, from Ayyub ibn Al-Hurr, from Abu Bakr Al-Haḍrami, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as), "Alqamah ibn Muhammad instructed me in his will to free a slave on his behalf, so I freed a female slave for him. Is that sufficient, or should I free another from my own wealth?"
Imam (as) replied: "It suffices him." Then Imam (as) added, "Indeed, Faṭimah, the mother of my son, had instructed me to free a slave on her behalf, so I freed a female slave for her."
arabicText: 5498 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ بَزِيعٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلنُّعْمَانِ عَنْ سُوَيْدٍ اَلْقَلاَّءِ عَنْ أَيُّوبَ بْنِ اَلْحُرِّ عَنْ أَبِي بَكْرٍ اَلْحَضْرَمِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لَهُ إِنَّ عَلْقَمَةَ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ أَوْصَى أَنْ أُعْتِقَ عَنْهُ رَقَبَةً فَأَعْتَقْتُ عَنْهُ اِمْرَأَةً أَ فَتُجْزِيهِ أَوْ أُعْتِقُ عَنْهُ مِنْ مَالِي قَالَ "يُجْزِيهِ" ثُمَّ قَالَ "إِنَّ فَاطِمَةَ أُمَّ اِبْنِي أَوْصَتْ أَنْ أُعْتِقَ عَنْهَا رَقَبَةً فَأَعْتَقْتُ عَنْهَا اِمْرَأَةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5498 - Muhammad ibn Ismaʿil ibn Baziʿ narrated from Ali ibn Al-Nuʿman, from Suwayd Al-Qallaʾ, from Ayyub ibn Al-Hurr, from Abu Bakr Al-Haḍrami, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as), "Alqamah ibn Muhammad instructed me in his will to free a slave on his behalf, so I freed a female slave for him. Is that sufficient, or should I free another from my own wealth?"
Imam (as) replied: "It suffices him." Then Imam (as) added, "Indeed, Faṭimah, the mother of my son, had instructed me to free a slave on her behalf, so I freed a female slave for her."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5499 - Muawiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who died and had instructed that Hajj be performed on his behalf. Imam (as) replied: "If he had never performed Hajj (was a ṣarurah), then Hajj should be performed on his behalf from the middle of his wealth. But if he was not a ṣarurah, then it should be performed from one-third of his wealth."
arabicText: 5499 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ أَوْصَى أَنْ يُحَجَّ عَنْهُ قَالَ "إِنْ كَانَ صَرُورَةً حُجَّ عَنْهُ مِنْ وَسَطِ اَلْمَالِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ غَيْرَ صَرُورَةٍ فَمِنَ اَلثُّلُثِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5499 - Muawiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who died and had instructed that Hajj be performed on his behalf. Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he had never performed Hajj (was a ṣarurah), then Hajj should be performed on his behalf from the middle of his wealth. But if he was not a ṣarurah, then it should be performed from one-third of his wealth."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5500 - And Imam (as) said regarding a woman who bequeathed her wealth for emancipation (freeing slaves), performing Hajj, and giving charity, but her wealth was insufficient: "Begin with Hajj because it is an obligation. If anything remains, allocate a portion for charity and a portion for emancipation."
arabicText: 5500 - وَ قَالَ : فِي اِمْرَأَةٍ أَوْصَتْ بِمَالٍ فِي عِتْقٍ وَ حَجٍّ وَ صَدَقَةٍ فَلَمْ يَبْلُغْ قَالَ "اِبْدَأْ بِالْحَجِّ فَإِنَّهُ مَفْرُوضٌ فَإِنْ بَقِيَ شَيْءٌ فَاجْعَلْ فِي اَلصَّدَقَةِ طَائِفَةً وَ فِي اَلْعِتْقِ طَائِفَةً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5500 - And Imam (as) said regarding a woman who bequeathed her wealth for emancipation (freeing slaves), performing Hajj, and giving charity, but her wealth was insufficient:
thaqalaynMatn: "Begin with Hajj because it is an obligation. If anything remains, allocate a portion for charity and a portion for emancipation."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5501 - Ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah who said:
I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about a man who bequeathed thirty dinar for the emancipation of a man from among our companions, but no such person was found.
Imam (as) said: "A person should be purchased from among the people and then emancipated."
arabicText: 5501 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى بِثَلاَثِينَ دِينَاراً يُعْتَقُ بِهَا رَجُلٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا فَلَمْ يُوجَدْ بِذَلِكَ قَالَ "يُشْتَرَى مِنَ اَلنَّاسِ فَيُعْتَقُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5501 - Ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah who said:
I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about a man who bequeathed thirty dinar for the emancipation of a man from among our companions, but no such person was found.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A person should be purchased from among the people and then emancipated."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5502 - Ali ibn Abi Hamzah narrated from Imam (as) that he said: "Then let them purchase from among the general people as long as he is not a Naṣibi (one who harbors enmity towards the Ahl Al-Bayt (as))."
arabicText: 5502 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْهُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "فَلْيَشْتَرُوا مِنْ عُرْضِ اَلنَّاسِ مَا لَمْ يَكُنْ نَاصِبِيّاً ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5502 - Ali ibn Abi Hamzah narrated from Imam (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Then let them purchase from among the general people as long as he is not a Naṣibi (one who harbors enmity towards the Ahl Al-Bayt (as))."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5503 - Aban ibn Uthman narrated from Muhammad ibn Marwan from the Shaykh, meaning Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), from his father, Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), peace be upon them both, that Imam (as) said:
"Indeed, Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), passed away and left sixty servants. He freed one-third of them, then I drew lots among the remaining ones and freed another one-third."
arabicText: 5503 - وَ رَوَى أَبَانُ بْنُ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَرْوَانَ عَنِ اَلشَّيْخِ يَعْنِي مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : "إِنَّ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَاتَ وَ تَرَكَ سِتِّينَ مَمْلُوكاً فَأَعْتَقَ ثُلُثَهُمْ فَأَقْرَعْتُ بَيْنَهُمْ وَ أَعْتَقْتُ اَلثُّلُثَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5503 - Aban ibn Uthman narrated from Muhammad ibn Marwan from the Shaykh, meaning Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), from his father, Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), peace be upon them both, that Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), passed away and left sixty servants. He freed one-third of them, then I drew lots among the remaining ones and freed another one-third."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5504 - Al-Qasim Muhammad Al-Jawhari narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), about a freed woman whom my brother had emancipated. She used to serve the maidservants and was living among his family. He had instructed me to spend on her moderately.
Abu Jafar (as), said: "If she remained with the maidservants and continued serving them, then spend on her and follow his will."
arabicText: 5504 - وَ رَوَى اَلْقَاسِمُ مُحَمَّدٌ اَلْجَوْهَرِيُّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ مُحَرَّرَةٍ كَانَ أَعْتَقَهَا أَخِي وَ قَدْ كَانَتْ تَخْدُمُ اَلْجَوَارِيَ وَ كَانَتْ فِي عِيَالِهِ فَأَوْصَانِي أَنْ أُنْفِقَ عَلَيْهَا مِنَ اَلْوَسَطِ فَقَالَ "إِنْ كَانَتْ مَعَ اَلْجَوَارِي وَ أَقَامَتْ عَلَيْهِمْ فَأَنْفِقْ عَلَيْهَا وَ اِتَّبِعْ وَصِيَّتَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5504 - Al-Qasim Muhammad Al-Jawhari narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), about a freed woman whom my brother had emancipated. She used to serve the maidservants and was living among his family. He had instructed me to spend on her moderately.
thaqalaynMatn: Abu Jafar (as), said: "If she remained with the maidservants and continued serving them, then spend on her and follow his will."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for Manumission, Charity, and Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5505 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abu Ayyub from Sama'ah, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a man who had made a will that a soul be freed on his behalf from one-third of his wealth with five hundred dirhams. The executor of the will bought a soul for less than five hundred, and some amount remained. What do you say about the remaining amount?
Imam (as) said: "It should be given to the purchased soul before it is freed, and then it should be freed on behalf of the deceased."
arabicText: 5505 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى أَنْ يُعْتَقَ عَنْهُ نَسَمَةٌ مِنْ ثُلُثِهِ بِخَمْسِمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ فَاشْتَرَى اَلْوَصِيُّ نَسَمَةً بِأَقَلَّ مِنْ خَمْسِمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ وَ فَضَلَتْ فَضْلَةٌ فَمَا تَرَى فِي اَلْفَضْلَةِ قَالَ "تُدْفَعُ إِلَى اَلنَّسَمَةِ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ تُعْتَقَ ثُمَّ تُعْتَقُ عَنِ اَلْمَيِّتِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5505 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abu Ayyub from Sama'ah, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a man who had made a will that a soul be freed on his behalf from one-third of his wealth with five hundred dirhams. The executor of the will bought a soul for less than five hundred, and some amount remained. What do you say about the remaining amount?
Imam (as) said: "It should be given to the purchased soul before it is freed, and then it should be freed on behalf of the deceased."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for the Mukatab and Umm Al-Walad
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5506 - Asim ibn Humayd narrated from Muhammad ibn Qays from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
"The Commander of the Faithful (as), peace be upon him, ruled concerning a contracted slave (mukatab) who was married to a free woman. She made a bequest for him at the time of her death.
Imam (as) said: 'The people entitled to inheritance cannot have her will executed for him because he is a mukatab who has not been freed.'
Then Imam (as), peace be upon him, ruled that he would inherit in proportion to what had been freed of him and that the will for him would be valid in proportion to what had been freed of him."
Imam (as) also ruled regarding a mukatab for whom a will had been made, and he had paid half of what was due upon him, that half of the will was valid for him.
Imam (as) also ruled regarding a mukatab who had paid a quarter of what was due upon him and for whom a will had been made, that a quarter of the will was valid for him.
Imam (as) said about a man who made a will for his female mukatabah and she had paid one-sixth of what was due upon her, that the will was valid for her in proportion to what had been freed of her.
arabicText: 5506 - رَوَى عَاصِمُ بْنُ حُمَيْدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "قَضَى أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي مُكَاتَبٍ كَانَتْ تَحْتَهُ اِمْرَأَةٌ حُرَّةٌ فَأَوْصَتْ لَهُ عِنْدَ مَوْتِهَا بِوَصِيَّةٍ فَقَالَ "أَهْلُ اَلْمِيرَاثِ لاَ تَجُوزُ وَصِيَّتُهَا لَهُ إِنَّهُ مُكَاتَبٌ لَمْ يُعْتَقْ" فَقَضَى عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "أَنَّهُ يَرِثُ بِحِسَابِ مَا أُعْتِقَ مِنْهُ وَ يَجُوزُ لَهُ مِنَ اَلْوَصِيَّةِ بِحِسَابِ مَا أُعْتِقَ مِنْهُ" وَ قَضَى عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي مُكَاتَبٍ أُوصِيَ لَهُ بِوَصِيَّةٍ وَ قَدْ قَضَى نِصْفَ مَا عَلَيْهِ فَأَجَازَ لَهُ نِصْفَ اَلْوَصِيَّةِ وَ قَضَى فِي مُكَاتَبٍ قَضَى رُبُعَ مَا عَلَيْهِ فَأُوصِيَ لَهُ بِوَصِيَّةٍ فَأَجَازَ لَهُ رُبُعَ اَلْوَصِيَّةِ وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى لِمُكَاتَبَتِهِ وَ قَدْ قَضَتْ سُدُسَ مَا كَانَ عَلَيْهَا فَأَجَازَ لَهَا بِحِسَابِ مَا أُعْتِقَ مِنْهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5506 - Asim ibn Humayd narrated from Muhammad ibn Qays from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The Commander of the Faithful (as), peace be upon him, ruled concerning a contracted slave (mukatab) who was married to a free woman. She made a bequest for him at the time of her death.
Imam (as) said: 'The people entitled to inheritance cannot have her will executed for him because he is a mukatab who has not been freed.'
Then Imam (as), peace be upon him, ruled that he would inherit in proportion to what had been freed of him and that the will for him would be valid in proportion to what had been freed of him."
Imam (as) also ruled regarding a mukatab for whom a will had been made, and he had paid half of what was due upon him, that half of the will was valid for him.
Imam (as) also ruled regarding a mukatab who had paid a quarter of what was due upon him and for whom a will had been made, that a quarter of the will was valid for him.
Imam (as) said about a man who made a will for his female mukatabah and she had paid one-sixth of what was due upon her, that the will was valid for her in proportion to what had been freed of her.

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for the Mukatab and Umm Al-Walad
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5507 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Jamil ibn Salih from Abu Ubaydah, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a man who had a slave woman with whom he had a son. When death approached him, he bequeathed for her two thousand dirhams or more and instructed his heirs to enslave her.
Imam (as) said: "No, rather she should be freed from one-third of the deceased's estate and given what he had bequeathed for her."
arabicText: 5507 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَنْ أَبِي عُبَيْدَةَ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ كَانَتْ لَهُ أُمُّ وَلَدٍ وَ لَهُ مِنْهَا غُلاَمٌ فَلَمَّا حَضَرَتْهُ اَلْوَفَاةُ أَوْصَى لَهَا بِأَلْفَيْ دِرْهَمٍ أَوْ بِأَكْثَرَ لِلْوَرَثَةِ أَنْ يَسْتَرِقُّوهَا فَقَالَ "لاَ بَلْ تُعْتَقُ مِنْ ثُلُثِ اَلْمَيِّتِ وَ تُعْطَى مَا أَوْصَى لَهَا بِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5507 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Jamil ibn Salih from Abu Ubaydah, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a man who had a slave woman with whom he had a son. When death approached him, he bequeathed for her two thousand dirhams or more and instructed his heirs to enslave her.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "No, rather she should be freed from one-third of the deceased's estate and given what he had bequeathed for her."

chapter: Chapter on Bequests for the Mukatab and Umm Al-Walad
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5508 - It was narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr Al-Bazanti, who said:
I copied from a book in the handwriting of Abu Al-Hasan (as):
"A certain person, your master, passed away, leaving behind a paternal nephew who also passed away. The nephew left behind an umm walad (a concubine who bore him no children) and bequeathed to her a thousand dirhams. Does the bequest hold validity, and does she receive emancipation? What is her status? May I be your ransom, I seek your opinion on this matter."
Imam (as) wrote back: "She is to be freed from one-third (of the estate), and she has the bequest."
arabicText: 5508 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ اَلْبَزَنْطِيِّ قَالَ : نَسَخْتُ مِنْ كِتَابٍ بِخَطِّ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فُلاَنٌ مَوْلاَكَ تُوُفِّيَ اِبْنُ أَخٍ لَهُ فَتَرَكَ أُمَّ وَلَدٍ لَهُ لَيْسَ لَهَا وَلَدٌ وَ أَوْصَى لَهَا بِأَلْفِ دِرْهَمٍ هَلْ تَجُوزُ اَلْوَصِيَّةُ وَ هَلْ يَقَعُ عَلَيْهَا عِتْقٌ وَ مَا حَالُهَا رَأْيَكَ فَدَتْكَ نَفْسِي فِي ذَلِكَ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "تُعْتَقُ مِنَ اَلثُّلُثِ وَ لَهَا اَلْوَصِيَّةُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5508 - It was narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr Al-Bazanti, who said:
I copied from a book in the handwriting of Abu Al-Hasan (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"A certain person, your master, passed away, leaving behind a paternal nephew who also passed away. The nephew left behind an umm walad (a concubine who bore him no children) and bequeathed to her a thousand dirhams. Does the bequest hold validity, and does she receive emancipation? What is her status? May I be your ransom, I seek your opinion on this matter."
Imam (as) wrote back: "She is to be freed from one-third (of the estate), and she has the bequest."

chapter: Chapter on a Man Making a Bequest of a Sword, a Chest, or a Ship to Another Man
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5509 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr narrated from Abu Jamilah from Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as), who said:
I asked him about a man who bequeathed a sword to another man, and the sword was in its sheath and adorned with decorations. The heirs said to him, "Only the blade belongs to you, not the sword (with its accessories)."
Imam (as) said: "No, rather the sword with everything it contains belongs to him."
I said to Imam (as): "A man bequeathed a box to another man, and there was money inside it. The heirs said: 'Only the box belongs to you, not the money.'"
Imam (as) said: "The box with everything it contains belongs to him."
arabicText: 5509 - رَوَى أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَمِيلَةَ عَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى لِرَجُلٍ بِسَيْفٍ وَ كَانَ فِي جَفْنٍ وَ عَلَيْهِ حِلْيَةٌ فَقَالَ لَهُ اَلْوَرَثَةُ إِنَّمَا لَكَ اَلنَّصْلُ وَ لَيْسَ لَكَ اَلسَّيْفُ فَقَالَ "لاَ بَلِ اَلسَّيْفُ بِمَا فِيهِ لَهُ" قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ رَجُلٌ أَوْصَى بِصُنْدُوقٍ لِرَجُلٍ وَ كَانَ فِيهِ مَالٌ فَقَالَ اَلْوَرَثَةُ إِنَّمَا لَكَ اَلصُّنْدُوقُ وَ لَيْسَ لَكَ اَلْمَالُ فَقَالَ "اَلصُّنْدُوقُ بِمَا فِيهِ لَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5509 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr narrated from Abu Jamilah from Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked him about a man who bequeathed a sword to another man, and the sword was in its sheath and adorned with decorations. The heirs said to him, "Only the blade belongs to you, not the sword (with its accessories)."
Imam (as) said: "No, rather the sword with everything it contains belongs to him."
I said to Imam (as): "A man bequeathed a box to another man, and there was money inside it. The heirs said: 'Only the box belongs to you, not the money.'"
Imam (as) said: "The box with everything it contains belongs to him."

chapter: Chapter on a Man Making a Bequest of a Sword, a Chest, or a Ship to Another Man
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5510 - Muhammad ibn Al-Husayn narrated from Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Hilal from Uqbah ibn Khalid from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: I asked Imam (as) about a man who said:
"This ship belongs to so-and-so," without specifying what was inside it, and there was food in it. Should the man be given the ship and what is inside it?
Imam (as) said: "It belongs to the one to whom it was bequeathed, unless its owner explicitly excluded what was inside it. The heirs have no claim over it."
arabicText: 5510 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ هِلاَلٍ عَنْ عُقْبَةَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَالَ هَذِهِ اَلسَّفِينَةُ لِفُلاَنٍ وَ لَمْ يُسَمِّ مَا فِيهَا وَ فِيهَا طَعَامٌ أَ يُعْطَاهَا اَلرَّجُلُ وَ مَا فِيهَا قَالَ "هِيَ لِلَّذِي أَوْصَى لَهُ بِهَا إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ صَاحِبُهَا اِسْتَثْنَى مَا فِيهَا وَ لَيْسَ لِلْوَرَثَةِ شَيْءٌ ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5510 - Muhammad ibn Al-Husayn narrated from Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Hilal from Uqbah ibn Khalid from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: I asked Imam (as) about a man who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"This ship belongs to so-and-so," without specifying what was inside it, and there was food in it. Should the man be given the ship and what is inside it?
Imam (as) said: "It belongs to the one to whom it was bequeathed, unless its owner explicitly excluded what was inside it. The heirs have no claim over it."

chapter: Chapter on One Who Does Not Make a Bequest While Having Heirs, if His Estate Divided Among Them or Sold for Their Benefit
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5511 - Zur'ah narrated from Sama'ah, who said: I asked Imam (as) about a man who died and left behind sons and daughters, both young and old, without leaving a will. He also had servants, slaves, and jewelry. How should the heirs divide that inheritance?
Imam (as) said: "If a trustworthy man undertakes the division of all that among them, then there is no harm in it."
arabicText: 5511 - رَوَى زُرْعَةُ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ لَهُ بَنُونَ وَ بَنَاتٌ صِغَارٌ وَ كِبَارٌ مِنْ غَيْرِ وَصِيَّةٍ وَ لَهُ خَدَمٌ وَ مَمَالِيكُ وَ عُقَدٌ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ اَلْوَرَثَةُ بِقِسْمَةِ ذَلِكَ اَلْمِيرَاثِ قَالَ "إِنْ قَامَ رَجُلٌ ثِقَةٌ قَاسَمَهُمْ ذَلِكَ كُلَّهُ فَلاَ بَأْسَ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5511 - Zur'ah narrated from Sama'ah, who said: I asked Imam (as) about a man who died and left behind sons and daughters, both young and old, without leaving a will. He also had servants, slaves, and jewelry. How should the heirs divide that inheritance?
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If a trustworthy man undertakes the division of all that among them, then there is no harm in it."

chapter: Chapter on One Who Does Not Make a Bequest While Having Heirs, if His Estate Divided Among Them or Sold for Their Benefit
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5512 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn Ri'ab, who said:
I asked Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), about a man related to me who died and left behind young children and male and female slaves. He did not leave a will.
What is your opinion regarding someone who buys a female slave from them and takes her as an umm walad (a concubine who bears a child)? And what is your opinion on selling them?
Imam (as) said: "If they have a guardian who manages their affairs, sells on their behalf, and looks after their interests, then he will be rewarded for it."
I said: "What do you say about someone who buys a female slave from them and takes her as an umm walad?"
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in that if the guardian responsible for their welfare sells to him, considering what is in their best interest. They have no right to revoke what the guardian, acting in their best interest, has done."
arabicText:
5512 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ قَالَ :
سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ بَيْنِي وَ بَيْنَهُ قَرَابَةٌ مَاتَ وَ تَرَكَ أَوْلاَداً صِغَاراً وَ تَرَكَ مَمَالِيكَ لَهُ غِلْمَاناً وَ جَوَارِيَ وَ لَمْ يُوصِ فَمَا تَرَى فِيمَنْ يَشْتَرِي مِنْهُمُ اَلْجَارِيَةَ فَيَتَّخِذُهَا أُمَّ وَلَدٍ وَ مَا تَرَى فِي بَيْعِهِمْ فَقَالَ "إِنْ كَانَ لَهُمْ وَلِيٌّ يَقُومُ بِأَمْرِهِمْ بَاعَ عَلَيْهِمْ وَ نَظَرَ لَهُمْ كَانَ مَأْجُوراً فِيهِمْ" قُلْتُ فَمَا تَرَى فِيمَنْ يَشْتَرِي مِنْهُمُ اَلْجَارِيَةَ فَيَتَّخِذُهَا أُمَّ وَلَدٍ قَالَ "لاَ بَأْسَ بِذَلِكَ إِذَا بَاعَ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلْقَيِّمُ لَهُمْ اَلنَّاظِرُ فِيمَا يُصْلِحُهُمْ وَ لَيْسَ لَهُمْ أَنْ يَرْجِعُوا عَمَّا صَنَعَ اَلْقَيِّمُ لَهُمُ اَلنَّاظِرُ فِيمَا يُصْلِحُهُمْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5512 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn Ri'ab, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), about a man related to me who died and left behind young children and male and female slaves. He did not leave a will.
What is your opinion regarding someone who buys a female slave from them and takes her as an umm walad (a concubine who bears a child)? And what is your opinion on selling them?
Imam (as) said: "If they have a guardian who manages their affairs, sells on their behalf, and looks after their interests, then he will be rewarded for it."
I said: "What do you say about someone who buys a female slave from them and takes her as an umm walad?"
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in that if the guardian responsible for their welfare sells to him, considering what is in their best interest. They have no right to revoke what the guardian, acting in their best interest, has done."

chapter: Chapter on a Man Who Makes a Bequest, but the Executor Forgets it and Only Remembers One Part of it
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5513 - Muhammad ibn Al-Hasan Al-Saffar, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Muhammad ibn Rayyan, who said:
I wrote to Imam (as) - meaning Imam Ali ibn Muhammad Al-Hadi (as) - asking about a person who had made a will, but the executor only remembered one part of it. What should be done with the remaining parts?
Imam (as) replied: "Allocate the remaining parts to charitable acts."
arabicText: 5513 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْحَسَنِ اَلصَّفَّارُ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ رَيَّانَ قَالَ : كَتَبْتُ إِلَيْهِ يَعْنِي عَلِيَّ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَسْأَلُهُ عَنْ إِنْسَانٍ أَوْصَى بِوَصِيَّةٍ فَلَمْ يَحْفَظِ اَلْوَصِيُّ إِلاَّ بَاباً وَاحِداً مِنْهَا كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ فِي اَلْبَاقِي فَوَقَّعَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "اَلْأَبْوَابَ اَلْبَاقِيَةَ اِجْعَلْهَا فِي اَلْبِرِّ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5513 - Muhammad ibn Al-Hasan Al-Saffar, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Muhammad ibn Rayyan, who said:
I wrote to Imam (as) - meaning Imam Ali ibn Muhammad Al-Hadi (as) - asking about a person who had made a will, but the executor only remembered one part of it. What should be done with the remaining parts?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Allocate the remaining parts to charitable acts."

chapter: Chapter on the Executor Purchasing From the deceased's Estate When it is Sold to the Highest Bidder
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5514 - Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Al-Husayn ibn Ibrahim Al-Hamdani, who said: I wrote along with Muhammad ibn Yahya asking whether the executor of a will is permitted to purchase something from the deceased's estate when it is sold to the highest bidder and take it for himself.
Imam (as) replied: "It is permissible if he purchases it properly."
arabicText: 5514 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ اَلْهَمْدَانِيِّ قَالَ : كَتَبْتُ مَعَ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ يَحْيَى هَلْ لِلْوَصِيِّ أَنْ يَشْتَرِيَ شَيْئاً مِنْ مَالِ اَلْمَيِّتِ إِذَا بِيعَ فِيمَنْ زَادَ يَزِيدُ وَ يَأْخُذُ لِنَفْسِهِ فَقَالَ "يَجُوزُ إِذَا اِشْتَرَى صَحِيحاً".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5514 - Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Al-Husayn ibn Ibrahim Al-Hamdani, who said: I wrote along with Muhammad ibn Yahya asking whether the executor of a will is permitted to purchase something from the deceased's estate when it is sold to the highest bidder and take it for himself.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is permissible if he purchases it properly."

chapter: Chapter on a Man Disinheriting His Son for Having Relations with His father's Umm Al-Walad
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5515 - Al-Hasan ibn Ali Al-Washa' narrated from Muhammad ibn Yahya from the executor of Ali ibn Al-Sari, who said:
I said to Abu Al-Hasan (as): "Ali ibn Al-Sari has passed away and appointed me as his executor."
Imam (as) said: "May Allah (swt) have mercy on him."
I said: "His son Ja'far committed an act with his father's umm walad (concubine), and he instructed me to exclude him from the inheritance."
Imam (as) said: "Exclude him if you are truthful, and he will suffer affliction."
He (the executor) said: I returned, and Ja'far brought me before Abu Yusuf the judge. Ja'far said to him, "May Allah (swt) rectify your affairs. I am Ja'far, the son of Ali ibn Al-Sari, and this is my father's executor. Order him to give me my inheritance from my father."
The judge asked me: "What do you say?"
I replied: "Yes, this is Ja'far, the son of Ali ibn Al-Sari, and I am his executor."
The judge said: "Then hand over his wealth to him."
I said: "I wish to speak with you."
He (the judge) said: "Come closer."
I approached him so that no one could hear me, and I said: "This man committed an act with his father's umm walad, and his father commanded me in his will to exclude him from the inheritance and not give him anything. I went to Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), in Medina, informed him, and sought his guidance. Imam (as) ordered me to exclude him from the inheritance and not give him anything."
The judge said: "By Allah (swt), did Abu Al-Hasan command you to do this?"
I said: "Yes."
He (the judge) made me swear three times and then said: "Carry out what you were ordered. His (as) word is decisive."
The executor said: After that, Ja'far was afflicted with madness.
Abu Muhammad Al-Hasan ibn Ali Al-Washa' said: I saw him after that.
arabicText: 5515 - رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ اَلْوَشَّاءُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ وَصِيِّ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلسَّرِيِّ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ عَلِيَّ بْنَ اَلسَّرِيِّ تُوُفِّيَ وَ أَوْصَى إِلَيَّ فَقَالَ "رَحِمَهُ اَللَّهُ" قُلْتُ وَ إِنَّ اِبْنَهُ جَعْفَراً وَقَعَ عَلَى أُمِّ وَلَدٍ لَهُ فَأَمَرَنِي أَنْ أُخْرِجَهُ مِنَ اَلْمِيرَاثِ فَقَالَ لِي "أَخْرِجْهُ إِنْ كُنْتَ صَادِقاً فَسَيُصِيبُهُ خَبَلٌ " قَالَ فَرَجَعْتُ فَقَدَّمَنِي إِلَى أَبِي يُوسُفَ اَلْقَاضِي فَقَالَ لَهُ أَصْلَحَكَ اَللَّهُ أَنَا جَعْفَرُ بْنُ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلسَّرِيِّ وَ هَذَا وَصِيُّ أَبِي فَمُرْهُ أَنْ يَدْفَعَ إِلَيَّ مِيرَاثِي مِنْ أَبِي فَقَالَ لِي مَا تَقُولُ فَقُلْتُ نَعَمْ هَذَا جَعْفَرُ بْنُ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلسَّرِيِّ وَ أَنَا وَصِيُّ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلسَّرِيِّ قَالَ فَادْفَعْ إِلَيْهِ مَالَهُ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ أُرِيدُ أَنْ أُكَلِّمَكَ قَالَ فَادْنُ مِنِّي فَدَنَوْتُ حَيْثُ لاَ يَسْمَعُ أَحَدٌ كَلاَمِي فَقُلْتُ لَهُ هَذَا وَقَعَ عَلَى أُمِّ وَلَدٍ لِأَبِيهِ فَأَمَرَنِي أَبُوهُ وَ أَوْصَى إِلَيَّ أَنْ أُخْرِجَهُ مِنَ اَلْمِيرَاثِ وَ لاَ أُوَرِّثَهُ شَيْئاً فَأَتَيْتُ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ بِالْمَدِينَةِ فَأَخْبَرْتُهُ وَ سَأَلْتُهُ فَأَمَرَنِي أَنْ أُخْرِجَهُ مِنَ اَلْمِيرَاثِ وَ لاَ أُوَرِّثَهُ شَيْئاً فَقَالَ اَللَّهَ إِنَّ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ أَمَرَكَ فَقُلْتُ نَعَمْ فَاسْتَحْلَفَنِي ثَلاَثاً ثُمَّ قَالَ لِي أَنْفِذْ مَا أَمَرَكَ فَالْقَوْلُ قَوْلُهُ قَالَ اَلْوَصِيُّ فَأَصَابَهُ اَلْخَبَلُ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ قَالَ أَبُو مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ اَلْوَشَّاءُ رَأَيْتُهُ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5515 - Al-Hasan ibn Ali Al-Washa' narrated from Muhammad ibn Yahya from the executor of Ali ibn Al-Sari, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Al-Hasan (as): "Ali ibn Al-Sari has passed away and appointed me as his executor."
Imam (as) said: "May Allah (swt) have mercy on him."
I said: "His son Ja'far committed an act with his father's umm walad (concubine), and he instructed me to exclude him from the inheritance."
Imam (as) said: "Exclude him if you are truthful, and he will suffer affliction."
He (the executor) said: I returned, and Ja'far brought me before Abu Yusuf the judge. Ja'far said to him, "May Allah (swt) rectify your affairs. I am Ja'far, the son of Ali ibn Al-Sari, and this is my father's executor. Order him to give me my inheritance from my father."
The judge asked me: "What do you say?"
I replied: "Yes, this is Ja'far, the son of Ali ibn Al-Sari, and I am his executor."
The judge said: "Then hand over his wealth to him."
I said: "I wish to speak with you."
He (the judge) said: "Come closer."
I approached him so that no one could hear me, and I said: "This man committed an act with his father's umm walad, and his father commanded me in his will to exclude him from the inheritance and not give him anything. I went to Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as), in Medina, informed him, and sought his guidance. Imam (as) ordered me to exclude him from the inheritance and not give him anything."
The judge said: "By Allah (swt), did Abu Al-Hasan command you to do this?"
I said: "Yes."
He (the judge) made me swear three times and then said: "Carry out what you were ordered. His (as) word is decisive."
The executor said: After that, Ja'far was afflicted with madness.
Abu Muhammad Al-Hasan ibn Ali Al-Washa' said: I saw him after that.

chapter: Chapter on a Man Disinheriting His Son for Having Relations with His father's Umm Al-Walad
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5516 - And the confirmation of this is what was narrated by Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa from Abdul Aziz ibn Al-Muhtadi from Sa'id ibn Sa'd, who said:
'I asked Imam (as) - meaning Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) - about a man who had a son whom he acknowledged and then later disowned, excluding him from the inheritance. I am his executor, so what should I do?'
Imam (as) said: "The son remains legally his due to his prior public acknowledgment. The executor cannot deny him anything that is already known."
arabicText: 5516 - وَ تَصْدِيقُ ذَلِكَ مَا رَوَاهُ أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلْعَزِيزِ بْنِ اَلْمُهْتَدِي عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ سَعْدٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ يَعْنِي أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ كَانَ لَهُ اِبْنٌ يَدَّعِيهِ فَنَفَاهُ وَ أَخْرَجَهُ مِنَ اَلْمِيرَاثِ وَ أَنَا وَصِيُّهُ فَكَيْفَ أَصْنَعُ فَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "لَزِمَهُ اَلْوَلَدُ لِإِقْرَارِهِ بِالْمَشْهَدِ لاَ يَدْفَعْهُ اَلْوَصِيُّ عَنْ شَيْءٍ قَدْ عَلِمَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5516 - And the confirmation of this is what was narrated by Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa from Abdul Aziz ibn Al-Muhtadi from Sa'id ibn Sa'd, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
'I asked Imam (as) - meaning Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) - about a man who had a son whom he acknowledged and then later disowned, excluding him from the inheritance. I am his executor, so what should I do?'
Imam (as) said: "The son remains legally his due to his prior public acknowledgment. The executor cannot deny him anything that is already known."

chapter: Chapter on the Cessation of an orphan's Orphanhood
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5517 - Mansur ibn Hazim narrated from Hisham from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"The end of an orphan's state of orphanhood is marked by reaching puberty, and that is when he reaches his full strength. However, if he reaches puberty but no sign of maturity is observed in him, and he is foolish or weak-minded, then his guardian should withhold his wealth from him."
arabicText: 5517 - رَوَى مَنْصُورُ بْنُ حَازِمٍ عَنْ هِشَامٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: "اِنْقِطَاعُ يُتْمِ اَلْيَتِيمِ اَلاِحْتِلاَمُ وَ هُوَ أَشُدُّهُ وَ إِنِ اِحْتَلَمَ وَ لَمْ يُؤْنَسْ مِنْهُ رُشْدُهُ وَ كَانَ سَفِيهاً أَوْ ضَعِيفاً فَلْيُمْسِكْ عَنْهُ وَلِيُّهُ مَالَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5517 - Mansur ibn Hazim narrated from Hisham from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The end of an orphan's state of orphanhood is marked by reaching puberty, and that is when he reaches his full strength. However, if he reaches puberty but no sign of maturity is observed in him, and he is foolish or weak-minded, then his guardian should withhold his wealth from him."

chapter: Chapter on the Cessation of an orphan's Orphanhood
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5518 - Ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Mathanna ibn Rashid from Abu Basir from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: I asked Imam (as) about an orphan who had memorized the Qur'an and had no deficiency in his intellect. The one holding his wealth wishes to invest it until the orphan reaches puberty and then hand over his wealth to him.
Imam (as) said: "Even if he reaches puberty but does not have sound intellect, nothing should ever be handed over to him."
arabicText: 5518 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُثَنَّى بْنِ رَاشِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ يَتِيمٍ قَدْ قَرَأَ اَلْقُرْآنَ وَ لَيْسَ بِعَقْلِهِ بَأْسٌ وَ لَهُ مَالٌ عَلَى يَدَيْ رَجُلٍ فَأَرَادَ اَلَّذِي عِنْدَهُ اَلْمَالُ أَنْ يَعْمَلَ بِهِ حَتَّى يَحْتَلِمَ وَ يَدْفَعَ إِلَيْهِ مَالَهُ قَالَ "وَ إِنِ اِحْتَلَمَ وَ لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ عَقْلٌ لَمْ يُدْفَعْ إِلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ أَبَداً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5518 - Ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Mathanna ibn Rashid from Abu Basir from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: I asked Imam (as) about an orphan who had memorized the Qur'an and had no deficiency in his intellect. The one holding his wealth wishes to invest it until the orphan reaches puberty and then hand over his wealth to him.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "Even if he reaches puberty but does not have sound intellect, nothing should ever be handed over to him."

chapter: Chapter on the Cessation of an orphan's Orphanhood
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5519 - Al-Hasan ibn Ali Al-Washa' narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: "When a boy reaches the age of thirteen and enters into his fourteenth year, what is obligatory upon those who have reached puberty becomes obligatory upon him, whether he experiences a wet dream or not. His bad deeds are recorded against him, and his good deeds are recorded for him. Everything becomes permissible for him except if he is weak-minded or foolish."
arabicText: 5519 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ اَلْوَشَّاءُ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "إِذَا بَلَغَ اَلْغُلاَمُ أَشُدَّهُ ثَلاَثَ عَشْرَةَ سَنَةً وَ دَخَلَ فِي اَلْأَرْبَعَ عَشْرَةَ سَنَةً وَجَبَ عَلَيْهِ مَا وَجَبَ عَلَى اَلْمُحْتَلِمِينَ اِحْتَلَمَ أَوْ لَمْ يَحْتَلِمْ وَ كُتِبَتْ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّيِّئَاتُ وَ كُتِبَتْ لَهُ اَلْحَسَنَاتُ وَ جَازَ لَهُ كُلُّ شَيْءٍ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ ضَعِيفاً أَوْ سَفِيهاً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5519 - Al-Hasan ibn Ali Al-Washa' narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When a boy reaches the age of thirteen and enters into his fourteenth year, what is obligatory upon those who have reached puberty becomes obligatory upon him, whether he experiences a wet dream or not. His bad deeds are recorded against him, and his good deeds are recorded for him. Everything becomes permissible for him except if he is weak-minded or foolish."

chapter: Chapter on the Cessation of an orphan's Orphanhood
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5520 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from 'Is ibn Al-Qasim from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: I asked Imam (as) about an orphan girl - when should her wealth be handed over to her?
Imam (as) said: "When you know that she will neither corrupt it nor waste it."
I then asked Imam (as): "What if she has gotten married?"
Imam (as) said: "Once she marries, the authority of the guardian over her ends."
COMPEV
قَالَ مُصَنِّفُ هَذَا الْكِتَابِ رَحِمَهُ اللَّهُ يَعْنِي بِذَلِكَ إِذَا بَلَغَتْ تِسْعَ سِنِينَ.
The author of this book, may Allah (swt) have mercy on him, commented: This means when she reaches the age of nine years.
arabicText: 5520 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ عِيصِ بْنِ اَلْقَاسِمِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْيَتِيمَةِ مَتَى يُدْفَعُ إِلَيْهَا مَالُهَا قَالَ "إِذَا عَلِمْتَ أَنَّهَا لاَ تُفْسِدُ وَ لاَ تُضَيِّعُ" فَسَأَلْتُهُ إِنْ كَانَتْ قَدْ تَزَوَّجَتْ فَقَالَ "إِذَا تَزَوَّجَتْ فَقَدِ اِنْقَطَعَ مُلْكُ اَلْوَصِيِّ عَنْهَا".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5520 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from 'Is ibn Al-Qasim from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: I asked Imam (as) about an orphan girl - when should her wealth be handed over to her?
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When you know that she will neither corrupt it nor waste it."
I then asked Imam (as): "What if she has gotten married?"
Imam (as) said: "Once she marries, the authority of the guardian over her ends."
COMPEV
قَالَ مُصَنِّفُ هَذَا الْكِتَابِ رَحِمَهُ اللَّهُ يَعْنِي بِذَلِكَ إِذَا بَلَغَتْ تِسْعَ سِنِينَ.
The author of this book, may Allah (swt) have mercy on him, commented: This means when she reaches the age of nine years.

chapter: Chapter on the Cessation of an orphan's Orphanhood
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5521 - Musa ibn Bakr narrated from Zurara from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said: "A girl should not be consummated in marriage until she reaches nine or ten years of age."
arabicText: 5521 - وَ رَوَى مُوسَى بْنُ بَكْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "لاَ يُدْخَلُ بِالْجَارِيَةِ حَتَّى يَأْتِيَ لَهَا تِسْعُ سِنِينَ أَوْ عَشْرٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5521 - Musa ibn Bakr narrated from Zurara from Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A girl should not be consummated in marriage until she reaches nine or ten years of age."

chapter: Chapter on the Cessation of an orphan's Orphanhood
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.5522 - Abu Abdullah (as), said: "When a girl reaches nine years of age, her wealth is handed over to her, her decisions regarding her wealth become valid, and the full legal punishments are applied for her and upon her."
arabicText: 5522 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "إِذَا بَلَغَتِ اَلْجَارِيَةُ تِسْعَ سِنِينَ دُفِعَ إِلَيْهَا مَالُهَا وَ جَازَ أَمْرُهَا فِي مَالِهَا وَ أُقِيمَتِ اَلْحُدُودُ اَلتَّامَّةُ لَهَا وَ عَلَيْهَا".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5522 - Abu Abdullah (as), said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When a girl reaches nine years of age, her wealth is handed over to her, her decisions regarding her wealth become valid, and the full legal punishments are applied for her and upon her."

chapter: Chapter on the Cessation of an orphan's Orphanhood
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5523 - It was narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), that he was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Exalted and Glorious:
"But if you perceive in them sound judgment, then deliver their wealth to them"
(Surah An-Nisa 4:6).
Imam (as) said: "Perceiving sound judgment means the ability to safeguard wealth."
arabicText:
5523 - وَ قَدْ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنْ قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ۝ فَإِنْ آنَسْتُمْ مِنْهُمْ رُشْداً فَادْفَعُوا إِلَيْهِمْ أَمْوٰالَهُمْ ۝
قَالَ "إِينَاسُ اَلرُّشْدِ حِفْظُ اَلْمَالِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5523 - It was narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), that he was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Exalted and Glorious:
"But if you perceive in them sound judgment, then deliver their wealth to them"
(Surah An-Nisa 4:6).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Perceiving sound judgment means the ability to safeguard wealth."

chapter: Chapter on the Cessation of an orphan's Orphanhood
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5524 - In the narration of Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya from Muhammad ibn Al-Husayn from Abdullah ibn Al-Mughira from someone who mentioned from Abu Abdullah (as), that Imam (as) said in the interpretation of this verse:
"If you perceive in them sound judgment, then deliver their wealth to them"
(Surah An-Nisa 4:6).
Imam (as) said: "If you see that they love the family of Muhammad (sw), peace be upon them, then elevate them in status."
arabicText:
5524 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ اَلْمُغِيرَةِ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ قَالَ فِي تَفْسِيرِ هَذِهِ اَلْآيَةِ
۝ إِذَا رَأَيْتُمُوهُمْ يُحِبُّونَ آلَ مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَارْفَعُوهُمْ دَرَجَةً ۝.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5524 - In the narration of Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya from Muhammad ibn Al-Husayn from Abdullah ibn Al-Mughira from someone who mentioned from Abu Abdullah (as), that Imam (as) said in the interpretation of this verse:
"If you perceive in them sound judgment, then deliver their wealth to them"
(Surah An-Nisa 4:6).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If you see that they love the family of Muhammad (sw), peace be upon them, then elevate them in status."

chapter: Chapter on Those Who Are Not Prevented From Inheriting
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5620 - Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Indeed, a newborn or an infant does not prevent you (from inheritance) nor inherits from you unless they have cried aloud. Anything concealed in the womb, even if it moves, has no share in inheritance except what the passage of night and day might change."
arabicText: 5620 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنِ اَلْعَلاَءِ بْنِ فُضَيْلٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : "إِنَّ اَلْوَلِيدَ وَ اَلطِّفْلَ لاَ يَحْجُبُكَ وَ لاَ يَرِثُكَ إِلاَّ مَنْ آذَنَ بِالصُّرَاخِ وَ لاَ شَيْءٌ أَكَنَّهُ اَلْبَطْنُ وَ إِنْ تَحَرَّكَ إِلاَّ مَا اِخْتَلَفَ عَلَيْهِ اَللَّيْلُ وَ اَلنَّهَارُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5620 - Abu Abdullah Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, a newborn or an infant does not prevent you (from inheritance) nor inherits from you unless they have cried aloud. Anything concealed in the womb, even if it moves, has no share in inheritance except what the passage of night and day might change."

chapter: Chapter on What Has Been Reported Regarding One Who Refuses to Take His Wealth After Reaching Maturity
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5525 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from Sa'd ibn Isma'il from his father, who said: I asked Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as) about the guardian of orphans whose wards have reached maturity. He offers them their rightful wealth, but they refuse to take it. What should he do?
Imam (as) said: "He must return their wealth to them and compel them to take it."
arabicText: 5525 - رَوَى أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ وَصِيِّ أَيْتَامٍ يُدْرِكُ أَيْتَامُهُ فَيَعْرِضُ عَلَيْهِمْ أَنْ يَأْخُذُوا اَلَّذِي لَهُمْ فَيَأْبَوْنَ عَلَيْهِ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ قَالَ "يَرُدُّ عَلَيْهِمْ وَ يُكْرِهُهُمْ عَلَيْهِ".

chapter: Chapter on the Executor Withholding the heir's Wealth After Maturity, Leading Him to Commit Adultery Due to His Inability to Marry
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5526 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub Al-Kulayni, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, narrated from Muhammad ibn Yahya from Muhammad ibn Al-Husayn from Muhammad ibn Qays from someone who narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said regarding a man who died and appointed someone as the guardian of his affairs while leaving behind a young son.
When the boy grew up, he went to the guardian and said: "Return my wealth to me so I can get married," but the guardian refused. The boy then went and committed adultery.
Abu Abdullah (as), said: "Two-thirds of the sin of this man's adultery is upon the guardian who withheld his wealth and did not give it to him, which would have allowed him to marry."
arabicText: 5526 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَعْقُوبَ اَلْكُلَيْنِيُّ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ عَمَّنْ رَوَاهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : فِي رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ أَوْصَى إِلَى رَجُلٍ وَ لَهُ اِبْنٌ صَغِيرٌ فَأَدْرَكَ اَلْغُلاَمُ وَ ذَهَبَ إِلَى اَلْوَصِيِّ فَقَالَ لَهُ رُدَّ عَلَيَّ مَالِي لِأَتَزَوَّجَ فَأَبَى عَلَيْهِ فَذَهَبَ حَتَّى زَنَى قَالَ "يُلْزَمُ ثُلُثَيْ إِثْمِ زِنَى هَذَا اَلرَّجُلِ ذَلِكَ اَلْوَصِيُّ اَلَّذِي مَنَعَهُ اَلْمَالَ وَ لَمْ يُعْطِهِ فَكَانَ يَتَزَوَّجُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5526 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub Al-Kulayni, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, narrated from Muhammad ibn Yahya from Muhammad ibn Al-Husayn from Muhammad ibn Qays from someone who narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said regarding a man who died and appointed someone as the guardian of his affairs while leaving behind a young son.
thaqalaynMatn:
When the boy grew up, he went to the guardian and said: "Return my wealth to me so I can get married," but the guardian refused. The boy then went and committed adultery.
Abu Abdullah (as), said: "Two-thirds of the sin of this man's adultery is upon the guardian who withheld his wealth and did not give it to him, which would have allowed him to marry."

chapter: Chapter on What Has Been Reported Regarding One Who Makes a Bequest or Frees a Slave While in Debt
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5527 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Jamil ibn Darraj from Zakariya ibn Abi Yahya Al-Sa'di from Al-Hakam ibn Utaibah, who said:
We were sitting at the door of Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), as a group waiting for him to come out. Suddenly, a woman approached and asked: "Which of you is Abu Ja'far?"
The people replied: "What do you need from him?" She said: "I want to ask him a question."
They told her: "This is the jurist of the people of Iraq, so ask him."
She said: "My husband passed away and left behind one thousand dirhams. I had a debt upon him from my dowry of five hundred dirhams. I took my dowry and also took my share of the inheritance. Then a man came and claimed that the deceased owed him one thousand dirhams, and I testified in his favor."
Al-Hakam said: While I was pondering this, Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), came out and said: "What is this that I see you counting with your fingers, O' Hakam?"
I said: "This woman mentioned that her husband died, leaving one thousand dirhams. She had five hundred dirhams as her dowry, which she took, and she also took her share of the inheritance. Then a man came claiming that the deceased owed him one thousand dirhams, and she testified in his favor."
Al-Hakam said: By Allah (swt), I had not even finished speaking when Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), said:
"She has admitted to two-thirds of what she possesses, and she has no right to any inheritance."
Al-Hakam said: By Allah (swt), I have never seen anyone more insightful than Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as).
Ibn Abi Umayr said: The explanation of this is that there is no inheritance until debts are settled.
The deceased only left one thousand dirhams, while he owed a total debt of one thousand five hundred dirhams - five hundred dirhams to her (as her dowry) and one thousand dirhams to the man. Therefore, she is entitled to one-third of the remaining amount because of her five hundred dirham debt, and the man is entitled to two-thirds due to his claim of one thousand dirhams.
arabicText: 5527 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ عَنْ زَكَرِيَّا بْنِ أَبِي يَحْيَى اَلسَّعْدِيِّ عَنِ اَلْحَكَمِ بْنِ عُتَيْبَةَ قَالَ : كُنَّا عَلَى بَابِ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ع وَ نَحْنُ جَمَاعَةٌ نَنْتَظِرُ أَنْ يَخْرُجَ إِذْ جَاءَتِ اِمْرَأَةٌ فَقَالَتْ أَيُّكُمْ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ فَقَالَ لَهَا اَلْقَوْمُ مَا تُرِيدِينَ مِنْهُ قَالَتْ أَسْأَلُهُ عَنْ مَسْأَلَةٍ فَقَالُوا لَهَا هَذَا فَقِيهُ أَهْلِ اَلْعِرَاقِ فَاسْأَلِيهِ فَقَالَتْ إِنَّ زَوْجِي مَاتَ وَ تَرَكَ أَلْفَ دِرْهَمٍ وَ كَانَ لِي عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ مِنْ صَدَاقِي خَمْسُمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ فَأَخَذْتُ صَدَاقِي وَ أَخَذْتُ مِيرَاثِي ثُمَّ جَاءَ رَجُلٌ فَادَّعَى عَلَيْهِ أَلْفَ دِرْهَمٍ فَشَهِدْتُ لَهُ قَالَ اَلْحَكَمُ فَبَيْنَا أَنَا أَحْسُبُ إِذْ خَرَجَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقَالَ "مَا هَذَا اَلَّذِي أَرَاكَ تُحَرِّكُ بِهِ أَصَابِعَكَ يَا حَكَمُ " فَقُلْتُ إِنَّ هَذِهِ اَلْمَرْأَةَ ذَكَرَتْ أَنَّ زَوْجَهَا مَاتَ وَ تَرَكَ أَلْفَ دِرْهَمٍ وَ كَانَ لَهَا عَلَيْهِ مِنْ صَدَاقِهَا خَمْسُمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ فَأَخَذَتْ مِنْهُ صَدَاقَهَا وَ أَخَذَتْ مِنْهُ مِيرَاثَهَا ثُمَّ جَاءَ رَجُلٌ فَادَّعَى عَلَيْهِ أَلْفَ دِرْهَمٍ فَشَهِدَتْ لَهُ قَالَ اَلْحَكَمُ فَوَ اَللَّهِ مَا أَتْمَمْتُ اَلْكَلاَمَ حَتَّى قَالَ "أَقَرَّتْ بِثُلُثَيْ مَا فِي يَدَيْهَا وَ لاَ مِيرَاثَ لَهَا" قَالَ اَلْحَكَمُ فَمَا رَأَيْتُ وَ اَللَّهِ أَفْهَمَ مِنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَطُّ. قَالَ ابْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ وَ تَفْسِيرُ ذَلِكَ أَنَّهُ لَا مِيرَاثَ حَتَّى يُقْضَى الدَّيْنُ وَ إِنَّمَا تَرَكَ أَلْفَ دِرْهَمٍ وَ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ الدَّيْنِ أَلْفٌ وَ خَمْسُمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ لَهَا وَ لِلرَّجُلِ فَلَهَا ثُلُثُ الْأَلْفِ لِأَنَّ لَهَا خَمْسَمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ وَ لِلرَّجُلِ أَلْفَ دِرْهَمٍ فَلَهُ ثُلُثَاهَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5527 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Jamil ibn Darraj from Zakariya ibn Abi Yahya Al-Sa'di from Al-Hakam ibn Utaibah, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
We were sitting at the door of Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), as a group waiting for him to come out. Suddenly, a woman approached and asked: "Which of you is Abu Ja'far?"
The people replied: "What do you need from him?" She said: "I want to ask him a question."
They told her: "This is the jurist of the people of Iraq, so ask him."
She said: "My husband passed away and left behind one thousand dirhams. I had a debt upon him from my dowry of five hundred dirhams. I took my dowry and also took my share of the inheritance. Then a man came and claimed that the deceased owed him one thousand dirhams, and I testified in his favor."
Al-Hakam said: While I was pondering this, Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), came out and said: "What is this that I see you counting with your fingers, O' Hakam?"
I said: "This woman mentioned that her husband died, leaving one thousand dirhams. She had five hundred dirhams as her dowry, which she took, and she also took her share of the inheritance. Then a man came claiming that the deceased owed him one thousand dirhams, and she testified in his favor."
Al-Hakam said: By Allah (swt), I had not even finished speaking when Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), said:
"She has admitted to two-thirds of what she possesses, and she has no right to any inheritance."
Al-Hakam said: By Allah (swt), I have never seen anyone more insightful than Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as).
Ibn Abi Umayr said: The explanation of this is that there is no inheritance until debts are settled.
The deceased only left one thousand dirhams, while he owed a total debt of one thousand five hundred dirhams - five hundred dirhams to her (as her dowry) and one thousand dirhams to the man. Therefore, she is entitled to one-third of the remaining amount because of her five hundred dirham debt, and the man is entitled to two-thirds due to his claim of one thousand dirhams.

chapter: Chapter on What Has Been Reported Regarding One Who Makes a Bequest or Frees a Slave While in Debt
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5528 - Ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Jamil ibn Darraj from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who freed his slave at the time of his death while he had a debt upon him.
Imam (as) said: "If the value of the slave is equal to the amount of debt he owes or more, then his emancipation is valid; otherwise, it is not valid."
arabicText: 5528 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ أَعْتَقَ مَمْلُوكَهُ عِنْدَ مَوْتِهِ وَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ فَقَالَ "إِنْ كَانَ قِيمَتُهُ مِثْلَ اَلَّذِي عَلَيْهِ وَ مِثْلَهُ جَازَ عِتْقُهُ وَ إِلاَّ لَمْ يَجُزْ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5528 - Ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Jamil ibn Darraj from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who freed his slave at the time of his death while he had a debt upon him.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If the value of the slave is equal to the amount of debt he owes or more, then his emancipation is valid; otherwise, it is not valid."

chapter: Chapter on What Has Been Reported Regarding One Who Makes a Bequest or Frees a Slave While in Debt
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5529 - In the narration of Aban ibn Uthman, it is reported that a man asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a man who had made a will appointing someone as his executor, stating that he had a debt upon him.
Abu Abdullah (as), said: "The executor should settle the debt owed by the deceased and then distribute whatever remains among the heirs."
The man then asked: "Should the executor distribute what was bequeathed for the debt? Should the debt be collected from the heirs or from the executor?"
Imam (as) replied: "It is not to be taken from the heirs; rather, the executor is responsible for it."
arabicText: 5529 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ أَبَانِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ قَالَ : سَأَلَ رَجُلٌ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى إِلَى رَجُلٍ أَنَّ عَلَيْهِ دَيْناً فَقَالَ "يَقْضِي اَلرَّجُلُ مَا عَلَيْهِ مِنْ دَيْنِهِ وَ يَقْسِمُ مَا بَقِيَ بَيْنَ اَلْوَرَثَةِ" قُلْتُ فَيُفَرِّقُ اَلْوَصِيُّ مَا كَانَ أُوصِيَ بِهِ فِي اَلدَّيْنِ مِمَّنْ يُؤْخَذُ اَلدَّيْنُ أَ مِنَ اَلْوَرَثَةِ أَمْ مِنَ اَلْوَصِيِّ فَقَالَ "لاَ يُؤْخَذُ مِنَ اَلْوَرَثَةِ وَ لَكِنَّ اَلْوَصِيَّ ضَامِنٌ لَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5529 - In the narration of Aban ibn Uthman, it is reported that a man asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a man who had made a will appointing someone as his executor, stating that he had a debt upon him.
thaqalaynMatn:
Abu Abdullah (as), said: "The executor should settle the debt owed by the deceased and then distribute whatever remains among the heirs."
The man then asked: "Should the executor distribute what was bequeathed for the debt? Should the debt be collected from the heirs or from the executor?"
Imam (as) replied: "It is not to be taken from the heirs; rather, the executor is responsible for it."

chapter: Chapter on the Clearance of the deceased's Liability From Debt When Someone Guarantees it for the Creditors with Their Consent
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5530 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who dies while owing a debt, and a guarantor assumes responsibility for it on behalf of the creditors.
Imam (as) said: "If the creditors agree, then the deceased is cleared of responsibility."
arabicText: 5530 - رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَمُوتُ وَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ فَيَضْمَنُهُ ضَامِنٌ لِلْغُرَمَاءِ قَالَ "إِذَا رَضِيَ اَلْغُرَمَاءُ فَقَدْ بَرِئَتْ ذِمَّةُ اَلْمَيِّتِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5530 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who dies while owing a debt, and a guarantor assumes responsibility for it on behalf of the creditors.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If the creditors agree, then the deceased is cleared of responsibility."

chapter: Chapter on a Sold Item That Remains Intact When the Buyer Dies While in Debt and Owing Its Price
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5531 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Jamil ibn Darraj from one of our companions from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who sold merchandise to another man. The buyer took possession of the merchandise but did not pay the price, and then the buyer died while the merchandise was still in its original form.
Imam (as) said: "If the merchandise remains in its original state, it should be returned to the seller, and the creditors have no right to dispute over it."
arabicText: 5531 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ بَاعَ مَتَاعاً مِنْ رَجُلٍ فَقَبَضَ اَلْمُشْتَرِي اَلْمَتَاعَ وَ لَمْ يَدْفَعِ اَلثَّمَنَ ثُمَّ مَاتَ اَلْمُشْتَرِي وَ اَلْمَتَاعُ قَائِمٌ بِعَيْنِهِ فَقَالَ "إِذَا كَانَ اَلْمَتَاعُ قَائِماً بِعَيْنِهِ رُدَّ إِلَى صَاحِبِ اَلْمَتَاعِ وَ لَيْسَ لِلْغُرَمَاءِ أَنْ يُخَاصِمُوهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5531 - Muhammad ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Jamil ibn Darraj from one of our companions from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who sold merchandise to another man. The buyer took possession of the merchandise but did not pay the price, and then the buyer died while the merchandise was still in its original form.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If the merchandise remains in its original state, it should be returned to the seller, and the creditors have no right to dispute over it."

chapter: Chapter on Settling Debt From Blood Money (diyyah)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5532 - Safwan ibn Yahya Al-Azraq narrated from Abu Al-Hasan (as), regarding a man who was killed while owing a debt and left behind no wealth. His family took the blood money (diyyah) from his killer. Should they use it to settle his debt?
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
I asked: "Even though he left nothing behind?"
Imam (as) replied: "They took his blood money, so they must use it to settle his debt."
arabicText: 5532 - رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى اَلْأَزْرَقُ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يُقْتَلُ وَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ وَ لَمْ يَتْرُكْ مَالاً فَأَخَذَ أَهْلُهُ اَلدِّيَةَ مِنْ قَاتِلِهِ عَلَيْهِمْ أَنْ يَقْضُوا دَيْنَهُ قَالَ "نَعَمْ" قُلْتُ وَ هُوَ لَمْ يَتْرُكْ شَيْئاً قَالَ "إِنَّمَا أَخَذُوا دِيَتَهُ فَعَلَيْهِمْ أَنْ يَقْضُوا دَيْنَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5532 - Safwan ibn Yahya Al-Azraq narrated from Abu Al-Hasan (as), regarding a man who was killed while owing a debt and left behind no wealth. His family took the blood money (diyyah) from his killer. Should they use it to settle his debt?
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
I asked: "Even though he left nothing behind?"
Imam (as) replied: "They took his blood money, so they must use it to settle his debt."

chapter: Chapter on the Disapproval of Appointing a Woman as an Executor of a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5533 - Al-Sakuni narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), from his forefathers, peace be upon them, who said that the Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
"A woman should not be appointed as an executor of a will because Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, says: "And do not give the weak-minded your wealth" (Surah An-Nisa 4:5)."
arabicText: 5533 - رَوَى اَلسَّكُونِيُّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : "اَلْمَرْأَةُ لاَ يُوصَى إِلَيْهَا لِأَنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَقُولُ ۝ وَ لاٰ تُؤْتُوا اَلسُّفَهٰاءَ أَمْوٰالَكُمُ ۝.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5533 - Al-Sakuni narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), from his forefathers, peace be upon them, who said that the Commander of the Faithful (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman should not be appointed as an executor of a will because Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, says: "And do not give the weak-minded your wealth" (Surah An-Nisa 4:5)."

chapter: Chapter on the Disapproval of Appointing a Woman as an Executor of a Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5534 - In another narration, Abu Jafar Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious:
"And do not give the weak-minded your wealth." (Qur'an 4:5).
Imam (as) said: "Do not give it to one who drinks alcohol or to women."
Then Imam (as) added: "And who is more foolish than a person who drinks alcohol?"
arabicText: 5534 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ : سُئِلَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ "وَ لاٰ تُؤْتُوا اَلسُّفَهٰاءَ أَمْوٰالَكُمُ" قَالَ "لاَ تُؤْتُوهَا شَارِبَ اَلْخَمْرِ وَ لاَ اَلنِّسَاءَ" ثُمَّ قَالَ "وَ أَيُّ سَفِيهٍ أَسْفَهُ مِنْ شَارِبِ اَلْخَمْرِ".

chapter: Chapter on the Obligation of the Executor of the Executor in Fulfilling the Bequest
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5535 - Muhammad ibn Al-Hasan Al-Saffar, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, wrote to Abu Muhammad Imam Hasan ibn Ali Al-Askari (as), asking:
"A man was the executor of another man's will, and then he died and appointed another man as his executor. Is the second executor obligated to fulfill the will of the man for whom the first executor was appointed?"
Imam (as) wrote in response: "He is obligated by his right if there is a rightful claim upon him, if Allah (swt) wills."
arabicText: 5535 - كَتَبَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْحَسَنِ اَلصَّفَّارُ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ إِلَى أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : رَجُلٌ كَانَ وَصِيَّ رَجُلٍ فَمَاتَ وَ أَوْصَى إِلَى رَجُلٍ آخَرَ هَلْ يَلْزَمُ اَلْوَصِيَّ وَصِيَّةُ اَلرَّجُلِ اَلَّذِي كَانَ هَذَا وَصِيَّهُ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ "يَلْزَمُهُ بِحَقِّهِ إِنْ كَانَ لَهُ قِبَلَهُ حَقٌّ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5535 - Muhammad ibn Al-Hasan Al-Saffar, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, wrote to Abu Muhammad Imam Hasan ibn Ali Al-Askari (as), asking:
"A man was the executor of another man's will, and then he died and appointed another man as his executor. Is the second executor obligated to fulfill the will of the man for whom the first executor was appointed?"
Imam (as) wrote in response:
thaqalaynMatn: "He is obligated by his right if there is a rightful claim upon him, if Allah (swt) wills."

chapter: Chapter on a Man Who Bequeaths a Portion of His Wealth to Another and is Then Killed by Mistake
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5536 - Asim ibn Humayd narrated from Muhammad ibn Qays, who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who bequeathed a portion of his wealth - a third or a fourth - to another man. Then, the man (the testator) was mistakenly killed.
Imam (as) said: "The will is to be executed from his wealth and from his blood money (diyyah)."
arabicText: 5536 - رَوَى عَاصِمُ بْنُ حُمَيْدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لَهُ رَجُلٌ أَوْصَى لِرَجُلٍ بِوَصِيَّةٍ مِنْ مَالِهِ ثُلُثٍ أَوْ رُبُعٍ فَيُقْتَلُ اَلرَّجُلُ خَطَأً يَعْنِي اَلْمُوصِيَ فَقَالَ "تُجَازُ لِهَذَا اَلْوَصِيَّةُ مِنْ مَالِهِ وَ مِنْ دِيَتِهِ ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5536 - Asim ibn Humayd narrated from Muhammad ibn Qays, who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man who bequeathed a portion of his wealth - a third or a fourth - to another man. Then, the man (the testator) was mistakenly killed.
Imam (as) said: "
thaqalaynMatn: The will is to be executed from his wealth and from his blood money (diyyah)."

chapter: Chapter on a Man Who Bequeaths a Portion of His Wealth to Another and is Then Killed by Mistake
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5537 - In another narration, Abu Abdullah (as), was asked about a man who had bequeathed one-third of his wealth and was then killed by mistake.
Imam (as) said: "One-third of his blood money (diyyah) is included in his bequest."
arabicText: 5537 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ : سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى بِثُلُثِ مَالِهِ ثُمَّ قُتِلَ خَطَأً قَالَ "ثُلُثُ دِيَتِهِ دَاخِلٌ فِي وَصِيَّتِهِ".
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.5537 - In another narration, Abu Abdullah (as), was asked about a man who had bequeathed one-third of his wealth and was then killed by mistake.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "One-third of his blood money (diyyah) is included in his bequest."

chapter: Chapter on a Man Who Appoints Another as the Guardian of His Children and Their Wealth, Permitting Him at the Time of the Bequest to Invest the Wealth, with the Profits Shared Between Him and Them
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5538 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub Al-Kulayni, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad Al-'Asimi from Ali ibn Al-Hasan Al-Mithami from Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Yusuf from Mathanna ibn Al-Walid from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Abdullah (as), who was asked about a man who appointed another man as the guardian over his children and their wealth. He also permitted him, in his will, to invest the wealth with the profit being shared between him and the children.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in that because their father had granted him permission to do so while he was alive."
arabicText: 5538 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَعْقُوبَ اَلْكُلَيْنِيُّ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْعَاصِمِيُّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْمِيثَمِيِّ عَنِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ يُوسُفَ عَنْ مُثَنَّى بْنِ اَلْوَلِيدِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى إِلَى رَجُلٍ بِوُلْدِهِ وَ مَالٍ لَهُمْ وَ أَذِنَ لَهُ عِنْدَ اَلْوَصِيَّةِ أَنْ يَعْمَلَ بِالْمَالِ وَ يَكُونُ اَلرِّبْحُ بَيْنَهُ وَ بَيْنَهُمْ فَقَالَ "لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ مِنْ أَجْلِ أَنَّ أَبَاهُ قَدْ أَذِنَ لَهُ فِي ذَلِكَ وَ هُوَ حَيٌّ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5538 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub Al-Kulayni, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad Al-'Asimi from Ali ibn Al-Hasan Al-Mithami from Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Yusuf from Mathanna ibn Al-Walid from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Abdullah (as), who was asked about a man who appointed another man as the guardian over his children and their wealth. He also permitted him, in his will, to invest the wealth with the profit being shared between him and the children.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in that because their father had granted him permission to do so while he was alive."

chapter: Chapter on a Man Who Appoints Another as the Guardian of His Children and Their Wealth, Permitting Him at the Time of the Bequest to Invest the Wealth, with the Profits Shared Between Him and Them
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5539 - Ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Abdur Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj from Khalid Al-Taweel, who said: My father called me when death approached him and said:
"O' my son, take charge of your younger brothers' wealth, invest it, take half of the profit for yourself, and give them the other half. You are not liable for any loss."
After my father's death, my father's concubine brought me before Ibn Abi Layla and said:
"This man is consuming the wealth of my children."
I explained to him what my father had instructed me to do.
Ibn Abi Layla said: "If your father commanded you with something invalid, I will not permit it." Then he had me testify that if I used the wealth, I would be liable for it.
Later, I went to Abu Abdullah (as), and narrated my story to him.
I then asked: "What do you say about this matter?"
Imam (as) said: "As for the ruling of Ibn Abi Layla, I cannot overturn it. But as for what is between you and Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, you are not liable."
arabicText: 5539 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ اَلْحَجَّاجِ عَنْ خَالِدٍ اَلطَّوِيلِ قَالَ : دَعَانِي أَبِي حِينَ حَضَرَتْهُ اَلْوَفَاةُ فَقَالَ يَا بُنَيَّ اِقْبِضْ مَالَ إِخْوَتِكَ اَلصِّغَارِ وَ اِعْمَلْ بِهِ وَ خُذْ نِصْفَ اَلرِّبْحِ وَ أَعْطِهِمُ اَلنِّصْفَ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْكَ ضَمَانٌ فَقَدَّمَتْنِي أُمُّ وَلَدِ أَبِي بَعْدَ وَفَاةِ أَبِي إِلَى اِبْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى فَقَالَتْ إِنَّ هَذَا يَأْكُلُ أَمْوَالَ وُلْدِي قَالَ فَقَصَصْتُ عَلَيْهِ مَا أَمَرَنِي بِهِ أَبِي فَقَالَ اِبْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى إِنْ كَانَ أَبُوكَ أَمَرَكَ بِالْبَاطِلِ لَمْ أُجِزْهُ ثُمَّ أَشْهَدَ عَلَيَّ اِبْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى إِنْ أَنَا حَرَّكْتُهُ فَأَنَا لَهُ ضَامِنٌ فَدَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بَعْدُ فَاقْتَصَصْتُ عَلَيْهِ قِصَّتِي ثُمَّ قُلْتُ لَهُ مَا تَرَى فَقَالَ "أَمَّا قَوْلُ اِبْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى فَلاَ أَسْتَطِيعُ رَدَّهُ وَ أَمَّا فِيمَا بَيْنَكَ وَ بَيْنَ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْكَ ضَمَانٌ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5539 - Ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Abdur Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj from Khalid Al-Taweel, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
My father called me when death approached him and said:
"O' my son, take charge of your younger brothers' wealth, invest it, take half of the profit for yourself, and give them the other half. You are not liable for any loss."
After my father's death, my father's concubine brought me before Ibn Abi Layla and said:
"This man is consuming the wealth of my children."
I explained to him what my father had instructed me to do.
Ibn Abi Layla said: "If your father commanded you with something invalid, I will not permit it." Then he had me testify that if I used the wealth, I would be liable for it.
Later, I went to Abu Abdullah (as), and narrated my story to him.
I then asked: "What do you say about this matter?"
Imam (as) said: "As for the ruling of Ibn Abi Layla, I cannot overturn it. But as for what is between you and Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, you are not liable."

chapter: Chapter on the Acknowledgment of Debt by a Sick Person in Favor of an Heir
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5540 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Hisham ibn Salim from Isma'il ibn Jabir, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a man who, while ill and in debt, acknowledged a right for one of his heirs.
Imam (as) said: "It is permissible if what he acknowledged is less than one-third (of his wealth)."
arabicText: 5540 - رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ جَابِرٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَقَرَّ لِوَارِثٍ لَهُ وَ هُوَ مَرِيضٌ بِدَيْنٍ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالَ "يَجُوزُ إِذَا كَانَ اَلَّذِي أَقَرَّ بِهِ دُونَ اَلثُّلُثِ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5540 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Hisham ibn Salim from Isma'il ibn Jabir, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a man who, while ill and in debt, acknowledged a right for one of his heirs.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "It is permissible if what he acknowledged is less than one-third (of his wealth)."

chapter: Chapter on the Acknowledgment of Debt by a Sick Person in Favor of an Heir
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5541 - Hammad narrated from Al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
'I asked Imam (as) about a man who acknowledges a debt to one of his heirs.'
Imam (as) said: "It is permissible if he is solvent (financially capable)."
arabicText: 5541 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادٌ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لَهُ اَلرَّجُلُ يُقِرُّ لِوَارِثٍ بِدَيْنٍ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالَ "يَجُوزُ إِذَا كَانَ مَلِيّاً".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5541 - Hammad narrated from Al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
'I asked Imam (as) about a man who acknowledges a debt to one of his heirs.'
Imam (as) said: "It is permissible if he is solvent (financially capable)."

chapter: Chapter on the Acknowledgment of Debt by a Sick Person in Favor of an Heir
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5542 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Mansur ibn Hazim, who said:
'I asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a man who, in his will, acknowledged a debt to one of his heirs.'
Imam (as) said: "If the deceased was in a sound state of health, then give him what was bequeathed to him."
arabicText: 5542 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ حَازِمٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى لِبَعْضِ وَرَثَتِهِ بِأَنَّ لَهُ عَلَيْهِ دَيْناً فَقَالَ "إِنْ كَانَ اَلْمَيِّتُ مَرْضِيّاً فَأَعْطِهِ اَلَّذِي أَوْصَى لَهُ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.5542 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Mansur ibn Hazim, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
'I asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a man who, in his will, acknowledged a debt to one of his heirs.'
Imam (as) said: "If the deceased was in a sound state of health, then give him what was bequeathed to him."

chapter: Chapter on the Acknowledgment of Debt by a Sick Person in Favor of an Heir
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.5543 - Ali ibn Al-Nu'man narrated from Ibn Muskan from Al-'Alaa, the seller of sabiri (a type of cloth), who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as), about a woman who entrusted a man with some wealth. When death approached her, she said to him, "The wealth I gave you belongs to so-and-so," and then the woman passed away.
Her heirs came to the man and said: "Our relative had wealth, and we believe it is with you. Swear to us that you have nothing of hers." Should he swear to them?
Imam (as) said: "If she was trustworthy in his view, then he should swear. But if she was suspect, then he should not swear and should leave the matter as it is. Indeed, she only has a right to one-third of her wealth."
